loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Mujeres Alegres está compuesto por señoras que buscan el progreso y bienestar dentro del hogar, todas ellas tienen actividades diferentes es por ello que acuden al grupo para así poder ir mejorando la calidad de vida y bienestar de la familia. 
Se destaca la labor de la Señora Nidia quien es una de las mujeres que siempre busca el bienestar de su familia. Ella se dedica el macate (venta ambulante) de ropas artículos de bazar que vende los fines de semana, es para eso que ella pidió este préstamo para poder comprar invertir en la compra de jeans, remeras, pantalones y demás, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Alegres (Happy Women) consists of women who seek progress and well-being within their households. They all have different business activities. This is why they turn to the group, to be able to continue improving their quality of life and the well-being of their families.

The work of Señora Nidia stands out. She is one of the women who always seeks the well-being of her family. She works as a street vendor, selling articles of clothing and household  items, which she sells on weekends. It is for this reason that she is requesting this loan, to be able to invest in the purchase of jeans, T shirts, pants, and other items, so that in this way she can continue with her sales and striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T shirts, pants, and other items to sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en un centro de compra de esta ciudad   en el área de limpieza. Realiza su trabajo día a día con mucha dedicación ya que esta es la fuente que genera ingresos para su familia  ya que la familia es la parte más importante para el señor José y es por esta razón  que solicito un crédito a kiva para la compra de zinc  para hacerle el cambio al techo de su vivienda ya que la única manera de hacer  las mejoras a su humilde vivienda.  es con un crédito que le pueda otorgar ceprodel.
texts.en: José Antonio lives in the city of Managua and works cleaning a shopping center in this city. He does his work day after day with a lot of dedication, as it is his family's source of income. José's family is the most important thing to him, and this is why he asked for a loan from Kiva to buy zinc to replace the roof of his home; the only way to make improvements to his small home is with a loan that CEPRODEL can grant to him.

loans.use: to buy zinc construction materials

loans.name: Shohidakhon

texts.ru: Шохидахон добросовестная и трудолюбивая сельская женщина из района Кубадиён. Ей 33 года. Она живет вместе с мужем, двумя детьми, свекровью и свекром. Ее муж зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги мастера строителя. Шохидахон сама занимается растениеводством. Вот уже три года как она на небольшом участке земли выращивает овощи и пшеницу. Сейчас Шохидахон активно готовится к весеннему посеву и просит кредит для купли семян картофеля, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Shohidakhon is an honest and hardworking country woman from the Qubadiyon District. She is 33 years old. She lives with her husband, two children, mother-in-law and father-in-law. Her husband earns a living offering his services as an expert builder. Shohidakhon pratices crop farming.  She has been growing vegetables and wheat on a small plot of land for three years. Now Shohidakhon is actively preparing for the Spring sowing season and is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel to carry out sowing in the Spring.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 54-year-old widowed woman from the village of Ateni. She lives alone and has a small income from an agricultural activity. In particular, she cultivates a plot of land where she grows apples and cherries, and sells them seasonally at the local market. She has great desire to start an activity that will be more stable, and not depend only on seasonal income. 

Nana requested a loan of 600 GEL, and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which enables rural people to start or re-start businesses. With the requested money, she plans to purchase a stock of clothing and will start a trading business. She will sell them among her villagers, and will give a chance for her customers to pay later for their purchases. 

This will help Nana to get more orders and profit. She has enough motivation to lead this business in a lucrative way. Nana awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 30 years old, a married woman, and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband who is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services using a van. He has been driving the van for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts.

loans.name: Noora

texts.en:
Noora is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to appear in the photo instead. Noora was born in 1973. She is a divorced woman living in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Her son Ashraf, who appears in the photo, is a 20-year-old single guy who is a university student majoring in History. 

Noora is applying for this loan to support her son in his studies and pay his semester fees, to give him the opportunity to work in his study field after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Maria está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona bien rural, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Emigdia es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas al por menor de víveres entre otras opciones.  Ella surte a la mayoría de las personas de su barrio y es por eso que le va muy bien, es una persona muy sacrificada que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, bebidas, arroz, poroto y demás, y de esa forma seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Santa María" group is on its first cycle with the women's committee programme. The "Santa María" group is in the city of Concepción, in an area a little far from the central area of Paraguay. The area is still in development and to be found in a rural area. As a result the group's members want to fight to continue growing and to improve their area and to grow slowly.

Emigdia is one member of the group. She is from an area far from the city centre and it is there that she has a small business selling supplies and other items. She sells to most of the people in her barrio and so her business is going very well. Emigdia is very dedicated and, with sacrifices, she is getting ahead.

Emigdia is applying for this loan in order to buy staple supplies, such as sugar, drinks, rice, beans and more. She can then continue growing and improving her living conditions while helping her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, drinks, beans and more to sell.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel is 30 years old, and a mother of two children ages one and four. Her family lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been farming rice since she had her family. This has been their source of livelihood. She works hard so her children can have a better future. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm, hollow blocks for house renovation, and groceries. The extra income that she can get from her business will be used for her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm, hollow blocks, and groceries.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 54-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 30 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea to sell, and keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. 

She describes her family challenge to be lack of proper sanitation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cement, sand, and other materials to build a toilet. This will benefit four family members. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and other materials to build a toilet.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in a business selling cloths for many years.  She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Bushra expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, candle, biscuits, and rice for her business,

loans.name: Gustavo Humberto

texts.es: El señor Gustavo, labora como Albañil desde hace mas de 10 años, su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el credito lo necesita para comprar bloques, arena, cemento, ya que dia a dia el invierte en su vivienda, muy agradecido con el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le ha brindado.
texts.en: Gustavo works as a bricklayer. He has done this for more than 10 years. His biggest dream is to be be able to improve his living conditions. He needs the loan to buy blocks, sand, and cement. Day to day, he invests in his home, and he is very grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for the support they have offered

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña María quien ahora se dedica a comercializar frutas y verduras con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como carretonero, de esta manera ambos se ayudan para  costear sus necesidades principales,  María ha venido haciendo mejoras en su vivienda con el apoyo de crédito, en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para  comprar cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de su vivienda, ella espera continuar hasta ver su sueño realidad de tener una casita en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Doña Maria now sells fruits and vegetables with the help of her husband, who works as a cart driver. In this way they both assist in paying for their principal needs. Maria has been making improvements in their home with the help of loans. At this time, she is applying for the loan to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of their home. She hopes to continue until she sees her dream of having her little house in good condition become a reality.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Yerald Augusto

texts.es: Yerald empresario de mucho éxito emprendedor tiene 34 años de edad, casado con un hijo de manutención, su negocio es un taller de calzado los cuales los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad, tiene 20 años de tenerlo, cuenta con tres trabajadores y solicita el crédito para compra de materia prima como cuero, suela, pega blanca, pega amarilla, hilo, forro, adornos, etc.
texts.en: Yerald is a very successful businessman. He is 34 years old, married and has one son he is supporting. His business is a shoe workshop. He sells his shoes in his town market. He has had this business for 20 years and has three workers. He is asking for the loan to buy raw materials such as leather, soles, white glue, yellow glue, thread, trim, etc.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials such as leather, soles, white glue, yellow glue, thread, lining, trim, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 48 años de edad, casada, es una mujer emprendedora, exitosa, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y una mini pulpería en su domicilio  desde hace 3 años consecutivos  ella misma atiende su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, shores, ropa de niño, etc.
texts.en: Elvira is 48 years old. She is married and an enterprising, successful woman. Her business is selling used clothes and running a mini-convenience store out of her house. She has been running her house for 3 consecutive years. She runs her business herself. She will invest the loan in buying used clothing   such as men's pants, women's pants, men's shirts, shorts, children's clothing, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying used clothing such as men's pants, women's pants, men's shirts, e shorts, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Hugo Miguel

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la cálida y alegre ciudad de Chincha. Hugo desde muy joven es muy trabajador, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tenía la necesidad de apoyarlos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.
Día a día Hugo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno y cerdos, cada mañana el se levanta muy temprano ´para poder darles los alimentos a sus animales y limpiar el espacio donde los cría, es por ello que él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y sobre todo le gusta lo que hace.

Hugo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la tercera vez que le brindan su apoyo y gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar animales como vacas, cerdos, corderos, entre otros, así como también comprar alimentos balaceados, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir la casa de sus padres de material noble ya que actualmente viven en una vivienda de adobe”.
texts.en:
Hugo is 38 years old and lives in the warm, happy city of Chincha.  Hugo has been a hard worker since he was young, since his parents had few financial resources and he had to help them.  Because of this he was only able to study to fifth grade but he would have liked to attend university.

He works daily in his business of buying and selling cattle and pigs.  Every morning he gets up very early to feed his animals and clean their areas.  He believes that things are going well for his business because of the dedication he puts in and above all because he enjoys it.

Hugo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and this is the third time they have supported him, and thanks to their help he will be able to buy animals such as cattle, pigs, lambs, and others.  He will also buy feed.  In this way he will be able to continue striving to make his grand dream a reality, “Build his parents’ house out of solid materials because they currently live in an adobe house.”

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.en:
Ebtisam is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to appear in the photo instead. 

Ebtisam was born in 1969. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her six sons and daughters and her husband, who is working as a driving instructor.  

Her son Amer (who appears in the photo) is a 20-year-old single guy and a university student majoring in tourism and hotels. 

Ebtisam is applying for this loan to support her son in his studies and pay his semester fees to give him the opportunity to work in his study field after graduation.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven estudiante de tercer semestre del programa técnico laboral Auxiliar Administrativo en Salud, el cual se encuentra realizando en la institución educativa CAMPO ALTO.  
Ella actualmente se encuentra realizando la etapa productiva por lo cual debió renunciar a el antiguo trabajo en el cual devengaba mayores ingresos económicos, todo esto lo hizo con el fin de poder cumplir con esta etapa del proceso de formación. 
Adicional mente a esto ella es madre de un pequeño niño por el cual debe responder con todos los gastos, ya que por motivos ajenos el padre del menor no ha respondido por el menor y siempre ha sido ella quien ha debido sacarlo adelante. 
Rosa es una joven la cual desde la niñez ha tenido que lidiar con diferentes situaciones que han sido dolorosas y difíciles para la vida y esto se ve reflejado en la personalidad callada y solitaria. 
A pesar de las adversidades ella ha sabido aprovechar las pocas oportunidades que se le  han presentado y les ha sacado el máximo provecho, porque a pesar de todo ella siempre se ha trazado metas muy claras y hoy en día mucho más, porque sabe que de lo que haga hoy en día dependerá el futuro de ella  y el del pequeño niño a quien solo espera poder brindarle lo mejor y no tenga que pasar por las necesidades que ella padeció de pequeña, por esto sabe  que la mejor manera de garantizarle esto al bebe es capacitándose para así poder tener más y mejores oportunidades laborales y crecer ella misma como persona.  
Ella espera poder contar con el apoyo ofrecido por kiva y así poder llevar a feliz término la formación académica, para cómo se mencionó anteriormente seguir creciendo en todos los ámbitos de la vida. 
De antemano ella esta inmensamente agradecida con este gran apoyo que kiva  le ofrece a todos y cada uno de los jóvenes que como ella luchan cada día por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young student in her third semester of a health technical management program, which she is completing at a higher learning institution.

She had to give up her previous job so she would be able to complete this stage in her life.

She is also the mother of a young boy whom she must support because his father has not helped and she has had to get her son ahead.

Rosa is a young lady who has had to face painful situations since she was little, and she is shy and quiet.  Despite these adversities, she has been able to take advantage of the few opportunities that have presented themselves and they have been very beneficial because despite everything she has made clear goals and now, more than ever because, she knows that her future and that of her young son depends on what she does.  She only wants to provide the best for him so that he will not have to suffer as she did when she was little.  She knows that the best way to provide for her baby is to train to be able to have better work opportunities and grow as a person.

She hopes to receive support from Kiva and be able to finish her education so she can continue to grow, as mentioned earlier, in all areas of her life.  She is immensely grateful for the support that Kiva is providing her and all the other young people who strive to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 38 years old and married.  She has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for many years. 

She has one buffalo and two cows in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the animals and performs the task of collecting milk from them on daily basis. Then people of her community come to her to buy milk according to their demand. By this time she has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

Currently she has applied a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es:
Bayardo Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una empresa del estado desde hace 5 años 
Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en su trabajo y con su familia.
Don Bayardo está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en  gastos escolares como pago de matrículas ,compra de cuadernos , y uniforme para su hijo que está por iniciar el año escolar ya que para el lo más importante es darle estudio  a su hijo para  prepararlo profesionalmente en el futuro
texts.en: Bayardo Antonio lives in the city of Managua. he has worked in a state business for 5 years. He is described as being a responsible person in his work and with his family. Don Bayardo is asking for a loan to invest in school expenses such as registration costs, notebooks, and a uniform for his son who is about to start the school year. For him, the most important thing is to give his son an education to prepare him professionally for the future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Concepcion

texts.es: Rosa es comerciante de carne de res y su esposo guarda de seguridad, ambos no tienen hijos aun, se están  preparando en mejorar su economía y así formar su familia. Rosa requiere de este crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando variedades de carne y pollo, producto del que carece actualmente para ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en: Rosa sells beef and her husband works as a security guard.  They don’t have any children and are trying to improve their finances before starting a family.  Rosa needs this loan so she can invest in her business buy buying beef and poultry to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beef and poultry.

loans.name: Max Huber

texts.es:
El señor Max Huber vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una universidad de Managua como conductor.
Don Max está solicitando un crédito para invertirlos en los gastos universitarios de su hijo que está por culminar su carrera universitaria.
Y agradece el apoyo que kiva y ceprodel con su financiamiento para preparar  a su hijo profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Max Huber lives in Managua and works as a driver at the University of Managua.

Max is asking for this loan to pay tuition for his son who is attending university.  He is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for helping to prepare his son professionally.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres  Del Rescate Group

texts.es: Grupo formado  por tres socios emprendedores de éxito una de ellas es Gloria mujer de 21 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos a cargo, desde hace dos años se dedica a vender ropa nueva y usada, ella misma atiende su negocio vende sus productos al crédito y por encargo, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de damas, camisas de varón, blusas, etc. Margarita tiene 48 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo o de temporada, Carlos tiene 60 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs, including 21 year old Gloria.  She is married, has two children and has been selling new and used clothing for two years on credit and to order.  She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing such as ladies’ pants, shirts, blouses, men’s shirts, etc.  Margarita is 48 years old and her business consists of buying and selling tamarind or seasonal fruits.  Carlos is 60 years old and he sells fruit.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: La Diferencia Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras, María es una de ella, tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda con tres hijos que dependen de ella, desde hace cinco años se dedica a vender pan y zapatos de manera ambulante en su vecindario y barrios aledaños a su domicilio, ella misma atiende su negocio, con sus utilidades ha sacado adelante a su familia, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pan simple, polvorón, punto rojo, etc. Julia tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es de un taller de tapicerías de muebles, camas y colchones, Lidia tiene 48 años de edad su negocio es la venta de calzado.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurial women.  Maria is 46 years old and a widow with three children who depend on her.  For the past five years she has been selling bread and shoes on foot in her neighborhood and those adjacent.  She tends to her business herself and has gotten her family ahead this way.  She will use the money from this loan to buy bread and other things.  Julia is 57 years old and she has a furniture, bed, and mattress upholstery shop.  Lidia is 48 years old and sells shoes.

loans.use: to buy bread, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Es una mujer humanitaria, tiene 36 años de edad, con 8 años de experiencia en la docencia, casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad que se encuentra estudiando la primaria y dos pequeños gemelitos de un año. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal. Hija mayor de 8 hermanos, con el objetivo de apoyar en la restauración de la vivienda de su mama, que vive en Waspam, debido a que en mayo del año 2013 se le quemo su humilde casita de madera. Su sueño es continuar apoyando a su familia, construirle a su mama la vivienda de concreto y la de ella también.
texts.en: This is a caring woman who is 36 years old and has 8 years of experience working as a teacher.  She is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are minors who attend elementary school.  The other children are 1 year-old baby twins.  Her husband works informally.  She is the eldest daughter in a family of 8 children, and her goal is to support the restoration of her mother's house.  Her mother lives in Waspam, and in May 2013, her humble wooden house burned down.  This borrower's dream is to continue to support her family by building a concrete house for her mother, and also one for herself.

loans.use: to help rebuild her mother's house

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Ani Kayaran village, Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two grown up sons ages 27 and 19-years-old. Anahit and her family keep cows, piglets, chickens and cultivate wheat. 
Anahit's elder son and husband own a truck  which they use for transporting the harvest to the market. The whole family works hard to gather income and sustain their living. 
Anahit has applied for this loan to enable her to enlarge her farm. She plans to purchase 6 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will greatly assist Anahit to enlarge her farm. 
Anahit has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anahit has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 6 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jean Poll

texts.es:
Jean vive en la ciudad de Ica, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir a adelante, es por ello que trabaja como animador y también realiza varios eventuales con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para poder salir adelante.

Jean está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar electrodomésticos para su domicilio y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Jean lives in Ica and is a young man with a desire to get ahead, so he works as an animator and works several events that provide his extra money to get ahead.

Jean is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help he will be able to buy household appliances for his home and improve his family’s quality of life and achieve his greatest dream, “Improve his quality of life.”

loans.use: to buy appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Kumman

texts.en: Kumman is a 53-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and five children. One of her children is shown in the photo. For about 20 years she has made hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 40000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Kumman dreams for her children a bright future. It’s her 3rd loan cycle and she is very much thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo José  trabaja como vigilante  en una empresa de la capital vive en un barrio de la capital  casado con dos hijos que están en edad escolar. 
Don Ricardo está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un terreno para hacerle un vivienda digna para su familia  ya que al comprar ese  terreno sería un patrimonio para sus hijos.
Ala vez nos expresa  su agradecimiento por el financiamiento que kiva le otorgue para poder hacer  realidad su  sueño.
texts.en:
Ricardo José works as a security guard for a company in the capital city.  He lives in a capital neighborhood, is married and has two school aged children.

Ricardo is asking for this loan to buy land on which to build a house for his family and so it can be passed onto his children.

He sent us his gratitude for the loan that Kiva has provided to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy land,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to buy more grocery products for their store to resell

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en: Rafiqan is a 47 year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She has a small business of animal selling. She has been doing this business for the last many years. She buys kids (baby buffalo) at a lower price and brings them up. Then she sells them at a higher price. She wanted to increase her income. For this purpose, she has to buy some more buffalo, so she contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase more kids (baby buffalo). She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan she will definitely expand her business and income level. It’s her 8th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more kids (baby buffalo).

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 35 years old from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children. For ten years now she has been engaged in a Sari-sari store business. She sell canned goods, shampoo, chips, soft drinks and seasoning. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of soft drinks, chips, noodles and canned goods. 

She is hoping that with the loan she will not experience a shortage of items needed by her customers, thus earning better. Her income will be used for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks, chips, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 46 years old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a simple humble house in the city. For the past six years Ahmad has operated a small grocery store where he sells regular grocery products like milk, sugar and rice. It is a good business and the only one in his village. 
Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to resell. By taking this loan Ahmad will be able to improve his business and increase the family income. 
Ahmad would like to take a bigger loan in the future to expand his store and insure a decent life for his family.
Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en: Kaniz is a 49-year-old married woman. She is providing the services of cooking from their own home for 20 years with her husband.  She enjoys making food and she became famous in her town for proving these facilities. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then sends it to respective places. She is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of flour, rice and packs of oil, salt and spices etc. at lower rates from the market. In this way she will be able to increase her sales. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her six children’s education and well being.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, rice and packs of oil, salt and spices

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es: Elba es una mujer de éxito, tiene 27 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores y de manutención, desde hace varios años su negocio es  la venta de frutas y ropa nueva en los mercados de su localidad y en las paradas de buses, el crédito lo solicita para fortalecer en inventario compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas, blusas, faldas, shores, etc.
texts.en: Elba is a successful woman. She is 27 years old and married, with two young children in her care. For many years, her business has been the sale of fruit and new clothing in the markets in her area and at bus stops. She is asking for the loan to build her inventory, buying clothing like men's pants, women's pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying new clothing like men's pants, women's pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 54 year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Her daughter has been running beauty parlor business for seven years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing good service she becomes very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she requested Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. With the help of the loan she will not only purchase a variety of products, but will also able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is 20 years old and single, a young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

For the past two years, Adham has had his own business, which is renting chairs and other wedding supplies. It is a good business, but seasonal due to the low demand in the winter. He would like to improve his business and expand it.

Adham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his wedding rental business, like more chairs. By taking this loan, Adham will be able to improve his business and also his income.

Adham appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for his wedding rental business, like more chairs

loans.name: Subhiyah

texts.en:
Subhiyah is a conservative person who prefer not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 
Subhiyah is a 44 year-old married woman from Rafah city, She is a mother of four sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers the family needs. Subhiyah and her husband also have a farm where they plant seasonal crops. it is a good business and helps the family in their expenses
Subhiyah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy fertilizer for their agricultural land. By taking this loan Subhiyah and her husband will be able to improve the land and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to  help her and her husband to buy fertilizer for their agricultural land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, juices and canned goods.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda was born in 1979. She is divorced and lives in a sector in Jordan called southern Ghour. Huda has been supporting herself financially by running her project of selling clothes and accessories for two years. She started it with a small quantity of clothes. Then she added accessories and found it profitable. Now she needs to expand her project by adding cosmetics, perfumes and a new collection of accessories in order to raise her profits. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and a new collection of accessories for her business

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar was born in 1981. He is married, and he lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with his wife. 

Jafar is a retired man who has been running his mini-market for four months. He started his project to be able to cover his children's needs and to improve his living conditions. 

Now he needs to stock his mini-market with new food products and to add new types of them. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to stock his mini-market with new food products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Nkubu area located at the Eastern slopes of Mt.Kenya. She is married and has 3 children and has been been farming for 10 years where her primary income source comes from the sale of milk, eggs, and tea. She enjoys dairy farming the most because it gives her more income. Her greatest challenge is purchasing farm implements, which are very costly.
Grace chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their favorable interest rates on their loans. During training she learned how to develop a savings culture..This loan will enable Grace to purchase animal feed for her livestock, which will improve the production of milk and eggs, thus bringing in more income and enabling her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 41 years old and married. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a business selling crockery for many years.

He offers various types of crockery, such as glasses, bowls, etc., on his bicycle to the people of community and in the local market. He makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Parveen contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000.

In this way he will be able to purchase more varieties of crockery, such as cups, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs. It will increase his sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase more crockery, such as cups, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Nancy Yolanda

texts.es: Es una joven con iniciativa, madre soltera de tres hijos, de los cuales dos se encuentran en edad escolar primaria y un pequeño de 2 años. Es docente primaria en una comunidad del Municipio de Puerto Cabezas desde hace tres años. Desde hace 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres en una pequeña casa de madera, en la cual habitan 8 personas. Con el objetivo de reducir el hacinamiento y vivir de manera segura e independiente con sus hijos, solicita a Pana Pana su tercer financiamiento para construir su vivienda de concreto con un tamaño de 22pies x 38pies, el cual será utilizado para la cancelación de mano de obra y comprar algunos materiales para la construcción tales como: 1,200 bloques, 11 quintales de varillas de hierro, 2 camiones de arena, un camión de arena fina, 25 libras de alambre de amarre. Con los dos financiamientos anteriores que le brindó Pana Pana le permitieron comprar materiales para el techo: 21 láminas de zinc, 300 pies de madera rústica y 300 pies de madera cepillada, 30 libras de clavo, 20 bolsas de cemento. Su sueño es construir las divisiones de los cuartos para sus hijos, cocina.
texts.en:
She is a young woman with initiative and the single mother of three children, two of which are primary school age and a little one who is two years old. She has been a primary school teacher in a community in the Puerto Cabezas Municipality for three years. 

For the last 24 years, she has lived in her parents´ house, a small wooden house in which eight people live. With the aim of reducing the overcrowding and living with her children in a more secure and independent way, she is requesting her third loan from Pana Pana to build her 22 x 38 foot concrete house. The loan will be used to pay for labor and to buy construction materials such as: 1,200 blocks, 11 quintals of iron rods, two truckloads of sand, one truckload of fine sand, and 25 pounds of tie wire. 

With the two prior loans that Pana Pana offered her, she was able to buy materials for the roof, including: 21 sheets of metal roofing, 300 feet of rough wood, 300 feet of planed wood, 30 pounds of nails, and 20 bags of cement. Her dream is to build the room divisions for her children, and the kitchen.

loans.use: to build her 22 x 38 foot cement house

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 22 year-old single young man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a small simple house.  His brother works as a lawyer and this is the only source if income to the family. Amjad is a student in a local university where he studies engineering. He is a very clever student and he would like to take the BA degree and then take a Master degree in the same field. 
Amjad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan  will help him to buy a new latop for his studies. By taking this loan Amjad will be able to do his home work and write the reports easily.
Amjad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Nariman is 30 years old and married, from a small village near Jenin city. She is the mother of eight kids: three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a construction worker, where he earns a low income. His income is barely enough cover all the family needs. 

Nariman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay hospital expenses for an urgent surgery in her stomach. 

By taking this loan, Nariman will be able to pay part of the urgent medical expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses to do urgent surgery in her stomach.

loans.name: Atiocoyo Xiii Group

texts.es:
Hipolito es un agricultor de 45 años de edad del Departamento de La Libertad,el forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Atiocoyo XIII,todos se dedican al cultivo de granos basicos.
Hipolito es padre soltero,realizo sus estudios hasta cuarto grado de primaria, ya que el grupo familiar al cual pertenecia era de escasos recursos economicos y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar en la agricultura desde muy joven para colaborar con la familia,tiene 6 hijos entre las edades de 2 y 20 años de los cuales dos estudian actualmente.
Hipolito tiene 25 años de experiencia en los cultivos de granos basicos,dicha actividad le ha permitido darle sostenimiento a su grupo familiar.
Hipolito requiere el credito para comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden a mantener su actividad economica y asi generar los ingresos necesarios para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y verlos realizados como profesionales, por consiguiente que mejoren su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hipolito is a 45-year-old farmer in the Department of La Libertad. He is part of the loan group called 'Atiocoyo XIII'; all members make a living by cultivating basic grains. Hipolito is a single father. He studied up to the fourth grade of primary school, as the family he belonged to had scarce financial resources and there was a need for him to work in agriculture from a very young age in order to help his family. He has six children between the ages of two and twenty who are currently studying.

Hipolito has 25 years of experience with cultivating basic grains. This business has allowed him to support his family. Hipolito requires the loan to buy agricultural supplies, which help him to maintain his business and thus generate the earnings necessary to keep supporting his children in their studies in order to see them trained as professionals so they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 52 years old and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married, with eight children, ages 7 to 30. Efrena's husband farms rice for his family. 

For six years now, she has sold gasoline and crude oil to the drivers in her community in order to help her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy more so she can earn better. Her income will pay for school fees and food for her family.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business someday and to see her children successful with their lives.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil to sell

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en: Sharifa was born in 1976. She is married and the mother of five, living in an area in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband is a retired man. Sharifa has been raising goats and cows and selling their products for one year in order to support her husband in improving their living conditions. She started her project raising only goats. Then she noticed that cows are more productive. Now she is requesting a loan to buy another cow in order to expand her project and raise her productivity, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy another cow to raise her productivity

loans.name: Mitra Shakti Shg Group

texts.en:
Pramila is a 35-year-old lady who lives with her husband and three children in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha state, India. The lady standing with her hand raised is Pramila. Her children are in school. She is engaged in paddy (rice) cultivation. 

Pramila, along with ten other women from her village, made a self-help group having the name of "Mitra Shakti Shg" to educate each other in their business activities. All the group members are engaged in different activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, flower selling, etc. All group members help and support each other in their personal lives, as well as in their business activities.

Pramila has been doing paddy cultivation for twelve years. She produces paddy and then sells it. Her husband is a farmer, and he also does paddy cultivation and vegetable cultivation. Pramila's husband helps her in her activity, and he also helps her to sell paddy in the market. 

She and her group members have requested a loan amount of 165,000 INR for their business activities. Pramila will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation. All the group members are very happy and excited to take this opportunity, and also they are very thankful to Kiva for this.

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Эту работящую и усердную женщину с района Кубадиён зовут Гулнора. Ей 41 год. Она мать четверых детей, все ее дети старше 18 лет. Гулнора, ее муж и дети все заняты в сельском хозяйстве. Они имеют орошаемый участок земли, на котором каждый год в сезон посевов  выращивают огородные культуры, а также пшеницу для продажи. Они начали эту деятельность как бизнес три года назад. Раньше они выращивали сельхоз культуры только для себя. 
Так как приближается сезон весеннего посева, Гулнора и ее семья начинают приготовления к посеву. Сейчас им необходимо закупить семена картофеля, минеральные удобрения и топливо для трактора. Чтобы осуществить задуманное Гулнора обратилась за кредитом. Этот кредит им очень важен для продолжения деятельности.
texts.en: This hardworking and diligent woman from the Kubad district is called Gulnora. She is 41 and has four children who are all over age 18. Gulnora, her husband, and her children are farmers. They have a plot of irrigated land and plant vegetables and wheat every year. They used to grow crops for personal use but started a farming business three years ago. Gulnora and her family are getting ready for the coming spring planting season. They need to buy seed potatoes, fertilizers and tractor fuel. To carry out this plan, Gulnora has requested a loan. This loan is very important for her family to continue to work.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes, fertilizers and tractor fuel

loans.name: Samabedana Shg Group

texts.en:
Samabedana Self Help Group is made up of nine women from a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in different activities, such as betel leaf cultivation, milk selling, paddy and vegetable cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women having a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses.

One of the group members, Sunita, is the president of this group. The lady standing with her hand raised is Sunita. Sunita is 27 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and three children. She does betel leaf cultivation. She produces betel leaf and sells it at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Sunita in betel leaf selling at the market. Sunita is planning to buy standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, so she can produce more betel leaf and can increase her income.

Sunita, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 135,000 INR to invest in their business activities. Sunita will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation. 

She wants to construct a house for her family. She says, on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation.

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
María es una mujer pujante y activa, a sus 59 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues tiene un criadero de pollos y venta de huevos, aprendió el oficio de sus padres quienes toda la vida realizaron esta actividad, el negocio lo heredó luego de la muerte de sus padres hace 21 años, adicionalmente y, con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos, también se dedica a vender refrescos congelados y crispetas de manera ambulante, por las diferentes calles del centro de la ciudad, así se gana la vida y apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más pollos para cría, engorde y posterior venta, así podrá aprovechar la temporada de madres, en la que su demanda de productos aumenta, logrando mejorar los ingresos.
María sueña con tener un criadero mucha más grande, con mayor número de animales para que le garantice una rentabilidad y le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a thriving and active woman who is 59 years old and works as an independent commercial seller. She has her own chicken hatchery and she sells the eggs laid there. She learned the business from her parents who also worked in agriculture. She inherited the business when her parents passed away 21 years ago. In addiction, with the zeal to earn more money, she also sells frozen drinks and popcorn as a street vender. She goes through the streets in town and she is able to earn a living and also support her husband with household costs. 
The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase more chickens to raise, feed, and later sell. She would like to take advantage of the upcoming season, when demand for her products increases and she is able to earn more money. 
Maria dreams of having a chicken hatchery even bigger than the one she has now, with more animals so that she can stabilize her income and to be able to create better living conditions for her and her husband.

loans.use: purchase more chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 49 years old and is married to Jane who adds additional income. They are blessed with three children who are 18 years old and older. He has been in the pharmaceutical business for four years, earning a monthly income of 70,0000 Kenyan Shillings.

He has applied for a loan which he will use to purchase more stock for his pharmacy. The anticipated profits will be used to educate his children and expand the current business. This is his second loan; he paid the previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in his store

loans.name: Teriano

texts.en:
Teriano is 54 years old and sells beads, ornaments, and traditional shawls. She has been in this business for four years, and it has been profitable. She is married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She plans to use this loan to buy beads and traditional shawls for resale. This will enable her to make more income which she will use to buy more traditional shawls.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hope is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy beads and traditional shawls for resale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 28-year-old single mother of two in Embu. Her children are aged six and two years respectively. She operates a salon business as her primary business and does farming, which supplements her income. She has been running her salon for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 4,000 which she uses to support her family.  

Doroty is applying for her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She is delighted to have been introduced to VisionFund Kenya where she will be able to obtain financial assistance to boost her business. She will use the loan to purchase hair oils, a hair dryer, hair chemicals, and weaves. With the expected profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have several beauty shops and offer her children quality education.

loans.use: to purchase hair oils, a hair dryer, hair chemicals and weaves.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a new client of the institution who has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. He is a 58-year-old man who is married and blessed with five children. He hails from Kicence village, Rwentondo parish, Eastern division, of the Rukungiri municipality.

He is a hardworking man who has been dealing in cattle fattening and trading for so many years. However, in his business, he has been faced with many challenges. These include competition from other traders, prolonged droughts, and price fluctuations.

He dreams of expanding his business and has approached this institution for financial support. With this loan from UGAFODE, he hopes to expand his business and earn more profits. He thanks Kiva lenders for their partnership and is looking forward to maintaining the partnership through loan repayment.

loans.use: to support cattle fattening.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 40-year-old married woman from Dzevera village, of the Gori district. She lives with her son. Other family members have lived abroad for 4 years.

Maka runs a small agricultural activity. She works hard on family-owned agricultural land, where apple and cherry trees are grown. She uses its products for local trading. Maka's only income is from seasonal activity, which is hardly enough to meet all of the basic needs. Her business needs some investment.

She requested a loan for expanding her agricultural business, to start dairy farming, to produce milk products and to sell it locally. Maka will earn a more stable income, will pay all household expenses freely, and will improve her family's living conditions. She relies on the goodwill of lenders and will greatly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es: Este grupo formado por tres emprendedoras una de ellas es Damaris tiene 34 años de edad, acompañada, con tres  hijos menores el cual los mantiene, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frito de cerdo, y ropa nueva, ella misma y sus hijo le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos como carne de cerdo para hacer frito de cerdo, pepena de cerdo, chicharrón, ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, blusas, camisas, etc. Mirian tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Julia tiene 65 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de nacatamales.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising ladies.  Damaris is 34 years old, married, and has three young children she supports.  She has been selling fried pork and new clothing for five years and her son helps her with the business.  She will use the money from this loan to buy items such as pork to make fried pork, pork rinds, clothing such as men’s and women’s pants, blouses, shirts, etc.  Mirian is 54 years old and sells cosmetics.  Julia is 65 years old and makes and sells nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy pork and clothing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and married with four children. She has a food stall where she sells milk and food. She has been in this business for 5 years. Her monthly income from her business is KES 42,000.

Grace will be using the loan to buy milk, rice, maize, beans, and sugar for her business. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay the loan and to save more. This is her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old and is from Nakuru. She is single and is blessed with two children, aged 10 and three years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last eight years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya which will be used to buy maize seeds for planting. 

Her monthly income right now is KES. 10,000, and her plan is to use the anticipated profits realized from her business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be a very successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seeds

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer was born in 1995 and is a football player. He is a single guy who lives with his five siblings and parents in a sector in Jordan, called Irbid.  Samer noticed that his family has been facing a financial crisis during this period. So he decided to run his project selling clothes, home products, and bed sheets at his own store for six months. He is now requesting a youth loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes and bed sheets in order to raise his profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and bed sheets for his business.

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer creativa, dinámica y carismática, a sus 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo.
Con el ánimo de apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, ella buscó alternativas para generar ingresos, pero no quería ser empleada, sino trabajar como independiente; fue en ese momento en el que decidió comenzar con su propio negocio, elaborando artesanías en foamy, arte country y otras técnicas, los productos que crea los vende entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos, así logra generar los recursos suficientes para su familia.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (foamy, country, pinturas, murano), esto le permitirá tener la disponibilidad suficientes para elaborar nuevos diseños que satisfagan los gustos de sus clientes y así mejorar los ingresos.
Fanny manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es montar su propio almacén bien organizado y estructurado, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y acreditarlo para que sea rentable y le brinde la oportunidad de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fanny, age 52, is a creative, dynamic, and charismatic woman. She lives with her husband and her son.

With the aim of supporting her husband with the economic responsibilities of their home, she looked for ways to generate income. However, she didn’t want to be an employee; she wanted to work independently. It was then that she decided to start her own business, making handicrafts with craft foam, country crafting, and other techniques. She sells the products that she creates to her relatives, friends, and neighbors; and this is how she manages to generate enough income for her family. 

She will use the loan that she is requesting for the purchase of basic supplies in bulk, such as craft foam, stencils, paints, and glass beads. This will allow her to have enough available to create new designs that will please her customers, and thus improve her income.

Fanny declares that her biggest desire is to open her own shop, and to organize and arrange it well; this would allow her to generate employment opportunities. She would like to get it firmly established so that it would be profitable, and give her the opportunity to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies in bulk (craft foam, stencils, paint, and glass beads).

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis,  a sus 32 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor y dinámico, con visión para los negocios; esto lo refleja desde hace 5 años que comenzó a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues montó un restaurante en el que trabaja con una empleada, el local está muy bien ubicado en una calle muy transitada del centro de la ciudad y, a pesar que tiene mucha competencia en el sector, él está tranquilo, pues ofrece productos diferentes e innovadores.
Su mayor anhelo es fortalecer y posicionar bien su negocio, para que le garantice una buena rentabilidad y le brinde la capacidad de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar, especialmente a su hijo que está próximo a  nacer.
Todo esto motiva a Luis para solicitar el crédito y con el dinero fortalecer su negocio, comprando insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, granos y otros), así tendrá disponibilidad suficiente para atender la demanda de productos y satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales, aumentando las ventas e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old and is known as an entreprising and dynamic young man with a knack for business. His business savvy can be seen in the work he has done for the past five years after he branched out to be his own boss. He opened a restaurant where he works with another employee. It is well located on a heavily trafficked street in the center of town and, despite all the competition, he is confident in his business because he sells products that are different and innovative. 
His biggest dream is to strengthen and position his business even better so that he is guaranteed profits and to be able to give his family a better quality of life and well-being, especially his son who will soon be born. 
All of this motivates Luis to ask for a loan and, with that money, improve his business, purchasing wholsale stock like vegetables, meat, grains and more. With supplies, he will have more available and be able to meet the demand for his products and to satisfy his customers tastes, while simultaneously increasing sales and income for his family.

loans.use: purchase wholesale stock like vegetables, meat, grains and other items.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan, continua con sus trabajo de cultivo, actualmente esta trabajando con su hijo ya que comercializan frutas, el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como completo, triple, urea, ya que quiere limpiar su cultivo de piña y evitar la expaccion de plagas, Agradece el apoyo que siempre le han brindado.
texts.en: Juan continues working his crops and is currently working with his son.  They sell fruit and he is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as complete fertilizer, triple, and urea because he wants to weed his pineapple crop and prevent plant diseases.  He is grateful for the support given him.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Asociacion Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias, Lidia es una mujer que tiene 43 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos, desde hace 7 años se dedica a vender productos de artesanías, ella inicio vendiendo dulces en ferias en el extranjeros y vendiendo ropa y cosméticos, tiene cinco años de ser cliente de la institución. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de artesanías variadas, artesanías de madera, zapatos, sandalias, marimbas, camisas guayaberas etc. Socorro tiene 56 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de papel y Felipa tiene 55 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three partners.  Lidia is 43 years old, married and has three children.  She has been selling arts and crafts for seven years.  She began by selling candy at the fairs outside the country and also clothing and cosmetics.  She has been a client of the institution for five years.  She will use the money from this loan to buy wooden crafts, shoes, sandals, etc.  Socorro is 56 years old and sells paper goods.  Felipa is 55 years old and sells fruit.

loans.use: to buy arts and crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy her hair removal laser machine and hair dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, iron, and quarry stone

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr: Madame FATOU est une promotrice qui habite dans le quartier ou se trouve le guichet. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des articles de mercerie et vend des tissus, garniture, fil à coudre etc...Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. FATOU sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 150.000F pour renforcer son fond de roulement et satisfaire ses commandes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 4 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir elle souhaite ouvrir d’autres points de vente et offrir d’avantage les services à ses clients. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses produits ;
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou is a banc villageois promoter who lives in the neighborhood where the branch is located. She sells sewing supplies: fabric, trimmings, thread etc. She is married and has children. She helps her husband with everyday household expenses and the children's school fees. Fatou is seeking this loan of 150,000 West African francs in order to bolster her working capital and complete all her customers' orders. She has over four years of experience in this business. She starts her work day at 9 AM and ends at 8 PM. At present she would like to open additional sales points and offer more services to her customers. She would like to diversify her offering and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Maria

texts.es: Doña Blanca es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado comprar más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Gaseosas, Embutidos, Cosméticos entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Blanca is from Esteli and has a general store.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because the loan allowed her to buy more products to offer her customers.  She is asking for a new loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, sausages, cosmetics, and other things.  She believes that this loan will be of great help to her and she will be able to obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
El señor Marvin José  trabaja en una empresa de vigilancia vive en la cuida de Managua. Casado con dos hijos que están en edad escolar. 
Don Marvin  está solicitando un crédito a la fuente de financiamiento de kiva para  pago de colegiatura y compra de útiles escolares como uniforme, cuadernos libros  para sus hijos ya que  en estos momentos su prioridad el que sus hijos asistan a la escuela. Ya que considera que la mejor herencia para sus hijos es darles estudios.
texts.en:
Marvin José works for a security company in Managua.  He is married and has two school aged children.

Marvin is asking for a Kiva loan to pay tuition and to buy school supplies like uniforms, notebooks, and books for his children since his priority is for his children to go to school.  He believes that the best legacy he can give his children is to provide them with an education.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Las Cuatro Rosas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias, Sonia mujer casada, con tres hijos menores, de 55 años de edad empresaria exitosa, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortilla y nacatamales en su domicilio y atraves de su negocio a sacado adelante a su familia, tiene de ser cliente 6 años consecutivos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como quintal de maíz, leña, cal, carne de cerdo, perecedero, hoja de chagüites, mecate, tocino, etc. Estela mujer de 49 años de edad su negocio es la de una mini pulpería en su domicilio y Manuela tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de carne de res hueso.
texts.en: This group is made up of three ladies.  Sonia is 55 years old, married, and has three young children.  She is a successful entrepreneur and has been making and selling tortillas and nacatamales from her home for ten years.  She has been a client for six consecutive years and will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as dried corn, firewood, lime, pork, perishables, rope, bacon, etc.  Estela is 49 and has a mini store in her home.  Manuela is 53 years old and she sells beef.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Roque” está en su 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de los 17 Señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Realizan constantes capacitaciones para seguir unidas y crecer juntos.
Mariana es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella es una persona muy entusiasta que con gran esfuerzo está creciendo y mejorando y por medio de los ingresos que tiene está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos variados para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma luchar por ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “San Roque” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have committed to work and help one another so that they can get ahead. They have taken a poverty elimination survey, which indicated that three of the 17 women are below the poverty line. They receive constant training so that they can press forward together and grow as a group.

Mariana is one of the members who sells cosmetics. She is a very enthusiastic person who is striving to grow and improve. With the income she earns, she is able move forward. Mariana is requesting a loan in order to buy various cosmetics so that she can continue her sales. This will allow her to improve her living conditions. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una pequeña bodega donde ofrece la venta de cerveza desde hace 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 69 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Morropon. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in the region of Piura, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Sebastián has a small store where he has been selling beer for 10 years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN so that he can buy a large quantity of beer that he can offer to his customers. This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre emprendedor su negocio es la de un vivero de plantas ornaméntales de toda variedad, estilo y especies además comercializa ropa nueva, tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio tiene 15 años de operación, tiene dos hijos adultos quienes trabajan con él y le ayudan en el negocio, de ser cliente de la institución tiene cinco años consecutivos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de plantas ornaméntales variadas, rosas rojas, rosas blancas, etc. ropa de varón como pantalón de dama, pantalón de varón, camisas de varón, blusas de damas, shores, etc.
texts.en:
Carlos is an enterprising gentleman. His business is a nursery where he offers all types of ornamental plants. He also sells new clothes. Carlos is 57 years old and has been in business for 15 years. He has two adult children who work with him and help with the business. Carlos has been a client of ADIM for five consecutive years.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of various ornamental plants, red roses, white roses, and other products. He will also buy women’s trousers, men’s trousers, women’s blouses, shorts, and other types of garments.

loans.use: to buy ornamental plants, red roses, white roses, and other products, as well as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Quinto Piso Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ella es Ana mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera con un hijo, desde hace un año se dedica a tener una pulpería en su domicilio, anteriormente se dedicaba  a vender ropa nueva ambulante en las comarcas, con las ganancias fue guardando y fue comprando productos para su pulpería este crédito lo invertirá en la compra arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite bidón, papel higiénico, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, medicamentos populares etc. Ana Julia tiene 34 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Blanca tiene 36 años de edad y su negocio es de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising partners.  Ana is 35 years old, single, and has a son.  She has had a store in her home for a year.  She used to sell new clothing on foot and she began saving up and buying items for her store.  She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bathroom tissue, beef, chicken, dairy, popular medicine, etc.  Ana Julia is 34 years old and sells new clothing.  Blanca is 36 years old and has a general store in her home.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 47-year-old man who is married and a father to five children. He has been operating a retail shop in Nakuru for the last five years where he has been earning a monthly income of about 20,000 KES.

Harrison was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by our credit officer and now he has been loaned 80,000 KES which serves as his third loan from the organization. Harrison will use the loan to purchase additional stock for his general store so as to be able to earn more from sales. He intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating his children, while also trying to expand his business. 

In the future, Harrison wishes to further expand his business so he is able to increase his earnings and better the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his general store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 36 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with four children. She is a farmer in Kangundo town where she grows maize for selling and also keeps livestock. Right now, her monthly income from her business is 25,000 KES. Her spouse does provide additional income.

She will be using this loan to buy farm inputs like manure, fertilizer and cattle feed. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay off her loan and save more.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. Her dreams and hopes in the future are to build a modern house and educate her children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure, fertilizer and cattle feed.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a 32-year-old man who has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. He is married and blessed with five children.Pictured is Edson with his wife in their retail shop.

Edson is a hard working and honest man, and has a retail shop located in a trading centre in the area near his homestead which is his source of income. However, his challenge has been limited capital and he has approached UGAFODE for financial support to increase the volume of his purchases so that he can save on transport costs and also increase his profits. His dream is to expand his business to a greater volume so as to increase his profit margin. This will reduce his vulnerability and dependence on loans, and he will eventually become self-sustained. Edson therefore appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva for the financial support they have rendered to him.
