loans.use: to buy stocks of general use items for sale in his retail shop.

loans.name: Lukuma Shg Group

texts.en:
Gorimanimali is a 53-year-old lady who lives with her husband and her 24-year-old son in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Gorimanimali. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. 

Some years ago, Gorimanimali formed a group with seven other women from her village with the group name of "Lukuma Shg". All the group members are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc to alleviate their poverty. Gorimanimali is the President of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives.

Gorimanimali, along with her group, requested a loan of 80,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 41 years old and from Nakuru. She is widowed and blessed with six children aged 15, 12, 10, nine, seven and two years old. She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last 20 years. She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya which will be used to hire laborers to till her land in preparation for the next planting season, and to buy planting seeds.

Her monthly income right now is 10,000 KES, and her plan is to use the anticipated profits realized from her business to educate her children and to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Zipporah hopes to be a very successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: to hire laborers to till her land for the next planting season, and to buy planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: El Chance Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendoras dinámicas una de ellas es Sonia mujer de 24 años, acompañada, con dos hijos menores de edad, desde hace tres años se dedica a vender cosméticos de la Selsa, ropa nueva anteriormente  trabajaba como doméstica, de ser cliente de la  institución tiene 6 meses, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de dama, shores, blusas etc. Jazmina tiene 46 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de refrescos naturales, helados, hielo, helados etc. y Francisca tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pozol, tistes, semilla de jícaro, etc.
texts.en: This group is made up of three dynamic women entrepreneurs.  Sonia is 24 years old, married, and has two minor children.  She has been selling Selsa brand cosmetics and new clothing for three years; she used to provide domestic help.  She has been a client of the institution for six months and will use the money from this loan to buy clothing such as men’s and women’s pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc.  Jazmina is 46 years old and she sells natural soft drinks, ice cream, ice, etc.  Francisca is 51 years old and sells boiled barley and bean soup, tiste, gourd seed, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras exitosas una de ellas es Elsa mujer de 28 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos menores, desde hace varios años vende ropa, y refrescos naturales, inicio vendiendo trastes de plásticos, ella misma atiende el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, blusas etc. Martha tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de platanitos y María tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, y productos Arabela.
texts.en: This group is made up of six successful entrepreneurs.  Elsa is 28 years old, married and has two minor children.  She has been selling clothing and natural soft drinks for several years and started out by selling plastic dishes.  She tends to the business herself and will use the money from this loan to buy clothing such as men’s and women’s pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc.  Martha is 30 years old and sells bananas.  Maria is 35 years old and sells Avon cosmetics and Arablela brand products.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maa Bastaren Group

texts.en:
Muribahal village in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India is a remotely located rural village. It is also the Community Development Block Headquarters, which is in one of the poorest region of the state. In this village, there is the separate hamlet of Mahar community. The main source of livelihood of this community is the weaving of bamboo baskets. In December 2013, after the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation, 13 poor women came out and formed a Self Help group named Maa Bastaren to take a loan for the development of their traditional businesses to lead a better life. Kalindi is one of the members of this group. She is 39 and resides with her husband, two sons and two daughters. She is sitting with her hand raised wearing a white sari in the photo. She is an active and straightforward woman. All members of this group belong to a very poor backdrop that is far away from all basic needs like education, shelter, health facilities etc.  

Kalindi's business (weaving bamboo baskets) is the traditional business of their community. Kalindi and her husband together do the processing work and weave baskets of different shape and size. They sell their products in the nearest weekly market of the town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Kalindi earns a monthly profit of Rs 3,000 from her business. As there is a growing demand for these products to supply to various parts of the country, Kalindi wants to purchase more raw bamboo with this loan to work for a longer period without any interruption for more output. This will help her to earn some extra income to manage the family smoothly. Kalindi hopes to construct a house in the near future.

The other 12 members of the group are doing businesses like a general store, a betel shop, bamboo craft etc.

loans.use: To purchase more raw bamboo

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a single, 29-year-old mother of one in Thika. She runs a general shop and has been in this business for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya after clearing her previous loans successfully. With the loan she has requested, she will be able to purchase 10 bags of sugar and rice for resale in her shop. 

The additional income created will be ploughed back into the business and used to buy food for the family. In the future, Marion would like to offer her child a quality education and improve the living standards of the family. 

She hopes to expand her general shop and have a successful family life.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of sugar and rice

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 36 years old, is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children who are 3, 11 and 13 years old. For 13 years now, she has been farming rice and raising hogs for a living. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed, rice and school supplies for her children. 

Elizabeth dreams of seeing her children become successful individuals by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice and school supplies

loans.name: Marlon Andrés

texts.es:
Marlon Andrés  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa del estado hace su mayor esfuerzodía a día para sacar adelante a su familia.
Marlon está solicitando a ceprodel y kiva un financiamiento para invertirlo en algunas mejoras a su vivienda para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia ya que por su trabaja se ve obligado a dejarlos solos por las noches para cumplir su jornada laboral  y este refinanciamiento le va  servir para asegurar mas su vivienda.
pero también nos manifiesta  que una parte del dinero lo va a ocupar para comprarle útiles escolares y uniformes  a sus hijos ya que  esta por iniciar el año escolar.
texts.en:
Marlon Andrés lives in Managua and works as a security guard for a government company.  He works daily to get his family ahead.

Marlon is asking for a loan through CEPRODEL and Kiva to make some improvements to his home and provide more security to his family, since he must leave them alone at night when he goes to work his shift.  This will help him secure his home more.

He also tells us that he will use part of the money to buy school supplies and uniforms for his children, since the school year is about to begin.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 23-year-old man who has been offering motorcycle services in Nakuru for the last year, earning a monthly income of about KShs 30,000. 

He was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by our credit officer and now he has been loaned KShs 15,000, which serves as his first loan from the organization. Shadrack will use the loan to service and repair his motorcycle to offer better services to his clients. He intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating his two nephews while also trying to expand his business. 

In the future, Shadrack wishes to further expand his business to increase his earnings and better his living standards.

loans.use: To service and repair his motorbike

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 42 years old and runs a grocery store in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for the past two years and it has been profitable. She is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children.

She will be using this loan to buy vegetables, onions and carrots to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Having paid her previous loans successfully, this will be Florah's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to own her own school and have a good business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda hails from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 47 years old and has relied on farming rice for her livelihood for the last six years. She wanted to increase her income so she could earn better. She applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides and pay for labor for tilling the land in preparation for planting season.

She hopes that someday, she can have a bigger farm and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay for labor

loans.name: Santiago Javier

texts.es: Santiago es un hombre exitoso y empresario desde hace tres años. Su edad es de 40 años, acompañado y con tres hijos. Su negocio es de tener un taller de zapatería en su domicilio, el mismo maneja su negocio con un trabajador que le da salario, este crédito lo solicita para compra de materia prima como suela, forros, pega amarilla, pega blanca, charol, fibra, remache, hilo, adornos, cambriño etc.
texts.en: Santiago is a successful man and has been an entrepreneur for three years.  He is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  He has a shoe workshop in his home and he manages the business himself with one employee to whom he pays a salary.  He is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as soles, coverings, yellow glue, white glue, patent leather, fiber, rivet, wire, ornaments, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuiton and buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old, single and blessed with two children aged 16 and 12 years old. She has been operating her entertainment business for the last three years and she has applied for her third loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from VisionFund Kenya so she can buy an extra television and a video player.

Her monthly income right now is 30,000 KES and her plan is to use the profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children, start a cereals business and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. Eunice hopes to be a successful business woman in the future and to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To buy an extra television and video player for her entertainment business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 42 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Mary and they are blessed with three children who are 17, 12 and 10 years old.

He is a tailor, a business he has been running for the last 20 years. To enable him to buy some clothing material and sewing thread for use in making clothes for his customers, he has applied for his third loan of KES 15,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 12,000 and he has plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya and to educate his children.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful tailor and to have the best family.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and sewing thread to use in making clothes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 44 years old, married and a mother of four children. She operates a farm in Nakuru and has been in the business for the last twenty years, now earning a monthly income of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Hellen was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by our credit officer and has received a loan of 20,000 (KES), her first with the organization. She will use the loan to purchase additional farm supplies such as fertilizer and seeds. She also intends to use the profits from the business to continue to support the education of her children and to look after her family. 

In the future, Hellen wishes to further expand her farming activities and practice mixed farming so she can increase her earnings in order to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm supplies

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara lives with her three school-age children in the Shirak region. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Time by time, he supports his family financially. To tackle the financial hardships and to gather income for her family, Lamara runs a farm. She keeps cows, sheep, oxen and chickens. Lamara also cultivates barley but the produce is for family use only.

As a hardworking mother of three children, Lamara feels very responsible for gathering a good income and sustaining her children's living. By applying for this loan, Lamara asks for financial support to purchase two oxen and grass to use as forage for the livestock. This will be a huge support for her farm and Lamara hopes to receive the lender's help.

As this is Lamara's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and grass to use as forage for the livestock

loans.name: Jose Isabel

texts.es:
José Isabel tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad con clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, café, maíz y frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cacao desde hace diez años, cuenta con clientela en su distrito y zonas aledañas, ocasionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como operario de construcción, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de mayor cantidad de cacao para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Isabel is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Pomahuaca. This community experiences a warm climate and is known for agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice, coffee, corn, and fruits. Other businesses in the area involve trade and livestock breeding. The community is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

José Isabel has been selling cacao for 10 years. He has customers in his district and in the surrounding areas. Occasionally, he offers his services as a construction worker. José Isabel is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy a large quantity of cacao that he can offer to his customers. This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy cacao in bulk quantity.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora  Elena tiene 39 años y 5  hijos de las edades de 12, 14, 8, 5 y 2 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona de Copacabana,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su casita y así de esta manera brindar comodidad a su familia, la señora Elena es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena is 39 years old and has five children (ages 12, 14, 8, 5, and 2). She sells food from a vending stall located at her house in the District of Copacabana.

The purpose of this loan is to buy construction materials for building a small house where her family can be comfortable. Sra. Elena is a hardworking individual who has been in business for years. She is very grateful to Emprender for the support she has received. This is the only business by which she is able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to build a home

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. She has a profitable business selling clothes in Kangundo town, and she also has a food stall where she sells potato chips. She supports three people in her family and currently her monthly income from the businesses is 44,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Elizabeth will use her loan to improve her clothing sales business by buying more clothes for resale. In addition, she will buy potatoes and cooking oil for her food stall. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded businesses to open another kind of business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to become more successful.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell and also boosts her food stall business.

loans.name: Heidelyn

texts.en:
Heidelyn is a 33-year-old mother of two children, aged two and six, whose husband works as a labourer. To boost the family income, Heidelyn has been operating a sari-sari store for one year now. This earns her 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy rice, canned foods, toiletries, candies and chips for the store. 
Heidelyn hopes that someday she can continue to improve and expand her business for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned foods, toiletries, candies and chips for her store.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is doing well in his tea-selling business in Nandi County. He has been repaying his previous loan well and is borrowing 30,000 Kenyan shillings to start a new business to boost his income.

He will use this loan to buy a dairy cow. With the remaining amount, he will buy milk for resale and pay for a business permit and licences, among other costs that he may incur.

His hope and dream is to expand both of his businesses to a level at which he will be able to employ people to work for him. He also hopes to meet his family's financial needs.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher has a barber shop in Makueni town that he has been running for the past 10 years. He is 52 years old, married and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with six children. He also has a photo studio. He currently makes a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He will be using this loan to buy more equipment such as shaving machines for his business. He will also buy a photo printer and boost his photo studio business. He will use the anticipated products to expand his business.

This is Christopher's fifth loan term and he has been paying his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to be successful.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines for his barber shop and a photo printer for his photo studio

loans.name: Yeri Fatima

texts.es: La señora Yeri vive en Santa Cruz con su pareja en concubinato desde hace 6 años, comparte la casa con sus suegros, a los cuales les paga un alquiler mensual. La señora es una persona emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración de pan y otros productos de pastelería, prueba de su compromiso con la actividad que realiza y su interés por salir adelante, es que comenzó en la elaboración de pan con un horno pequeño de 2 latones que le regaló su pareja y decidió realizar un curso a nivel técnico de Panadería y Pastelería, de esta forma se fue superando poco a poco. En la actualidad cuenta con 2 hornos de 2 y 6 latones respectivamente que le permiten una producción diaria de 200 panes, 100 empanadas y 1 queque. Para ampliar y mejorar su producción solicita un crédito con el objetivo de comprar una amasadora para la elaboración de pan, de esta forma lograra automatizar el proceso de amasado, ya que actualmente lo realiza de manera manual junto con su esposo, lo cuál conlleva mucho esfuerzo y tiempo,al ser mas eficiente por consiguiente obtendrá mayores ingresos y mejorara la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Yeri lives in Santa Cruz with her common-law partner of six years. They share a house with her in-laws and pay them monthly rent.

Sra. Yeri is an enterprising person who makes bread and other baked goods. As proof of her commitment to this type of work and her interest to get ahead, she began baking bread using a small oven and two baking tins that were given to her by her partner. Yeri decided to complete a technical course in baking and pastry making, and she has gotten better little by little. She currently has two ovens and six baking tins. This enables her to produce 200 units of bread, 100 empanadas, and 1 cake each day.

In order to expand and improve her production, Yeri is requesting a loan so that she can buy a mixer for making bread. This will help automate the kneading process since she and her husband currently do this by hand, which takes a great deal of effort and time. Being more efficient will enable her to generate more income and improve the quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy a mixer for making bread.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena, 46,  is married and the mother of five children, aged five and 28. She has operated a clothes shop for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She learned about Vision Fund from a customer who had already registered. She is borrowing her first loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, which she intends to use to purchase more clothing stock for her business. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.

Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her own residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children who are 16, 13 and 4 years old. She sells vegetables in Kangundo town and has been in this business for 14 years.

She will be using the loan to buy a digital TV decoder (GOTV). She will use the anticipated profits from her business to assist her husband in paying school fees for their children. 

This is her eighth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has been paying her previous loans successfully. Her future hope is to grow and expand in her business.

loans.use: To buy a digital TV decoder (GOTV)

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 38 years old, is from Nakuru. She is married to Joseph and they are blessed with nine children who are 20,18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 1 years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last six years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to buy maize and bean seeds to plant.

Her monthly income right now is KES  6,000 and her plan is to use the anticipated profits realized from her business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be a very successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy some maize and bean seeds

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has three children. She has been doing farming for nine years and her primary income sources come from the sale of milk, eggs, tea and vegetables. She said that what she enjoys most about farming is that the returns are promising. Her biggest challenge is unpredictable rains and drought.

Purity chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help improve the farming activities of small holder farmers. During the training, she learned how to keep records, which has enabled her to keep track of her daily income. With this loan she will purchase water pipes to pull water to the farm from the main water source during dry spells. This will increase production and hence income will increase. Through the income,she will be able to pay her children's school fees and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more candy, cold water, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 25-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Lillian and they have three children aged seven, three and a half and one year old. He sells general goods, a business he has done for the past four years earning an income of KES 8500 monthly.

He is taking his first loan of KES 10,000 with Vision Fund Kenya to use in purchasing more boxes of general goods. He plans to use the profits to improve the lives of his family members.

His dream is to own a mega general store.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like mirrors, combs, wall hangings and picture frames to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, tomatoes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 38-year-old father of a one-year-old baby girl. He lives in Trinidad, Bohol. For four years now, he has been farming rice for an income. Aside from providing for his daughter, he aims to renovate his house too.

He is asking for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy amakan (woven bamboo for walls) and pay for wood sawing. His income from rice farming allows him to dream of a better house for his family. 

In the future, he hopes to be successful in farming, to expand the land that he is cultivating and to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy amakan (woven bamboo for walls) and pay for wood sawing

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 51 years old and widowed with five children. She has a grocery business and a retail shop in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for seven years now and it has been profitable. 

She will be using the loan to expand her grocery business by buying more vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to provide the basic needs of her family.

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Catherine's future hope is to educate her children up to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Jack

texts.en: Jack is a 53-year-old married male with nine children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa garden where he sells cocoa beans to one of the leading agents of ESCO Uganda. He has another source of income from his rentals. He dreams of having many cocoa gardens to yield high produce for selling to earn more profits. However, inadequate capital and price fluctuation at the market limit his expected output. Jack intends to use the loan to complete his house.

loans.use: To complete his residential house

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a family man aged 54, blessed with seven children aged between 18 and 4 years old. Charles and his spouse help each other in raising income for the family through farming activities on their farm. They have been in operation for over a period of 10 years, earning an income of KES 10,000.

Charles is now servicing his seventh term loan of KES 75,000 from Vision Fund Kenya and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for his children. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to excel in life.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 45-year-old from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary and they are blessed with four children who are 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old. 

He has been operating a carpentry shop in Nyahururu for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to purchase additional working materials for his carpentry business.

He intends to use the profits from the business to pay his loan, educate his children and boost his business. In the future, Francis wishes to expand his carpentry shop to accommodate more employees and increase his earnings so that he may improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more timber and other materials.

loans.name: Yolanda Mery

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer pujante y luchadora, madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que afrontó la separación con su esposo.
Con gran esfuerzo, logró iniciar su propio negocio de confección a terceros, aprendió la labor de manera empírica y con el tiempo fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos; esto le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y generar empleo, Yolanda solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una máquina fileteadora, así tendrá la capacidad para cumplir a tiempo con la producción de sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos con su labor; esto la impulsará para cumplir el sueño de tener un taller mucho más grande y acreditado, que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que sea profesionales íntegros y exitosos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a driven and determined woman, mother of two children and head of the household since separating from her husband. With great effort, she managed to start her own tailoring business. She learned this job hands-on and with time, perfected her technique and increased her knowledge; this has allowed her to give her children a good start in life and pay the basic expenses of the household.

With the mind to strengthen her business and generate work, Yolanda is asking for a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine. This will enable her to have the ability to finish orders for her customers on time and get better income for her work; which will propel her towards her dream of having a much bigger and reputable workshop. This will guarantee her the favorable economic stability to offer her children a quality education so they can be successful and upright professionals.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 34 years old, married to Gloria and blessed with three children. He is a matatu operator offering transport facilities to passengers and has been in the business for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 40,000.

With his second loan of KES 100,000, from Vision Fund Kenya, he intends to purchase a new engine for his motor vehicle. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to prosper in life and expand his current business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor vehicle engine

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es:
Arelis, a sus 37 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante y trabajadora, que siempre busca nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante.
Durante su vida productiva trabajó como empleada en varios talleres de confección, donde aprendió y obtuvo experiencia en esta labor, poco a poco fue ahorrando y cuando tuvo el capital suficiente, decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller, allí presta el servicio de confección a terceros, fabricando blusas para dama y camisetas para hombre; genera tres empleos directos y desde que inició su labor independiente logra apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones) y una estantería, esto le permitirá cumplir a tiempo con los encargos de sus clientes y así lograr una fidelización de los mismos, esto dará como resultado un trabajo constante durante todo el año y un aumento en los ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Arelis siempre tiene en mente proyectos cada vez más ambiciosos y para un futuro cercano, planea aprender a realizar los cortes para comenzar a elaborar prendas de su línea propia y ampliar su negocio para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo, lo que mejorará la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como la de sus colaboradores.
texts.en:
Arelis, at 37 years old, is known for being driven and hardworking, always looking for new options which will help her to get on in life.

During her productive work life, she worked as an employee in various sewing workshops, where she learnt and gained experience in this job. Bit by bit she saved and when she had enough capital, she decided to go independent and launch her own workshop where she offers tailoring services, sewing blouses for women and shirts for men. She employs three people directly and since she went independent, she has been able to support her husband with the financial burden of the household.

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale materials (fabric, thread, buttons) and a shelf, this will allow her to complete her customers' orders on time and gain their loyalty, which will come as a result of working all year round and increase the income that she receives from her work.

Arelis always has ambitious projects in mind and for the near future, she plans to learn clothing cuts to start to make her own clothing line and increase her business to make new work opportunities, which will improve the quality of life of her family, as much as that of her coworkers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale materials (cloth, thread, buttons) and a shelf.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima con la ayuda de sus padres ha podido salir adelante y estudiar, ellos han sido su principal apoyo y sostén.
Está estudiando la carrera de odontología, ya que siempre quiso poder ayudar a las personas en algo tan importante como es la salud bucal, y es por ello que hoy se está esforzando bastante.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más de su sueño de ser una odontologa.
texts.en:
Fatima with the help of her parents has been able to get on in life and to study, they have always been her main backing and support.

She is studying dentistry, as she always wanted to help people with something as important as oral health, and this is why she is now making considerable efforts.

She is asking for a loan to cover her fees, as this will enable her to continue studying and to get ever closer to her dream of being a dentist.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Jesus Vivant De Petitanse Group

texts.fr:
Dieula est la coordinatrice de son groupe Jesus Vivant de Petitanse. Elle habite dans la région de Petitanse dans Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de produits divers pendant les 8 dernières années. Elle est veuve et elle a 2 enfants. 

Dieula voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits divers comme cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussure, produits alimentaires et du charbon. Elle espère qu'avec ce prêt peut faire croître votre entreprise.
texts.en:
Dieula is the coordinator for the 'Jesus Vivant de Petitanse' group.  She lives in the Petitanse area of Trou-du-Nord in Haïti, where electricity is rare and water is very scarce.  She is a widow, and has two children.

Dieula has been selling various products for eight years.  She will use her loan to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc for resale.  The other group members will use their loans to buy various products such as cosmetics, clothes, shoes, food products and charcoal.

Dieula hopes to be able to use this loan to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc for resale.

loans.name: Lamentation De Philibert Group

texts.fr:
Modelline est la coordinatrice de son groupe Lamentation de Philibert. Elle habite dans la région de Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de restaurant pendant les 7 dernières années. Elle a 3 enfants. 

Modeline voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le Restaurant, elle a acheter des alimentaires pour votre restaurant. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussureset du charbon. Modeline dit que son défi principal est en mesure de vendre plus depuis la crise économique en Haïti ne reçoit pas beaucoup d'argent.
texts.en:
Modeline is the coordinator of the Lamentation de Philibert group. She lives in the Trou-du-Nord region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She has three children. 

Modeline has been running a restaurant business for the last seven years. She would like to use this loan to invest in this restaurant by buying food.

The other group members need a loan for their businesses which sell food products, cosmetics, clothes, shoes, and coal.

Modeline says that her main challenge is increasing sales, since the economic crisis in Haiti has not recovered much.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana, es una mujer activa y luchadora, casada y madre de un hijo de 9 años de edad, por quien lucha constantemente para darle un mejor nivel de vida.
Durante varios años trabajó como enfermera en diferentes centros de salud y hospitales, pero, con el ánimo de estar más tiempo con su hijo, decidió independizarse y trabajar en el negocio que su padre le heredó, este consiste en la cría y comercialización de pollos, los galpones están ubicados en el patio de su casa, trabaja sola todos los días y así ha generado los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de concentrado para los animales y cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio, pues podrá engordar más pollos para su posterior venta, incrementando la producción y las ganancias.
Diana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es comprar otro lote de tierra para hacer más galpones y comprar mayor cantidad de pollos para engorde, así aumentará la producción y mejorará notablemente la calidad de vida de su familia, además estará en la capacidad de dar una mejor educación a su hijo para que se forje un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Diana is an active and hardworking woman, she is married and mother to a 9-year-old son for whom she constantly fights to give him a better quality of life. For many years she worked as a nurse in different health care centers and hospitals, but in order to be with her son for more time, she decided to head out on her own and work in the business that her father left her. This work consists of the rearing and sale of chicken. The chicken coops are situated on the patio of her home. She works alone every days and it is in this manner that she has generated sufficient income to contribute to the family finances.

Diana will invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of animal feed and use it to pay of the balance of a loan that is in force. This will allow her to improve the profitability of her business as she will be able to fatten up the chicken more for their subsequent sale, increasing production and the profits. 

Diana states that her greatest dream is to buy another plot of land to make more chicken coops and buy more chicken for fattening, which will mean that she will increase the production and noticeably improve her family's quality of life, furthermore, she will be able to give her son a good education so that he can pave the way to a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and repay the balance of a loan that is in force.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lassa et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font tous les petits commerces de pâtes d’arachides. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Damafing (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de gousses d’arachide au marché. Pour faire la pâte d’arachide, les gousses d’arachide sont  décortiquées, les graines obtenues sont grillées, épluchées, triées et broyées au moulin. La pâte ainsi obtenue est vendue en détail à Lassa et à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Damafing espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families.  They are, on average, thirty-one years old, and have five children.  They live in Lassa, and know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties.  

All the group members work selling peanut paste.  In order to increase their working capital, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their first group loan.

Damafing (standing second from the right in the photo) has a well-earned reputation selling peanut paste.  She will use her loan to buy three sacks of peanuts at the market.  

To make the paste, the peanuts are shelled, grilled, skinned, sorted and then ground in a mill.  The resulting paste is sold to individual customers who are mostly women.  

Damafing hopes to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business and use to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts to make peanut paste for sale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lassa et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Lassa. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pagnes wax, brodés, bazins, de produits cosmétiques et de l’artisanat. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïcha (femme debout à l’extrême à gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits  (pagnes wax,brodés, …). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïcha compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into monogamous households, the five members of the Danaya group are, on average, 33 years old and have three children. They all live in Lassa and know each other through neighborhood ties and from business at the Lassa market. The group members engage in small-scale commerce selling wax pagnes, embroidered pagnes, damask fabrics, cosmetics, and artisan goods. 

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second group loan.

Aïcha (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) is a great seller of clothing (wax pagnes, embroidered pagnes, etc.). She plans to use her loan to buy 20 lengths of wax pagnes from Bamako. Sales will be made at retail in a market to mostly female customers.

With this loan, Aïcha hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Djaminate Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djaminate est majoritairement composé de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sirakoro Dounfing et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de sucre, produits cosmétiques, chaussures et la transformation des céréales. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de sucre. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs  de sucre  au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Sirakoro Dounfing à une clientèle mixte. La cliente Korotoumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans son activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djaminate Group is made up of polygamous women.  The are, on average, forty-five years old, and have three children.  They all live in Sirakoro Dounfing, and are neighbours.  The members of the group all sell sugar, cosmetic products, shoes or process cereals.  

In order to increase their stock levels, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their third group loan.

Aminata (sitting on the far right of the photo) has a well-earned reputation selling sugar.  She will use her loan to buy ten sacks of sugar at the main market.  She sells her sugar to various individual customers in Sirakoro Dounfing.  

Aminata hopes to earn a monthly average of 75,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

In the future, she would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy a housing plot.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Señor Miguel Ángel es una persona muy responsable, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, cuenta con una instrucción a nivel bachiller, y vive en el municipio de Colomi. Su principal actividad es la venta en una tienda comercial de productos lácteos, con una antigüedad de más de 2 años trabaja arduamente todos los días, de esta manera se mantiene económicamente a través de su trabajo, actualmente necesita un crédito para comprar mercadería para su negocio de productos lácteos, así podrá ofrecer productos variados y en mayor cantidad, para satisfacer la demanda y generar mayores ingresos con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is a very responsible person, is 23 years old, single, has a high school diploma, and lives in the municipality of Colomi. His main activity is the sale of dairy products in a store, and he has been working for more than 2 years in this field, working hard every day and in this manner he can support himself financially through his job. 

Miguel Ángel now needs a loan to buy merchandise for his dairy product business, this means he will be able to buy a variety of products and in a great quantity to satisfy demand and generate more sales with the aim of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his dairy product business.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Lolo est composé de 4 femmes parmi lesquelles il y’a 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sirakoro Dounfing et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié et de voisinage. La plupart des membres du groupe font la transformation des céréales en galettes de mil, fonio précuit, semoule de mil et « dégué ». Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
La cliente Korotoumou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits alimentaires de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5sacs  de riz et 10 sacs de mil au marché. La revente se fait en détail à Sirakoro Dounfing et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Korotoumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The 'Lolo' Group is made up of four women, of whom, two are polygamous.  They are, on average, thirty-seven years old, and have five children.  The women all live in Sirakoro Dounfing, and know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties.  Most of the women make millet cakes, pre-cooked fonio, millet semolina and dégué (African porridge).

In order to increase their working capital, the group work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their third group loan.

Korotoumou (sitting on the far right of the photo) has a well-earned reputation selling all sorts of food products.  She will use her loan to buy five sacks of rice and ten sacks of millet at the market.  She sells her products to various individual customers in Sirakoro Dounfing, and sometimes sells on foot.

Korotoumou hopes to earn a monthly average of 80,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals to make millet cakes (Takoula) for sale.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Benkan est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala  Koulikoro vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que des Pommades, Habits, Beignet, Tasses, Glacière etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première. 
Awa, 1 ère debout de la droite vers la gauche est une vendeuse de tasses, Lait, Glacières etc. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de bidons remplis de lait, Tasses inox et glacières  à Koutiala et ailleurs, elle  les vend en détail  au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkan comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  100 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkan is a group of women from Koutiala Koulikoro who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women are, on average, 34 years old and have at least three children. 

This group sells various goods, especially ointments, clothing, donuts, glasses, coolers, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to integrate into Soro Yiriwaso's loan program for the first time.

Awa, the first person standing on the right in the photo, sells glasses, milk, coolers, etc. She plans to use her loan to buy filled milk jugs, stainless steel cups, and coolers in Koutiala and surrounds, which she will sell at retail in a market to a mixed clientele.

While the other members of the Benkan group hopes to earn an average profit of 95,000 francs CFA for each cycle, Awa hopes to earn a 100,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use a part of her profits to support her personal needs and to increase her business funds. She hopes to strengthen her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that she never has to run out of stock.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Jesús Emilio

texts.es:
Jesús es un campesino de 59 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 40 años trabaja como independiente, en la producción agrícola y de ganado de levante, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre, quien desde pequeño le enseñó todas las labores del campo y su horario es de 6 am a 5 pm; adicionalmente trabaja como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, con el fin de complementar los ingresos para su familia.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues con el dinero comprará 2 terneras de levante, así aumentará su producción y aumentará las ganancias que obtiene de su labor.
Jesús manifiesta que su sueño es tener una finca propia en la que pueda tener sus cultivos y su ganado lechero y de levante, así podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y tendrá la posibilidad de disfrutar una vejez con mayores comodidades y bienestar.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 59-year-old farmer, he is a father to 3 children who he has got ahead in life with a lot of hard work and dedication. For the last 40 years he has been working independently in agriculture and rearing calves. He learned this trade from his father who, from a young age, taught him the ropes for everything to do with working in fields. Jesús works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm, in addition, he works as a farm laborer in different farms of the region, all with the aim of complementing his family's income.

The loan that Jesús is seeking is to source of support to strengthen his business, with the money, he will buy 2 calves to rear, and in this way increase his production and grow the profits that he will make from this work.

Jesús says that his dream is to have his own farm in which he could have his own crops and his dairy and rearing cattle, this is how he will be able to improve his family's life conditions and he will have the possibility of enjoying a more comfortable and healthy old age.

loans.use: to buy two calves for rearing.

loans.name: Nietaga Group

texts.fr:
Nietaga est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala  Koko extension qui se connaissent et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que du Bois de chauffage, Savon, Beignet et divers autres articles. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première. 
Fanta  debout en quatrième position de la gauche vers la  droite, est une vendeuse de beignets et d’huile alimentaire. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de bidons d’huile et des haricots pour en faire de beignet  au marché et les vend en détail  au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Nietaga comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fanta compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The 'Nietaga' Group is made up of women from Koutiala Koko extension, who live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, thirty-eight years old, and have at least four children.  The women sell various items such as firewood, soap and fritters.

In order to expand their businesses, the group have decided to start working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.

Fanta (standing third from the right in the photo) sells fritters and cooking oil. She will use her loan to buy barrels of oil and beans in order to make fritters to sell at the market to various customers.

The other members of the group expect to earn an average of 95,000 francs CFA over the loan cycle, but Fanta expects to earn 105,000 francs CFA over the same period.  In addition to repaying their loans, the women will use their earnings to provide for their personal expenses and increase the working capital of their businesses.

In the future, the group would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso to guarantee their supply of stocks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fritters for sale.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que su sueño es poder recibirse de contadora y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia.
Cuenta también que una vez terminada la carrera le gustaría pode especializarse y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese importante gasto.
texts.en:
Karen is from the city of Carapeguá and she is studying for an accounting degree.  She says her goal is to become an accountant and through her work be able to support her family.

She also says that once she has graduated she would like to specialize in a field and continue growing as a professional.  The loan she is requesting is to pay for graduation fees, since the expense to be covered is significant.

loans.use: To pay graduation fees.

loans.name: Reinilda

texts.es:
Reinilda es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es una persona que se está esforzando por estudiar y salir adelante, cuenta que es madre, y que trabajo, y también estudia.
Está siguiendo la carrera en ciencias de la educación y comenta que su esfuerzo es para poder dar a sus hijos un buen estilo de vida, y sacarlos adelante.
Pide este préstamo para pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo, luchando por cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Reinilda is from the city of Villarrica.  She is studying hard to get ahead since she is a mother who also works and studies.

She is studying education science and says her efforts are aimed at giving her children a good lifestyle so they can prosper.

She is requesting this loan to cover university costs so she can continue to study as she has been doing and striving to meet her goals.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a power saw.

loans.name: Sirley

texts.es:
Sirley, a sus 48 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante, enérgica y trabajadora; siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos.
Actualmente trabaja con su esposo en un transporte escolar, sin embargo, los ingresos que obtiene su esposo no le alcanzan para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar; es por esto que desea iniciar su propio negocio, una venta de comidas rápidas, para lo cual solicita el apoyo del crédito; pues con el dinero comprará un carro de comidas y los insumos necesarios (carnes frías, panes, salsas, gaseosas), para dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo; con el que espera tener la capacidad para mejorar las finanzas familiares.
Sirley es consciente que para lograr posicionar su negocio en un mercado tan competido, debe esforzarse y agregar valor a su labor, pues de ello depende el éxito de su idea de negocio, con la que espera cumplir el sueño de ser reconocida en el sector y garantizar una estabilidad económica para seguir apoyando a sus hijos y brindarles una educación universitaria de calidad.
texts.en:
Sirley, 48, is known as a driven, energetic, hard-working woman who is always looking for alternative ways to prosper together with her husband and three children.

She currently works with her husband who is a school transportation driver.  But her husband's income in not enough to cover all the household expenses so she decided to set up her own business, a fast food business.  She is requesting a loan to buy a food cart and the necessary supplies (cold meats, breads, sauces, sodas) so she can begin her new project.  She hopes to be able to improve the family financial situation this way.

Sirley is aware that in order to run a successful business in a competitive market she must work hard and include added value.  The success of her business idea depends on it.  She hopes to meet her goals and become well-known in the sector in order to guarantee her economic stability so she can continue supporting her children and give them a quality university education.

loans.use: To buy a food cart and the necessary supplies (cold meats, breads, sauces, sodas)

loans.name: Jhonny Alberto

texts.es:
Jhonny es un joven campesino de 23 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de zanahoria y papa, actividad que realiza todos los días y las cosechas que recolecta son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante.
Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.
Jhonny, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a young farmer of 23 years old, he is hard working and humble who from a young age learned how to work the land thanks to his parents' teachings.

This has allowed him to progress and, today he has carrot and potato crops, an activity that he performs every day and the crops that he harvests are sold in the town market square. In addition, he works as a laborer in different farms of the region, as this complements the income with which he cares for the well-being of his parents who fought so much to improve his lot in life.

With the help of the loan, Jhonny will buy agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and others), through this loan, she will continue to care for his crops and have a better crop, a much more productive one, with which he will improve the profits when selling his profits.

Jhonny, with his enterprising spirit, drive and tenacity, he wants to continue fighting to achieve his dream of having his own farm, in which he could grow a greater variety of products and therein improve the profitability of the business, guaranteeing financial stability to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and others).

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que se está esforzando por mejorar su vida a través del estudio, quiere ser un profesional independiente.
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería ambiental, con lo que quiere poder ser útil a la sociedad por medio de los conocimientos que ha adquirido en sus estudios.
Luis pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, que le permitirá poder seguir estudiando y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is working hard to improve his life through education, since he wants to be an independent professional.

He is studying for an environmental engineering degree which he hopes he can use to help society through the knowledge acquired during his education.

Luis is requesting a loan to pay university costs so he can continue his education and improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón es un campesino humilde y trabajador, a sus 62 años de edad, es casado y padre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Luego de trabajar casi toda su vida como agricultor, decidió cambiar de oficio, con el fin de dinamizar la economía familiar, por ello comenzó a vender mazamorra pilada de manera ambulante, lleva el producto en canecas de aluminio sobre una carretilla y va caminando por las calles del municipio, esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y ha generado muy buenos resultados desde hace 11 años que lleva realizando su labor.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar más canecas y surtido al por mayor (mazamorra pilada), esto le permitirá aumentar su capacidad para satisfacer la demanda actual de su producto, pues es tradicional su consumo entre los habitantes de todos los municipios antioqueños.
Ramón manifiesta que su edad no le impide soñar y luchar para cumplir sus proyectos, por ello sigue trabajando con entusiasmo y dedicación para llegar a producir el producto por su cuenta y así generar mayor rentabilidad, con lo que podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y disfrutar una vejez tranquila en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Ramón is a humble, hard-working peasant who is 62, married and has three children who he is raising though much effort and dedication.

After having worked almost all his life as a farmer he decided to change his occupation in order to jump-start the family economy.  So he began working as a street vendor selling "mazamorra pilada" (a maize-based food).  He carries the food in aluminum canisters on a cart which he pushes through the town streets.  He learned this trade on his own and has been earning a very good income this way for 11 years.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy more canisters and wholesale goods (mazamorra pilada).  This will help him increase capacity to satisfy the current demand for his product which is consumed traditionally among the local people.

Ramón says his age does not get in the way of his dreams nor his ability to complete his projects.  So he continues working with enthusiasm and dedication to begin producing on his own and generate more profit.  This will allow him to give his family a better quality of life and to enjoy a peaceful old age in the company of his loved ones.

loans.use: To buy more canisters and wholesale goods (maize-based food)

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABALY est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6 ème prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habits
à l’image de ROKIA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes,  20 mètres de bazins   avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabaly group is made up of seven women, who are married and are, on average, 36 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of Bougouni. The group members know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, the group joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their sixth loan. Their five previous loans have all be repaid correctly.

This group of women sells clothing, like Rokia, who is the first women seated on the right in the photo. With her loan, Rokia plans to buy 10 lengths of pagne and 20 meters of damask fabric from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at a market and from home, for cash and credit, to a mixed group of customers.

Rokia hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SINDIYA est constitué de  5 femmes (dont 3 mariées et 2 célibataires) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habits à l’image de NASSOUN qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 mètres de bazin et 6 pièces de pagnes  avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sindiya group is made up of five women (of whom three are married and two are single). They are, on average, 31 years old and have four children. They live in traditional extended families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of Bougouni. The group knows each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

In order to increase their financial capacity and better conduct their businesses, the group joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first loan.

This group of women sells clothing, like Nassoun, who is the first woman standing on the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy 10 meters of damask fabric and six lengths of pagne [bright, colorful fabric] from the wholesalers in Bamako. Nassoun makes her sales at a market and from home, for cash and credit, to a mixed group of customers. 

Nassoun hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA, which she will use to invest in her business and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anta's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été crée le 14 Mai 2010 et regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier. Anta l'emprunteuse en vedette est âgée de 41ans mariée est mère de 04 enfants ( 02 garçons). Elle s'active dans la restauration et tient une gargote devant chez elle et elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans, elle a une grande capacité de vente. Elle va investir tout son prêt pour l'achat de denrées riz, huile et condiments. Les bénéfices vont être réinjecter dans son commerce pour augmenter son fond de roulement, dans son épargne, l'achat de fourniture et scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle appui son mari dans la gestion dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The group was created on 14 May 2010 and is made up of members who live in the same area. Anta, the featured borrower, is 41 years old, married, and a mother of four children (two boys). She is in the restaurant business and has been running an eatery in front of her house for ten years. She has a large selling capacity. 

Anta is going to invest her loan into buying foodstuffs, like rice, oil, and condiments.

Earnings are going to be reinjected into her business in order to increase her cash flow, put away in savings, and used to pay for her children's schooling. She also helps her husband with the costs and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and condiments

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 65 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary and they are blessed with eight children aged 31, 28, 25, 23, 20, 5, 3 and one year.

He is a farmer, an activity he has been running for the last five years. He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to buy some maize and bean planting seeds. 

His monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and his intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded farming activity to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to buy a plot and construct some rental houses for more income. In the future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To expand his farming activity by buying more farm inputs.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BADEYA est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  pommes à l’image de BATOMA qui est la 2ème femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 8 cartons de pommes 18 casiers de boissons avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Badeya Group consists of seven married women with an average age of 35 years and three children at home. They live in nuclear families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni. They are friends and neighbours who support each other's apple-selling businesses. To strengthen their financial and commercial capacity, they partnered with Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are now on their fourth loan. The three previous loans have all been repaid. 

Batoma is the woman standing in the back on the left. With this loan she intends to buy eight boxes of apples and 18 cases of drinks from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her wares at the market and at home, accepting cash and credit from a mixed clientele. Batoma hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60.000FCFA, which she will invest in the business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase various products for resale

loans.name: Misri

texts.en:
Misri is 42 years old. She is married and has no children. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys fertilizers and seeds. In the future, Mistra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 37 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Pauline and they are blessed with three children ages 12, eight and four years. For the past 15 years, Daniel has operated a tailoring business and earns 8,000 KES each month. 

Daniel is requesting a 10,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more materials to boost his business. He plans to use the profit from his loan to educate his children, boost his business, and repay his loan. In the future, Daniel hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more materials to boost his business

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo casado y con un hijo menor de 13 años, desde hace 5 años buscó la forma de mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia,  puso un quiosco de ventas de fritos como carnes, chorizos y otros. No tiene empleados, trabaja solo y aprendió el oficio con la práctica es decir cuando se propone las cosas las consigue, su sueño es ampliar su negocio y comprar surtido e insumos, (carnes, chorizos, gaseosas, servilletas) de ésta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un lugar más cómodo y agradable  y comidas con mayor calidad, al obtener  este crédito Edgardo, continuará aumentando los ingresos familiares dando como resultado una mejor calidad de vida para toda la familia  y poder tener en el futuro un negocio con reconocimiento y prestigio y disfrutar de lo que hace cada día con más aprecio y sin tanta presión económica.
texts.en: Edgardo is married and has a son under 13 years of age. He has been looking for 5 years for a way to improve his income and better his family's quality of life. He set up a kiosk selling fried food such as meat, chorizo sausage and other items. He does not have employees, but works on his own, and he learnt the job by doing it. That is, he achieves what he sets out to do. His dream is to expand his business and buy stock and supplies such as meat, chorizo sausage, fizzy drinks and napkins.  In this way, he will be able to offer his customers a more comfortable and pleasant locale, as well as better quality meals. Edgardo will use this loan to carry on increasing his family's income, which will provide a better quality of life for all his family. In addition, he will be able to have a recognised, prestigious business in the future, and be able to enjoy and appreciate his daily work without economic pressures.
