loans.use: to expand his business and buy stock and supplies such as meat, chorizo sausage, fizzy drinks and napkins.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 38-year-old gentleman, married to Grace and a father of one child aged ten years old. He has operated a butcher shop in Narok town, Kenya, for the last twelve years with a monthly income of KES 40,000.

Patrick learned about Vision fund from a loan officer. He has been advanced a second loan of KES 70,000 after successfully paying off the first one. The funds will facilitate him in the purchase of goats for slaughter. He will use the proceeds to buy livestock so as to sustain the business with minimal expenditure. 

Patrick's hope is to open several butcher shops in the town.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 22 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Ann and they have no children yet. He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last five years. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 99,500 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to buy a motorcycle to transport customers for a fee. His monthly income right now is KES 8,500 and his intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to buy a plot and construct some rental houses for more income.

In the future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use to transport customers for a fee.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 27-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and in-laws. She is from the Khelvachauri district. Nona’s husband works as an operator in a shipping company and gets 400 GEL monthly. This was her family’s only source of income to cover their everyday expenses until Nona started a used clothing business. She opened her business a month ago and needs some investment.

Nona is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase additional stock of used clothing. Her loan will help her to expand her range of products and attract more clients. This loan will greatly help Nona to make her business more productive. She is very grateful for help and relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 26-year-old hardworking gentleman, married to Beth and a father of one child aged three years. He has run a motorcycle transport business for the last two years with a monthly income of KES 60,000. He learned about VisionFund from from a colleague who is already a registered client.

He has been advanced a third loan of KES 120,000 which will facilitate him in the purchase of an additional motorcycle and salon equipment for his wife's business. Michael will use the increased proceeds to pay school fees and expand his business.

His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline and her family are well. She has a poultry, beekeeping, and dairy business that is going well and generates 20,000 KES each month.

Magdaline is requesting a loan to purchase an egg incubator.

loans.use: to purchase an egg incubator.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse they are blessed with three children. She runs a beauty salon and has been in the business for five years and currently makes a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She plans to use the loan to buy hair pieces and dryers as a way of adding stock to her beauty salon and use the anticipated profits to boost her salon and pay back the loan. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

Her future hopes are to grow and open another salon.

loans.use: To buy dryers and hair pieces.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Felister and they are blessed with two children aged 9 and 5 years old.

He has been running his business of motorcycle transport for the last three years. To enable him buy another motorcycle so as to maximize his profits and income, he has applied for his third loan of KES 97,500 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to buy a piece of land and construct his own home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Powell

texts.en:
Powell is a thirty-two-year-old male, married with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He practices farming on a small scale and has been growing cocoa for six years. 

He is a teacher by profession and wishes to expand his cocoa business and improve on his household income and alleviate poverty. His dream is to boost his cocoa business and make more profits which will help him pay his debts on time, though he is challenged by bad weather and price fluctuations of cocoa plus low pay as a teacher. 

Powell has requested for a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 22 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his two brothers and his parents. Amer’s father is retired and currently works as a bus driver. Amer is studying for his bachelors degree in Arabic Language and is in his third year. He is planning to find a better job after graduation to earn a better income to support his family. Due to the financial crisis his family has been facing, Amer hasn’t been able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. 

Amer is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Menuka

texts.en:
Menuka is 35 years old and married with two children ages 13 and 16. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Menuka works seven days a week four hours a day to support her family. She has successfully repaid six previous loans from Patan BPW. 

Menuka lives in Nepal. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With Kiva loans, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer to help them be able to grow cash crops to sell in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

Menuka is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. Menuka thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 32 years old. He has a shop selling phones. He lives in Gaza.

He worked in many shops to get some experience then after many years he decide to open his own workshop. He needs this loan to buy stock to sell, as well as chargers and shelves. This will increase his income, and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  

Hani want to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success; he believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, cold water, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with his three siblings and his parents. Mohammad is studying for his diploma and is majoring in tourism management. He is in his second year. Mohammad is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn a better income to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he was unable to pay for his upcoming semester fees. 

Mohammad is requesting a loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with one adult son. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. For ten years, she has been raising hogs and farming rice and watermelons. This allows her to live on a 6,000 PHP per month as an income. She is asking for a loan to buy watermelon seeds, fertilizer and piglets to further improve her business. Her income provides food and pays the household bills, like water and electricity.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds, fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
Lisandro,  a sus 39 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y pujante que se ha ganado la vida con mucho esfuerzo, para sacar adelante a su hijo adolescente de 15 años.
Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado como pastelero y pizzero en diferentes panaderías de la ciudad, el oficio lo aprendió realizando cursos de panificación y pastelería en entidades educativas, la experiencia la obtuvo en los diferentes empleos que tuvo; esto lo impulsó a buscar nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante y generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por ello decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de pizzas y pasteles ubicado en su propia casa, allí labora todos los días de 6 am a 2 pm y así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos al por mayor (harina, margarina, carnes frías, queso) y realizar mejoras locativas en su espacio de trabajo, esto le permitirá cambiar la imagen del negocio, lo que atraerá más clientes para deleitarlos con sus productos y así mejorar los ingresos que percibe.
Lisandro con empeño, disciplina y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ampliar su mercado y la oferta de productos, así hará de su negocio su principal fuente de ingresos, con lo que estará en la capacidad de dar a su hijo una educación universitaria y disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Lisandro is a 39-year old hard-working and thriving man who has made a living working very hard to support his 15-year old son. He has worked as a pastry chef and pizza cook in various local bakeries. He learned this profession from bread-making and bakery courses in educational centers and gained experience through his different jobs. This motivated him to look for new opportunities to get ahead and earn income on his own. He started his business selling pizzas and pastries at his home, where he works every day from 6am to 2pm generating enough resources to cover his household expenses. 

He plans to use the loan to buy ingredients in bulk (flour, butter, cold meat and cheese) and to make improvements to his work space. This will allow him to change his business image, attract more customers and improve his income. 

Lisandro is willing to keep working hard, with discipline and dedication, to keep the business going and to expand his market and product offering. He plans to have his business as his main income source, so that he can cover college tuition for his son and enjoy better life and well-being conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk (flour, butter, cold meats and cheese) and to make improvements to his work space.

loans.name: Kyeicumu Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a 34-year-old Ugandan married male and he is a resident of Kagadi. He deals in produce, selling mainly maize to enable him earn a living. He also does farming to earn extra income. He hopes to educate his children though he is challenged by poor roads that make transportation of his merchandise to the main town difficult. Patrick needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kaytseruhi

texts.en:
Kaytseruhi lives with her husband and little son. She is a farmer with many years of experience. She keeps cows, pigs, piglets and chickens. Her husband sells the meat and milk locally. With their income from agriculture, the family is able to earn a living, and it is very important for them to run the farm successfully.

Kaytseruhi has applied for this loan to ask for financial support. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her to purchase six piglets and forage for the livestock. The loan is highly important to this family, to enlarge their farm and cover their current living expenses. 

As this is Kaytseruhi's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they had no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for six piglets and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en:
Hannington is an old client of the institution whose Kiva loan of UGX 1,000,000 was paid back well. He is applying for another loan of UGX 1,500,000. His previous loan fetched him a good income through selling the pigs and goats and he will use this one to improve on his agricultural produce so that he can raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his siblings and develop his family.

His main challenge is still limited capital, fluctuating prices for his products and competition from other producers. Hannington is a very hard working man and determined to change his future.

With this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), Hannington is hopeful that his business will drastically change for the better.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and goats to breed and later sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of corn flour.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria, a 48-year-old rice farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol, is married with four children. Her eldest is 25 and the youngest is 14. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides so she can maintain a healthy crop. 

Macaria hopes to continue doing what she loves most, and dreams of expanding her livelihood in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 40 years old. She is married and has two children aged 21 and 19. Many years ago, she established her business selling cows' milk Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 22 and 21.  Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Lalita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Tayiana

texts.en:
Tayiana is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of 13 members. She is a mixed farmer and she has been in the business for the last four years. Her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is currently receiving her first loan from VisionFund of KES 20,000 that will facilitate her to prepare the land and get planting seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. 

Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a 24-year-old single gentleman who supports his siblings, is a livestock trader in Narok County, Kenya. He has been running the business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 10000.

Francis has requested his first loan of KES 20000 from VisionFund to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Levi's Group

texts.en:
Levi is 61 years old and is married with six children. He is known as friendly and trustworthy and is active in community in groups such as the men's group and prayer group. Levi has been a farmer for 23 years. He described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Levi first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund to learn new farming methods. Levi volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Levi’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and was able to feed his family.

Levi and his group are requesting a loan through One Acre Fund to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With the support from One Acre Fund and your loan, farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.  

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old. He is married to Salina and they have five children between 10 and 26 years old. For the past 20 years, Charles has been a farmer and he earns an income of 6,000 KES each month. Salina also brings in extra income to the family kitty. 

Charles is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs. This will be his third loan with VisionFund and he successfully repaid his previous loans. Charles will use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his farm. In the future, he dreams of being a leading farmer in his society.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kalau

texts.en:
Kalau is a 46-year-old married lady who supports a family of 10 members. She is a mixed farmer, and she has been in the business for the last four years. Her monthly income is KES 8,000.

She is currently servicing her first loan from Vision fund of KES 20,000, which will help her to prepare the land and get seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Bipana

texts.en:
Bipana is 33 years old. She is married and has two children aged 12 and 5. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Bipana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has owned a rice farm and has been farming for 40 years now. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines with her six children ages 12 to 23. Aside from farming she also sell home-cooked meals and snacks.

Julieta needs to make further investments in her food however she lacks the funds to do so. As of this time, she  is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy flour, brown sugar and cooking oil. With the loan, Julieta  will be able to increase her productivity giving her the chance of increasing her sales.

She hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, brown sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 30-year-old lady from Kakamega in Kenya, married to Fredrick. The couple have one child aged four and a half years old. Diana operates an internet cafe, earning a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This the second loan she is taking out with VisionFund Kenya, a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings that she will use to expand her business by purchasing another computer. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more internet bundles and repay her loan.

Her dream is to own a big internet cafe and bring up a stable family

loans.use: To purchase another computer for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano is a 57-year-old fisherman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages 11 and 25. He has been fishing for a long time now and would like to further invest on his livelihood. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fishing net to replace the old one. His fishing business afforded him healthy meals and school fees for his child.

In the future, he hopes increase his income from fishing by continued hard work and improvement on his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fish net.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old and single with three children. For the past year, she has run a retail shop and she also sells charcoal in Makueni town. Gladys earns a monthly income of 14,000 KES. 

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more stock of retail goods to sell including sugar and credit calling cards. This will be her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. Gladys will use the anticipated profits from her loan to improve the living standards of her family. In the future, she hopes to have a good and successful business which will enable her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and credit calling cards

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is 37 years old, married to Caroline and they are blessed with two children. He runs a motorcycle transport services in Kapsabet town and is served by Vision Fund Kenya Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last 10 years; from this business, he gets a monthly income of Kshs 30,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 30,000 of which he will use to pay school fees for his son. His dream is to give the best to his family as the breadwinner, as well as expand his business to a point where he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 23 years, single, and supports three people. He is a cobbler, a business he has done for the last eight years. He gets an average monthly income of Kshs 5,000. 

He plans to use the amount borrowed of Kshs 30,000 to purchase leather and a sewing machine to expand his business. He will use the profits from the retail shop business to sustain himself and his dependents.

loans.use: to purchase leather and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fabiola De Jesús

texts.es:
Fabiola es una mujer pujante y luchadora, lleva más de 20 años generando ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y de línea propia, trabaja sola todos los días desde la comodidad de su vivienda, allí presta sus servicios de 8 am a 6 pm, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue mejorando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos.
A sus 50 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos por quienes lucha constantemente para darles un mejor bienestar y educación, la pasión que siente por su labor y el amor a su familia, la impulsan a buscar alternativas para seguir adelante, es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, cierres, botones), esto le permitirá terminar la producción que tiene pendiente y entregar los pedidos de manera ágil y oportuna, logrando mejorar los ingresos y así obtener más contratos, fidelizando a su clientela.
Fabiola manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es aumentar su capacidad instalada, comprando más máquinas y generando oportunidades de empleo, así podrá incrementar su clientela y lograr que su negocio sea una microempresa rentable y bien estructurada, para que le permita brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a strong and plucky woman. For 20 years she has been earning a living making clothes for others and with her own designs. Fabiola works alone every day from the comfort of her home. There she offers her services from 8am until 6pm. Fabiola learned her trade by observing others and practising herself. Little by little she improved her technique and her knowledge grew.

At 50 years old, Fabiola is married and a mother to two children for whom she is constantly fighting in order to offer them better well-being and a better education. Fabiola's passion and love for her work and her family drive her to look for new ways to get ahead and so she is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies (such as threads, material, zips and buttons). This will allow her to finish products that she has already started and to deliver orders on time and well done. She can then earn a higher income and receive more orders as her customers become loyal.

Fabiola tells us that her biggest desire is to increase her capacity by buying more machines and creating jobs. She can then increase her number of customers and have a well-structured and profitable business in order to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies (such as threads, material, zips and buttons).

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 26 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with one child. She has a retail shop and also does farming in Makueni town. She has been in this business for two years now and it has been profitable.

She plans to buy charcoal for sale. She will use the anticipated income to expand her business. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to work hard and be successful.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elya

texts.en:
Elya lives in Hovtashat village of Ararat region with her husband and two grown-up children, ages 25 and 22 years old. Her husband works at a local post office and Elya herself is a student. She studies at Pedagogical University after Kh. Abovyan. Despite her age (Elya is 43) she desire and plan to get a higher education is very strong, so Elya studies hard to become a teacher.

She has now applied for this loan to ask Kiva and SEF to help her with university tuition. She wasn't able to save money for covering education costs and decided to apply for this loan. This is very important for Elya and she waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is from Angeghakot, a village in the Syuniq region, where she lives with her husband and 12-year-old son. Meri's husband is employed in the private sector, but his salary is hardly enough to cover the family's basic needs. Thus, Meri is engaged in farming. She grows wheat, barley, emmer wheat, potatoes, apples and pears. Meri works hard to have high-quality agricultural products to sell in local markets. 

Now, as the new growing season starts, she needs some capital for her farm. With this loan of $3,000, Meri plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel. As this is Meri's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they had no credit history. The loan is very important to Meri, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fuel, seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu for her business,

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas was born in 1975. He is a married retired soldier from the Jordanian army. He lives in Zarqa city with his wife and six sons (four are two sets of twins). Firas decided to expand the hookahs and hookah accessories store that he owns after he retired to provide a better life for his family. 

Therefore, Firas would like a loan to expand his store to purchase smokers' supplies such as coal and various flavors of honeyed tobacco to increase his profit and provide a better life for his growing family.

loans.use: to purchase smokers' supplies, such as coal and new flavors of honeyed tobacco.

loans.name: Asmani's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North district, with Asmani selected as the Kiva representative. Asmani has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and he is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 71 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Asmani is 63 years old and has been a farmer for 40 years. Asmani works as a farmer to provide for his five children. The community and other farmers know Asmani as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. Besides farming, he is also involved in his community in groups such as the savings group and prayer group. Asmani described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group. 

Asmani joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Asmani joined One Acre Fund so that he can get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family. Because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Asmani has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Asmani's life because he has more profits from his harvest and was able to feed the family. In the future, Asmani hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and invest in a business. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Asmani and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer packages from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With the support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

 The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Caroline is married and has four children. She runs a small business selling mandazi while her husband is a farmer. He has been farming for five years now and he is currently growing maize and beans on his farm. Caroline is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Caroline’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her hives to expand her small business. Caroline’s hope for the future is to expand her beekeeping project and produce more honey.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 42-year-old lady who has six children. She also does small-scale farming with her husband; he is standing beside her in the photograph. Apart from farming, Imelda also has a mobile trade business which supplements their family income. She started the business in order to help her husband to support their fairly large family. She will use this loan to buy merchandise of clothes and shoes for the mobile trade business. She is hard-working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph's Group is a group of seven farmers in the Kakamega North District, with Joseph selected as the Kiva representative. Joseph is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 70 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Joseph is 45 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years to provide for his 10 children. The community and other farmers know Joseph as hardworking and trustworthy. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community in groups such as the men's group and savings group. Joseph hopes he can have an even better harvest this year with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in the group. 

Joseph first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Joseph joined One Acre Fund to get the best seed prices and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Joseph plans to use the money he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, buy a cow and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  

Joseph and the Lukhuna Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Manisha

texts.en:
Manisha is 26 years old. She is married and has one child, who is 5. Many years ago, she established her cow milk-selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Manisha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.
 
In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en:
Theodora, 42, is from Kakamega County. She is married to Nicodemus, who is a businessman in the same town. They have three children, aged 13, nine and five.

Theodora operates a pharmacy as her business and has done this for the last three years. She earns an average income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. 

She is taking her second loan, for 30,000 KES, with Vision Fund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more products. 

Her profits will be used to repay the loan and build savings. Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase products for her business

loans.name: Wairimu

texts.en:
Wairimu is 51 years old from Nakuru. She is divorced and is blessed with four children, ages 30, 27, 23 and 21 years old.

She has been running her business of selling fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years and to enable her to buy some more stock of potatoes, she has applied for this third loan of KES 30,000 form VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,700 and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to buy a plot.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Repher

texts.en:
Repher is a 34-year-old lady from Kakamega. She is married and has two kids, ages 11 and 6 years old respectively.

She has a beauty salon within her local town. She has been operating this kind of business for the last three years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Her dream is to grow her business and to become a successful entrepreneur so as to support her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 32-year-old lady, married to James. She is a mother of three children aged between sixteen and ten. She earns a living from the sale of fish. She learnt about VisionFaund from a colleague of hers in the business, who is already accessing the organization's services. 

Damaris has been advanced a third loan of KES 90,000, which she will use to buy and transport fish from the lakeside city to her premises in Narok. 

She will use the proceeds to renovate her food stall. Her dream is to build her own rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase and transport fish to her food stall.

loans.name: Duván Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Duván, es soltero y tiene 30 años de edad, trabajaba en una finca en la zona rural, con aspiraciones más amplias decidió ubicarse en el pueblo y allí compró un bar hace aproximadamente un año, sus clientes son los habitantes del municipio, familia y amigos. Esta adquisición la hizo  con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida para él y su familia ya que es el apoyo económico de sus padres. 
El señor Duván  tiene como sueño  ampliar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida,  el crédito que solicita es para hacerle  mejoras locativas al bar para que sea un lugar más agradable para sus clientes y surtir el bar con los productos que el ofrece (cerveza, gaseosas, licor, mecato).
texts.en:
Duván is 30 years old and single.  He used to work on an estate in a rural area. With bigger aspirations, Duván decided to move to a town and there he bought a bar a year ago. His customers are people from the municipality, as well as family and friends. As Duván supports his parents financially, he bought the bar with the objective of improving his income and his and his family's quality of life. 

Duván's dream is to increase his income and his quality of life. He will use this loan to make improvements to his premises - so that it is more pleasant for his customers - and to buy stock (beer, fizzy drinks, liquor and pastries).

loans.use: to make improvements to his premises and to buy stock (beer, fizzy drinks, liquor and pastries).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic supplies (aluminium sheeting, paint and anti-rust products) in bulk.

loans.name: Héctor William

texts.es:
Héctor, a sus 41 años de edad, es un microempresario consagrado a su labor, organizado y trabajador, pues desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a trabajar como mecánico automotriz, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica y que poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos.
Actualmente su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy comercial y bastante competitiva en este campo de acción, sin embargo ha obtenido muy buenos resultados porque ofrece un servicio de excelente calidad, siendo esto un factor diferenciador, cuenta con el apoyo de 4 empleados directos y así se ha ganado la vida y ha sacado adelante a su esposa y a su hijo de 10 años de edad.
Con el crédito que solicita realizará adecuaciones locativas y pintará el local para mejorar la imagen del mismo y así atraer nuevos clientes para prestar su servicio, logrando generar mejores ingresos.
Héctor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad y permanencia a su negocio, logrando reconocimiento en el sector, esto le generará mayor rentabilidad y estará en la capacidad de adquirir una vivienda propia para brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar, y a su hijo podrá ofrecerle una buena educación para que se forje un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Héctor is 41 years old. He is a micro-businessman who is dedicated to his work. He is organized and hardworking. He has been working as an automotive mechanic for 20 years. He learned this trade empirically and perfected his technique little by little, widening his knowledge.  

Right now, his business is located in a very commercial area and it is very competitive in this field. Nonetheless, he has obtained very good results because he offers a service of excellent quality. This is a distinguishing factor. He has the help of 4 direct employees. This is how he has earned his living and gotten his wife and 10 year old son ahead.  

With the loan he is asking for, he will make improvements on his locale and paint it so that he can improve its image. This way, he can attract new customers to provide service to and generate better income. 

Héctor says that his biggest wish is to have continuity and permanence in his business, and becoming better known in the are. This will generate more profits and he will be able to acquire his own home for his family to have better living conditions and well being. He will be able to offer his son a good education so that he can forge a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to make improvements on his locale and to paint it to improve its image.

loans.name: Zahreya

texts.en:
Zahreya was born in 1965. She is divorced and lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Zahreya’s son sells vegetables. For the past four years, she has been supporting herself financially by running a mini-market. She also sells clothes and blankets. Zahreya started her project with a small quantity of clothes and blankets and then added food products to open her mini-market. She has found it to be profitable but does not have enough money to purchase more food products or clothing. 

Zahreya is requesting a loan to buy more clothing, blankets, and food products to expand the variety of items she sells. She hopes her loan will increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, blankets, and food products

loans.name: Rula

texts.en: Rula was born in 1992. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla with her husband and her only daughter. Rula has been supporting her husband financially by running her project selling blankets for one year. She started it with a small quantity of blankets. Now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of blankets in order to raise her profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa was born in 1961. She is married and a mother of 5 living in an area in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as a taxi driver. He also works in agriculture. Salwa has been raising goats and selling their products for 1 year in order to support her husband in improving their living conditions. She started her project raising few goats. Now she is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of goats in order to expand her project and raise her productivity, but she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats for her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 27-year-old man who has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). He hails from a village in Bugangari Rukungiri municipality.
He is working with a government agricultural advisory service and raises cattle, earning income to support himself and his family.
Stephen's main dream is to expand his business so he can double his income, but his challenge has been limited capital.
With this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), Stephen is hopeful that his cattle business will expand and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky is a new client of the institution. The 32-year-old is married and blessed with two children. He hails from Munyeganyegye village, Masya parish, Nyakagyeme sub-county, Rukungiri district.

Lucky is a motorcycle (boda boda) cyclist and has been in this business for so many years. It is in this business that he has been getting income to look after his family.

He is a hard-working man and his dream has been to build a commercial house to get income and be great personnel in his area. He is taking this loan to finish his commercial building.

With this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), Lucky is hopeful that all will be well and his income will increase to greater volume. In the photograph is Lucky and the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right.)

loans.use: to finish a commercial house.

loans.name: Claudia Cristina

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven de 23 años, soltera y en la actualidad se desempeña como estilista en una sala de belleza.
Es muy emprendedora y  organizada; tiene como sueño montar su propio negocio, por ello desea adquirir este crédito para conseguir un local y adecuarlo apropiadamente, pues necesita comprar  todo lo necesario para dicho servicio como son (lavacabezas, secadores, silletería, espejos, productos químicos y de belleza) y con el fin de continuar con su  carrera, cada día mejorando para ofrecerle a sus clientes una gama de servicios de buena calidad (maquillaje, corte y cepillado, manicure y otros) y sentir su sueño realizado mejorando su calidad de vida y aumentando sus ingresos en esta profesión como independiente; así podrá organizar su tiempo y utilizarlo para realizar otras actividades.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 23 year old young woman who is single and currently working as a stylist in a beauty salon. 
She is very enterprising and organized. Her dream is to set-up her own business and so she is requesting this loan to acquire a premises and set it up appropriately. She needs to buy everything that is necessary for this task such as shampooing chairs, driers, seating, mirrors, beauty products and chemicals. Her goal is to continue her career, improving every day so she can offer her customers a range of services (makeup, hair cutting and styling, manicures, and more) and to realize her dream of improving her quality of life and increasing her income by working for herself in this profession. This would enable her to organize her time and use it for other activities.

loans.use: to buy everything needed for a beauty salon (shampooing chairs, driers, seating, mirrors, beauty products and chemicals).

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Doña Beatriz una mujer con tenacidad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 24 años, siendo muchos años solamente ama de casa y en vista de dificultades económicas optó por otras oportunidades de ingresos para apoyar en el sustento familiar, se contactó con una cuñada quien llevaba varios años como vendedora de productos a través de catálogos, ella aprendió dicha labor y en la actualidad posee muchos clientes, pero ello conlleva a tener más compromisos con los pagos y la adquisición de muchos productos,  por esto doña Beatriz está solicitando dicho crédito para  colocar un local propio y comprar surtido (productos de belleza, para  el cabello, la piel, y más) y poder llevar a sus fieles clientes productos de calidad y prestarles así un excelente servicio.  Todo esto dando como resultado cumplir su sueño y mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a persistent married woman who has two children, ages 16 and 24.  In light of economic problems, after being exclusively a homemaker for many years she decided on other income opportunities to help support her family.  She contacted a sister-in-law who had been working in catalogue sales for several years and learned that job.  Currently she has a lot of clients, which entails a commitment to buying more products.

Beatriz is requesting the loan to set up her own store and buy more merchandise (beauty products, hair products, skin products, etc.) so she can provide her loyal customers with quality products and excellent service.

The result of all this will be to achieve her dream and improve her income and her family's quality of life

loans.use: to buy beauty products, hair products, skin products, and other merchandise

loans.name: Marta Libia

texts.es:
La señora Marta tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos,  desde hace cuatro años trabaja en forma independiente vendiendo productos de belleza y cosmetología por catálogos de varias empresas reconocidas a nivel mundial, Doña Marta tiene como sueño mejorar sus ventas y con ello aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida,  con el crédito solicitado comprará mercancía (como perfumería, cosméticos, productos de aseo personal) y así  obtendrá un stock suficiente para ofrecerles a sus clientes.

También en el futuro desea adquirir un local propio para la distribución de sus productos, ofreciendo artículos de buena calidad y satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes, de igual forma  genera mayor rentabilidad para su  negocio y amplía su proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 31 years old, married and has two children. For four years she has been working independently selling beauty products from catalogues provided by businesses that are known around the world. Marta's dream is to improve her sales and, with it, to improve her income and quality of life. She will use this loan to buy merchandise (such as perfumes, cosmetics and personal hygiene products) and to have enough stock to provide to her customers.

In the future Marta would also like to have her own premises to sell to her products. She would like to offer good quality products there and satisfy her customers' needs. She can then make her business more profitable and go on with her life plans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (such as perfumes, cosmetics and personal hygiene products).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay of the balance of an existing loan and buy necessary materials such as lace, elastic, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia, 28, has two children and operates a boda-boda (motorcycle) transport business. He also trades in maize (corn) during the growing season. He began his business to increase his income. 

As a motorcyclist, he gets all types of customers from the general public. His major challenge is the rainy season but, all in all, he believes he is hardworking.

Matia will use this loan to buy construction materials for completing his house. He is living in it with his wife and child but wishes that he could get enough funds to make the place more habitable. 

In the photograph is Matia and his wife, who is carrying their baby.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 48 years old, married and blessed with six children aged eight to 18 years old. A businessman, he owns a retail shop in Ewalel Location and has been in operation for a period of six years.  He earns an income of 19,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

With his fourth term loan  from Vision Fund Kenya, for 20,000 KES, he intends to purchase additional stock for his shop. The profits he earns will be used to pay school fees for his children who are in school.  

His hope is to improve living standards for his family.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is a 39-year-old Cameroonian and a married mother of two children. Her oldest is fourteen and in secondary school while the youngest is five and in primary school. She is an experienced tailor, having been in the business for over two years. Clarisse is likely to succeed because her business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her profits by seventy five percent.

loans.use: to buy material for sewing clothes

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina has spent the last ten years raising hogs for an income. She is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. 

Martina's hog raising business is thriving, especially since she is raising a sow that also produces piglets. She is asking for a loan to keep her business well maintained. She will use her loan to buy two types of feed and supplements so that her pigs will be healthy and disease-free.

Her income provides food and pays for bills like electricity and water.

In the future, she only hopes to see her children successful with their lives.

loans.use: to buy two types of feed and supplements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, vita water, fish, pepper and oil for her business.

loans.name: Luz Albany

texts.es:
Luz es una madre soltera de dos hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
A sus 29 años de edad, se desempeña como comerciante independiente, vendiendo comidas rápidas, su negocio está ubicado en una calle muy transitada del centro de la ciudad, trabaja sola de lunes a sábado de 10 am a 6 pm, así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar, durante los 7 años que lleva como independiente.
Con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos, desea incursionar en el mercado con otro tipo de mercancía, especialmente sudaderas, shorts, camisetas y medias, esto con el fin de aprovechar la temporada escolar, en la que este tipo de productos es muy solicitado; para ello será utilizado el crédito que solicita.
Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es posicionar mejor su nuevo negocio y generar una mayor estabilidad económica para brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz is a single mother to two children. She has helped them to get ahead with a lot of effort and dedication.

At 29 years old, Luz works as an independent businesswoman selling fast food. Her business is in a street in the city centre that has many passers-by. Luz works alone from Monday to Saturday, from 10am until 6pm. She has managed to earn enough money to support her household during the seven years that she has been working independently.

With a desire to complement her income, Luz would like to entire the market with a different type of product, particularly sweatshirts, shorts, t-shirts and socks. She is doing this in order to take advantage of the start of the school year, when these products are in high demand. This loan will be used to start this work.

Luz tells us that her greatest desire is to set up her new business well and to be more financially stable in order to provide her children with better well-being and a better upbringing.

loans.use: to buy sweatshirts, shorts, t-shirts and socks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kabango Joint Women Organic Farmers Organisation Group

texts.en:
Yozephina, aged 53 married with four children, lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer who has been involved in this business since 1980 when she started it to supplement her family's income. As a loving mother she hopes to have all her children educated and is only affected by weather changes. 

Yozephina needs the loan to buy pea seeds for planting. She is a member of the above group where each member guarantees the other as they don't offer security.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supplement his payroll for the employees of his courier business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cold water, rice, oil for her business.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives with her 17-year-old son in Shaqe village of Syuniq region. Her husband and elder son have left for abroad to work. Nune herself runs a farm where she keeps livestock and cultivates land. 

She works hard to sustain her family's living with the income that she gets from agriculture.

So development of the farm will allow her to gather enough income and her husband will come back.

Therefore, Nune asks this loan to be able to purchase six piglets, fertilizer, seeds and forage for the livestock. This will be a huge support for her farming business and she will be very grateful to lenders.

loans.use: to pay for six piglets, fertilizer, seeds and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Jyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Жыпаркул и ее супруг очень ответственные и трудолюбивые люди и имеют большое уважение среди сельчан. У Жыпаркул - среднее образование, она домохозяйка, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жыпаркул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 17,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 телки, 1 лошадь, 15 овец, также семья обрабатывает 3,6 ГА земли, где в основном выращивают фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дома для детей.
texts.en: Jyparkul is 54 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Jyparkul and her husband are very responsible and hardworking people who are deeply respected by their fellow villagers. Jyparkul has a secondary education. She is a homemaker. As the main source of income for her family, Jyparkul practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 16 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 17,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jyparkul's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 2 calves, 1 horse and 15 sheep on her farm, as well as a 3.6 hectare plot of land on which the family mainly grows beans for sale. Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Jyparkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Jyparkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for to build a home for her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.en: Osvaldo is an artisan in Rio de Janeiro who showcases Brazil's extraordinary gemstones in his art. He would like to stock up on stones, brass and other materials for production. Osvaldo has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: "In 1980, I left a career as an accountant. I began as an artisan's assistant and a sculptor, and became fascinated with gems and crystals. Today I travel throughout Brazil in search of crystals from Bahia, emeralds from Minas Gerais, and agates from Rio Grande do Sul. I realize I have experienced a great personal transformation. I have more patience for art than for logic!" "I hope to be able to stock up on the materials I need so as to be able to have a good supply of designs in stock. I am very grateful for your support. Thank you!" Use the link below to view Osvaldo's Brazilian gemstone art on the NOVICA site: Novica website

loans.use: to stock up on stones, brass and other materials for production.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is a 34-year-old Cameroonian who is married with four children; the oldest is 12 and in primary school while the youngest is 2. She has been in this business for over ten years which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her turn over by 35 percent.

loans.use: to buy stuff like soft drinks, bread, savon, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes such as plates, bowls and cups for her business.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Эта 44-летняя женщина по имени Сабохат является матерью одиночкой. У нее 12-летний сын, который учится в школе. Сабохат вместе с сыном, матерью, невесткой и племянником живет в районе Джиликуль. 
Сабохат по профессии швея. У нее 20-летний стаж работы в этой области. Она занимается кройкой и шитьем женских национальных платьев. У нее постоянно много заказов, но по причине того, что ее машинка ручная, она не успевает в работе. В связи с этим Сабохат берет кредит для того чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Благодаря такой машинке производительность ее труда увеличится и таким образом увеличится доходность ее деятельности.
texts.en:
This 44-year-old woman whose name is Sabohat is a mother of one. She has a 12-year-old son, who goes to school. Sabohat and her son, mother, sister-in-law and nephew live in the region of Djilikul.

By profession, Sabohat is a seamstress. She has 20 years of work experience in this area. She is engaged in the cutting and sewing of women's national dresses. She always has many orders, but because her machine is manual, she does not have time to work. In connection with this, Sabohat is taking a loan to purchase a new modernized sewing machine. Thanks to this machine, her work productivity will increase and thus improve profitabiiity of her activities.

loans.use: to buy a new modernized sewing machine to develop a sewing business

loans.name: Melyboy

texts.en:
Melyboy is a 24-year-old fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. For three years now he has been selling fresh fish in the neighborhood for an income. This gave him an average profit of 8,000 PHP every month. He would like to sell more but has limited capital. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish to sell. 

His income will be for food and household bills.

He hope that in the future he can have more business and live abundantly for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.es: María Genara, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, junto a su esposo se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa y cosméticos ambulante y por encargo, de esta manera la señora se gana la vida. Hoy en día requiere de este crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, perfumes, vanidades, ropa interior de dama y caballero, ya que no cuenta con estos productos en su inventario para seguir ofreciendo.
texts.en: Maria Genara is the mother of 2 school-aged children.  She has a business that she runs with her husband.  She sells clothing and cosmetics from place to place and through orders.  In this way she is able to earn a living.  She needs this loan now to buy pants, shirts, perfumes, compact makeup kits, and underwear for men and women, because she lacks these products in her inventory and she wants to continue to offer them for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old, married and supports two of his children, who are aged 12 and 10 years. He owns a retail shop in Poi location. His shop has been in operation for a period of three years, and he earns an income of KES 10,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his first-term loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya, and wishes to purchase stock of sugar, tea leaves, and detergents, among other stock for resale. The profits he gets will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to excel in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, tea leaves, and soaps, among other stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a resident of Rukungiri municipality. His main income is boda boda or motorcycle riding and house renting.

From that income, he has been able to provide basic necessities for his children. His main challenge has been lack of enough capital to expand income generation for him and his family's sustenance. He will buy another motorcycle using the loan to help increase his income base since the person riding it will be giving him UGX 10,000 daily. 

He is resilient and hopes for a better future through working hard to achieve his dream.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Almaz

texts.ru: Алмаз 43 года, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 2 детей. Супруга-частная швея, занимается мини заказами по пошиву одежды на дому. У Алмаза - среднее образование, у него очень большой опыт в сфере сельского хозяйства. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алмаз занимается животноводством и полеводством, имеет большой практический опыт по возделыванию земли в выращивании разного рода сельхозкультур, стартовав 16 лет назад, с 17,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алмаза, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 20 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,6 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль, лук и морковь, посезонно получают очень хороший доход от урожая. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмаз обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алмаз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт помещения для скота.
texts.en: Almaz is 43 years old, married, and together with his wife, is raising two children. His wife is a private seamstress who takes mini-orders for tailoring dresses in their home. Almaz has a secondary education. He has a lot of experience in the sphere of agriculture. As the main source of income for his family, Almaz practices livestock breeding and crop farming. He has a lot of practical experience in land farming and growing different types of crops. He started this business 16 years ago with 17,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Almaz's hard work, he currently 1 milk cow, 1 bull calf and 20 sheep on his farm, as well as a 3.6 hectare plot of land on which he grows beans, onions and carrots. Every season, he receives a very good income from his harvest. His monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing his business, Almaz turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan to buy bull calves to increase the size of his herd. Almaz plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of cattle. He also intends to save money to repair the barn for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Alberto De Jesús

texts.es:
Alberto es un microempresario humilde, carismático y trabajador, a sus 62 años de edad aún continúa velando por el bienestar de su familia, conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 19 años comenzó a trabajar como levantador de carga en la plaza de mercado, allí conoció todo lo relacionado con el manejo de los negocios de frutas y verduras, esto lo impulsó a independizarse y se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar una carga de granadilla y lulo, para luego distribuirlo, los productos son almacenados en un pequeño local que alquiló y poco a poco se dio a conocer en el sector, logrando mejorar los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Con el apoyo del crédito comprará surtido al por mayor (lulo, granadilla y otros productos), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente para satisfacer la demanda actual, logrando mejorar las utilidades que deja su labor.
Alberto manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir soñando y luchar para cumplir esos sueños, especialmente el de crecer su negocio y ampliar su cobertura para despachar hacia otros municipios, esto le permitirá tener mejor calidad de vida para ofrecer a su familia y podrá disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Alberto is a humble, charismatic, and hardworking micro-entrepreneur. He is 62 years old and continues to work to ensure the welfare of his family which consists of his wife and 4 children whom he has raised with great effort and dedication.

He began working as a cargo transporter in the marketplace 19 years ago. He learned everything related to business management of selling fruits and vegetables while in the marketplace. This experience prompted him to become an entrepreneur. He was presented with the opportunity to purchase a load of local South American fruits. He then distributed these products in a small space that he rented. He gradually became known in the industry and achieved a higher income to bring home.

With the support of this loan, he will buy a wholesale assortment of local fruit. This order will allow him to have sufficient product to meet current demand, earning better profits.

Alberto says that his age does not stop him from dreaming and working hard to fulfill his dreams, especially to grow his business and expand its coverage to other municipalities. Expansion would allow him to have a better quality of life with his family and to enjoy a peaceful old age without economic worry.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale local fruits.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, con su espíritu de superación y con la necesidad de generar recursos para aportar a su hogar, comenzó su propio negocio de venta de mercancía por catálogo, caracterizándose por el amplio conocimiento sobre las bondades de los productos que ofrece, se ha dado a conocer en el sector, logrando atraer cada día nuevos clientes.
Con el apoyo del crédito comprará mercancía al por mayor (batidos, malteadas, suplementos dietarios, multivitamínicos y otros), así podrá satisfacer la demanda actual de sus productos y además prestará un mejor servicio, realizando la entrega inmediata de los productos que compre su clientela; así mejorará las ventas e ingresos.
Jhonatan manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ascender en los escalafones de microempresarios de la marca que distribuye, así mejorará notablemente su calidad de vida y podrá seguir aportando a la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is an enterprising youth who is 22 years old.  Because of his determination to succeed and his need to generate resources to contribute to his household, he started his own business selling merchandise through a catalog.  He is known for his expansive knowledge about the benefits of the products that he sells.  He has come to know the neighborhood and is managing to attract new customers on a daily basis.

With the support from this loan, he will buy merchandise at wholesale (smoothies, shakes, dietary supplements, multivitamins, and other products).  This way, he will be able to meet the demand for his products and also provide better service by immediately delivering the products that his customers buy.  This will increase his sales and his income.

Jhonatan states that his main desire is to move up the ranks of the entrepreneurs who are selling the brand that he distributes.  This way he will significantly improve his quality of life, and will be able to continue to contribute to the household finances.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (health products) at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Чолпон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чолпон занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 кобылы, 50 овец, также дополнительно занимаются выращиванием клевера, картофеля, кукурузы и овощей. Супруг занимается перевозкой пассажиров по местным селам. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чолпон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Cholpon is 39 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Cholpon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Cholpon practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 2 mares, and 50 sheep on her farm. She additionally grows clover, potatoes, corn, and vegetables.  Her husband transports passengers around local villages.Their joint monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Cholpon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Cholpon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, etc. to cook rice and sauce for sale.

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is 35 years old from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with three children. For 13 years now, he has been farming rice for an income. He is also into habal-habal (motorcycle service for remote places) transportation services. This barely earn him 2,000 PHP per month. For a family of five, he is struggling to keep both ends meet. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. Renante is determined to work hard for his family.

His hope is to send his children to school until they graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, salt, onion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luis José

texts.es:
Luis es un campesino de 60 años de edad, humilde y trabajador. Durante muchos años se ganó la vida trabajando en una litografía pero, cuando se terminó su contrato, decidió dedicarse a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno y porcino, con unos ahorros que tenía organizó los corrales y las cocheras para tener los animales cerca de su casa, sus principales clientes son otros ganaderos de la zona y también los ofrece en la feria de ganado; así ha generado los ingresos suficientes para sostener a su familia durante los últimos 12 años.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará dos lechones y cuido por bultos, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y aumentar la producción, así tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar los ingresos por venta y satisfacer la demanda actual.
Luis manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es pensionarse y así darle continuidad a su labor, pues se siente útil y alegre haciendo lo que le apasiona, con ello logrará mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su único hijo, por quien ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlo adelante.
texts.en: Luis is a 60 year old farmer who is modest and hard-working. For many years he made his living working in a lithographer's but when his contract was up he decided to raise and sell cattle and pigs. With savings he built the corrals and  sheds to keep the animals close to his house. His main clients are other ranchers in the area and he also sells them at a livestock market. So he has been able to  generate sufficient revenues to support his family through the past 12 years. With the loan Luis will buy two piglets and bulk feed.
