This will allow him to continue his labor and increase his production and have the possibility of increased revenues through sales. Plus he can satisfy current customer demand. Luis manifests that his dream is to get his pension and continue with his labor, as he feels useful and happy doing what he loves. Doing so he will improve the quality of living for his wife and one son, who he has fought to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and bulk feed.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura vive con su mamá, comenta que su objetivo principal es terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión para poder ayudar a su mamá en el negocio que ella tiene, el cual es una farmacia.
Laura está estudiando para ser técnica en farmacia, ya que de esa forma podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y a la vez ayudar a su mama en su negocio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de título y gastos de manutención. Agradece por esta oportunidad de seguir creciendo que recibe, con lo cual podrá ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Laura lives with her mother. She says that her main goal is to finish her education and to practice her profession in order to help her mother with her business which is a pharmacy.

Laua is studying to be a pharmacy technician because that way she can improve her living conditions and at the same time help her mother in her business. She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in graduation fees and living expenses. She is grateful for this opportunity she receives to continue growing so she can be somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees and living expenses

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина молодая активная жительница района Кубадиён. В свои 24 года она уже имеет свой бизнес. Зарина занимается животноводством. Она пока не замужем и живет с отцом, матерью и двумя сестрами в одном доме. Зарина научилась профессии животновода у своего отца. Она очень любит животных и получает удовольствие когда ухаживает за ними. Зарина занимается выращиванием бычков вот уже два года. По ее словам это бизнес, приносящий стабильный доход. И сейчас она хотела бы увеличить поголовье скота для развития бизнеса. Для осуществления этой Зарина просит кредит. Она намерена закупить пару молодых бычков для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Она в душе надеется, что ей окажут поддержки.
texts.en: Zarina is a young, active resident of the Qubadiyon District. At 24 years old, she already has her own business. Zarina practices livestock breeding. She is not yet married and lives with her father, mother, and two sisters in one house. Zarina learned the profession of livestock breeding from her father. She really loves animals and enjoys looking after them. Zarina has been raising bull calves for two years already. According to her, it is a business which brings in a stable income. Now she would like to increase the size of her herd in order to develop her business. In order to accomplish this goal, Zarina is requesting a loan. She is determined to buy a pair of young bull calves to fatten them up and resell them in the future. She wholeheartedly hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy a pair of bull calves to fatten up and resell.

loans.name: Robereta

texts.en:
Robereta is 35 years old from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four children ages one to 18. She and her family are engaged in fishing and farming. Her business has been in existence for 16 years now, earning her 9000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy fish net and fertilizer. She is determined to make sure that her children have a good education out of her income. 

She would like to continue her business so she can provide well for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fish net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, jeans, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида умная, насчитанная, добрая, верная жена и мать четверых детей. Хамида с семей живет на района Шахритуз. Хамиде 47 лет и много лет своей жизни она посвятила деятельности скотоводства. Она с детства любила ухаживать за скотами, и ей нравилось проводить время на скотном дворе. В последнее время ее увлечение стала ее работой и выгодным бизнесом. Она начала разводить скотов. На сегодняшний день у нее малое количество скотов и Хамида решила обратиться за кредитом. На заемные деньги она намерена купить телят и увеличить поголовья скота. Она надеется, что с увеличением скотин увеличиться и доходность от бизнеса, тогда она сможет внести в семейный бюджет значительную помощь.
texts.en: Hamida is an intelligent, dependable, kind and faithful wife and a mother of four children. Hamida and her family live in the Shahrituz District. Hamida is 47 years old and has dedicated many years of her life to cattle breeding. From childhood, she loved to look after cattle and liked to spend time in the barnyard. Recently, her passion has become her job and a profitable business. She began to raise cattle. Today, she has a small amount of cattle. Hamida decided to apply for a loan. With the borrowed money, she is determined to buy calves and increase the size of her herd. She hopes that the increase in cattle will increase the profitability of her business. Then she will be able to substantially assist their family budget.

loans.use: to buy calves and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Basal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Basal and is composed of six women. The president of the group is A`aisha. She is 30 years old, married, and has children. She works in selling vegetables and fruits. She lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She will use the loan to buy onions, tomatoes, apples, oranges, and other items for her business, and in this way, will increase her working capital and improve her business. 

Her reason for applying for this loan is lack of capital. She faces challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family. She hopes to expand her business to a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, apples, oranges, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plates, cups, spoons, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia de 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, ambos buscan mejorar su situación económica y forma de vida, su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de quesillos, en la cual tiene una antigüedad de 8 años, la señora se provee de insumos de los productores de leche por la zona donde vive, de esta manera genera sus ingresos con la comercialización de quesillos, es una persona responsable y con muchas ganas de superarse, además su pareja le ayuda y juntos buscan el bienestar de su familia. Ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de muebles y enseres para su hogar, ya que no cuenta con los muebles necesarios y quiere ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones para poder vivir de manera más cómoda y así satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Lidia is 31 years old. She is single and lives with her partner, and has two children who depend on her income. They are both searching to improve their financial situation and lifestyle. 

Her main activity is making and selling cheese and she has been doing this for 8 years. She gets her supplies from the dairy farmers in the area where she lives, thus earning income by selling cheese. She is a responsible person who is eager to succeed, and her partner helps her as together they seek the welfare of their family.

Now she is asking for a loan in order to buy furniture and appliances because she does not have the necessary furniture and she wants to provide her family better conditions in order to live more comfortably and meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy furniture and appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Al-Wala Group

texts.en:
Al-Wala is a group that is composed of four women. They are from Taiz, Yemen, and work together to help one another. They are hardworking, enterprising women who do not give up easily. Currently, they are requesting a loan of 200,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB in order to increase their business levels. 

Noura is the leader of the group. She is 30 years old and a married woman. She has been selling incenses and perfumes to customers for one year, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. Her business has helped her to provide for her family. 

She is turning to AMB to request a loan of 50,000 YER because she has orders and would like to be able to fulfill them for her customers. She would like to buy incenses and perfumes, which will increase her profit and offer a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Esperanza En Fe 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her loan group, "Esperanza en Fe" (Hope in Faith) 3. Her group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a rugged, lush area with a nascent tourism industry where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her extended family.

Maria is looking forward to taking her 15th loan from Esperanza. She is excited about the opportunity to expand her business, through several years of taking loans from Esperanza. She sells charcoal and oil. Maria plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.  She will use the profits to make her home more livable and to fulfill the needs of her husband and their three children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and other products like oil

loans.name: Ramón Elías

texts.es:
Ramón, a sus 52 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos por quienes ha luchado constantemente para que nada les falte.
Vivía en Manizales, donde se desempeñaba como mayordomo en diferentes fincas, pero, debido a la violencia e inconvenientes de orden público que se presentaban en la zona, tuvo que trasladarse para otra ciudad, en busca de nuevas oportunidades para sacar adelante a su familia.
Ya radicado en su nuevo hogar, conoció y aprendió la actividad de fabricación y comercialización de productos de aseo para el hogar, fue así como comenzó su nuevo negocio desde hace varios años y, hoy en día se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su familia; adicionalmente vende comidas preparadas, fritos, helados y otros productos, con el fin de complementar los ingresos familiares, trabaja solo todos los días en un horario de 7 am a 8 pm.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos y materia prima al por mayor (material de empaque, químicos y envases plásticos), esto le permitirá darle continuidad a su labor y podrá aumentar su producción, así podrá cumplir con la demanda actual y mejorar los ingresos.
Ramón manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad a su negocio y posicionarlo en el mercado, para que le garantice una mayor rentabilidad y le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ramón is 52 years old, married and father of two children who he constantly strives to ensure they lack nothing. He lived in Manizales where he worked as a foreman on various farms. But due to the violence and breakdown of public security that occurred in the area he had to move to another city in order to find new opportunities to support his family. Once settled into his new home, he learned about the making and sale of home cleaning products. And so he began his new business several years ago. Today it has become his unique source of income to support his family. Also he sells prepared foods, fries, ice-cream and other products with the goal of complimenting the family's income. He works every day from 7 am until 8 pm. 

Ramón will use the loan to buy supplies and raw materials wholesale (packing material, chemicals and plastic containers). This will permit him to continue with his work and to increase his production so he can cover the actual demand and increase his revenues. Ramón says that his biggest dream is to make his business sustainable and position it in the market to guarantee him a higher profit and allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials wholesale (packing material, chemicals and plastic containers).

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Acción está en su ciclo 23 con la Fundación Paraguaya, es un grupo antiguo que gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de todas están creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Todas luchan por sus familias para poder darles lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La  Sra. Nilda es empleada y también se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, con lo cual tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Gracias a su esfuerzo diario sumado al apoyo de sus compañeras ella está mejorando sus ingresos y ayuda a sus seres queridos. Comenta que su sueño es poder tener un local estable donde poder seguir con sus ventas y también dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras frescas para la venta, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorando su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The group called, "Mujeres en Acción" [Women in Action], is in its 23rd cycle with "Fundación Paraguaya." It is an older group that is growing and improving their living conditions thanks to the efforts and sacrifices of all. They all fight for their families in order to give them what they could not have. 

Nilda is a housekeeper and also works selling fruits and vegetables. With this revenue, she is able to help her family. Thanks to her daily efforts coupled with the support from her friends, she is improving her income and helping her loved ones. She says that her dream is to be able to have an established shop where she could continue her sales and give her loved ones what she could not have. She is applying for this loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. This will allow her to continue growing and improving her business plan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Isidro está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde una de las personas que se destaca es la Sra. Blanca, una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, comenta que todos los días se levanta muy temprano a traer los helados que vende desde su proveedor.
Tiene muy buena venta, en especial en los días de verano, y que gracias a su trabajo tiene un ingreso extra para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos. Ella quiere seguir trabajando ya que de ello dependen muchas personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados variados, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Isidro Group is in its first cycle of the committee for women program, where one of the people that stands out is Blanca, a self-sacrificing and hardworking woman. She says that every day she gets up very early to get the ice cream she sells from her provider.

She has very good sales, especially during the summer, and thanks to her work she has extra income in order to support her family and her loved ones. She wants to continue working as many people depend on her.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of various kinds of ice cream in order to continue her sales, fighting to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: La Confianza 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of the “La Confianza” (Trust) 1 Group.  She is the mother of two children who live with her and her long-term partner in one of the slum neighborhoods located in the north of Santo Domingo. She is very excited to receive her sixth loan with Esperanza International.

Santa has had her business for around five years. She started it with some savings she had. She used a little bit of capital to buy miscellaneous products and started selling from her house and by walking around. After some years of doing business, she needs to invest more capital in her business so she attended the Esperanza International program in her community. 

Santa is planning to use her new loan to purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry, and other products. She will use her business profits to continue investing in her business and to save for her future plans. She will achieve her dream of having a successful business and stable income to support her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes and other products

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Victoria está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona bien rural, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas al por menor de víveres entre otras opciones, la cual  sale también por las noches a trabajar en su carrito de venta de lomitos y panchos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, yerbas, fideos y demás insumos, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The group La Victoria (Victory) is in its fifth loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is from the city of Concepción, which is a zone that is some distance from the center and is still growing. It is a very rural zone, and so the members of this group want to work to continue growing and give the zone where they live a better environment and have it continue growing slowly.

Señor Maria is one of the members. She is from a zone some distance from the same center of the city where she has her little retail business selling groceries, among other items. She also goes out in the evenings to work selling steak sandwiches and hot dogs from her little sales cart. She is a very hard-working and sacrificing woman.

She is applying for this loan to buy rice, oil, herbs, pasta, and other supplies, and in this way be able to continue growing and improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, herbs, pasta, and other supplies.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustin vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, cuenta con escasos recursos económicos y además tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando a los cuales ayuda y mantiene económicamente, vive con su esposa y trabaja en su actividad agrícola y pecuaria desde muy joven, contrata personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas que son sus vecinos, su casa está construida de adobe no tiene obra fina por dentro y además no tiene muchos muebles y enseres,  actualmente trabaja de forma tradicional utilizando sus yuntas, todavía no utiliza la tecnología agrícola, como no tiene muchos recursos, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno ya que pretende aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Agustin lives in a rural part of the Province of Tiraque. He has limited economic resources and also has four children who are studying who he helps and supports economically. He lives with his wife and has worked in agriculture and livestock raising since he was young. He hires neighbors as casual labor to plant and harvest his crops. His house is made of adobe with no fine workmanship inside, with scant furnishings and belongings. He works in the traditional method using his oxen. He does not use modern farming techniques as he doesn't have the resources. He needs a loan to buy cattle so he can increase his revenues to improve the family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 49 years old, married, and has three children. Her primary source of income comes from a farming business. She also manages a hog raising business. With her determination to get ahead in life, she decided to request a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to make the business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise for her hog business

loans.name: Rosell

texts.en: Rosell is 37 years old and lives in Bongabong Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is happily married with 2 adult-aged children. Rosell requested a loan to buy materials like seaweed seedlings, bottles, ties, etc. for guso, or seaweed production.  She has been running this business for five years now. Rosell hopes to save for retirement and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for guso, or seaweed production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a copier machine, air-conditioner, table and chair and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre trabajador y organizado, a sus 34 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un taller de litografía que inició hace varios años; el oficio lo aprendió desde hace 14 años, gracias a las enseñanzas de una familiar que siempre ha trabajado en este gremio; allí aprendió algunos procesos y posteriormente se le presentó la oportunidad de independizarse; comenzando con una máquina pequeña que compró de segunda mano; poco a poco fue adquiriendo más clientes y su negocio se fue consolidando; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para brindar a su único hijo adolescente una buena educación y sustento diario.
Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos al por mayor (tintas, papel, cartón) y además tendrá capital para trabajar de manera holgada, esto le permitirá tener más variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes; además podrá dar crédito a aquellos clientes constantes, lo que le ayudará a fidelizarlos y así tener mejores ingresos.
Roberto manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es acreditar y posicionar bien su negocio en el mercado, logrando reconocimiento y permanencia en el tiempo, pues de esta forma estará en la capacidad de garantizar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y podrá brindar educación universitaria a su hijo, para que sea un profesional íntegro y exitoso.
texts.en:
Roberto, 34, is a hardworking and organized man.  He earns a living with his own business, a print shop he started several years ago.  He learned the trade 14 years ago thanks to a relative who had always worked in that profession.  There Roberto learned some processes and later had the opportunity to go out on his own.  He started with a small second-hand machine and little by little acquired more customers.  He strengthened his business and managed to earn enough income to support his teenage son and give him a good education. 

With the support of the loan Roberto will buy supplies wholesale (ink, paper, and cardboard).  He'll also have the capital to work more comfortably and have a greater variety available for his customers.  He'll also be able to extend credit to his regular customers, helping make them loyal and earning more income for himself.

Roberto said his biggest desire is to position his business well in the marketplace so he can earn recognition and have longevity.  Consequently he'll ensure a better quality of life for his family and be able to give his son a college education, making him an upstanding and successful professional.

loans.use: to buy ink, paper, and cardboard wholesale

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Mendbayar, 34-years-old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling hats to local people since 2009. Her husband raises livestock for a living. She, together with her friend, runs a barbershop, sharing rent fees and profits. The house they live in has deteriorated so she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, planks and fiberglass to renovate her house.  After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integran este grupo llamado Emprendedoras, donde todas por su esfuerzo y lucha ya están en el noveno ciclo del programa de comité. Ellas además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación como un medio de poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende cosméticos, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus cosméticos de variadas marcas, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y así a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
17 women make up the group called "Emprendedoras" where their efforts and struggles have brought them to the ninth cycle with this program committee. They are also working on a survey on the elimination of poverty as a way to know the life situation of each woman and thus be able to improve their lives. 

One of the members is Maria who demonstrated a poverty level within the third class during her last survey. This means that through efforts, steady work, and applying vital behaviors of a successful woman, she can improve her poverty situation. Similarly, she is aware that work and efforts should be done in a continuous and permanent manner to ultimately be success and provide a better life for her family. 

Her job includes selling cosmetics. The consultant work should also be noted. They continuously monitor training and verification that somehow requires and also encourages the women to fight to escape poverty. Maria is applying for this loan to buy cosmetics from various brands. This will help her to finalize her business plan and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy assorted cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 73-years-old, married with five children and a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She generates money through her mini sari-sari store. Retailing helps Corazon and her family to survive life to the fullest. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan to purchase farm inputs and fruit tree seedlings. She wants to cultivate their little parcel of land to make a living.

Corazon deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fruit tree seedlings

loans.name: Maria Donabel

texts.en:
Maria Donabel, 42 years old, is from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is married with two children who are six and ten years old. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Maria Donabel has been raising hogs for four years now to earn a living.

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed and piglets. She wants to make her business big someday so she can make a success out of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth is 61 years old, and has finished her primary school studies. She is married and currently lives with her spouse and three grown-up children in a small village in Baray, Kampong Thom province. She works in agriculture, sowing rice on her two-hectare farmland, and earns additional income from making and selling rattan products.

With the loan, she will be able to make improvements to her sanitation practices, since she currently doesn’t have a safe latrine at home. She will build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Yeth is encouraged to create healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Erika Francelly

texts.es: Erika es una joven mujer que ha trabajado en fábricas de confecciones, pero ahora es independiente y confecciona blusas, camisas para hombre y otras prendas. Erika quiere invertir su crédito en la compra de una máquina plana, con el fin de optimizar el tiempo de producción y mejorar la calidad de las prendas que elabora, además de generar empleo. Su sueño es acreditar su negocio e incrementar los ingresos de la familia, así como mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Erika is a young woman who has worked in sewing factories, but now she is independent and makes blouses, shirts for men, and other clothing items. Erika wants to invest her loan in the purchase of a flatbed sewing machine, with the goal of optimizing her production time and improving the quality of the garments that she makes, in addition to generating employment. Her dream is to establish her business in the market and increase her family's income, as well as improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a flatbed sewing machine

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano es  de la zona de San Lorenzo,  son 17 integrantes  muy responsables todas participaron de la eliminación de pobreza en el año, haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen para poder ayudarse.
Mirtha es miembro del grupo, y también es la presidenta, ella es una persona muy optimista y positiva que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Cuenta que se dedica a hacer comidas de todo tipo, y que por medio de ese trabajo ayuda a su familia. Mirtha pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser harina, arroz, fideos, condimentos para las comidas  carnes, sal, y de esa forma seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The "San Cayetano" communal bank is from the San Lorenzo area and is composed of 17 very responsible persons who all participate in the Elimination of Poverty year. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight Program survey to be able to improve their living conditions. All of them are responsible and hard-working mothers who get together to help each other.

Mirtha is a member of the group and is also the President. She is a very positive and optimistic person who always tries to motivate her companions to continue growing as they have been doing. She says that she prepares foods of all types and through this work supports her family. Mirtha is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of  ingredients for her meals such as flour, rice, pasta, spices for the meat dishes and  salt. Then she can continue to work and struggle.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, pasta, spices for the meat dishes, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es de una familia humilde, comenta que su meta es poder recibirse y ser un gran profesional y poder salir adelante por propios méritos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Es soltero,  periodista radial y fotógrafo y también está estudiando la carrera de Ciencia de la educación para el desarrollo.
Pide este préstamo para poder usarlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, ya que está por terminar la carrera y quiere cubrir ese gasto para seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de estudiar.
texts.en: Ramon is from a humble family. He comments that his goal is to study and become a professional and be able to get ahead on his own merits to help his family. He is single, a journalist and photographer. He is also studying  Developmental Education. He is requesting a loan to pay his tuition fees as he is ready to complete his degree and wants to cover these expenses to continue with his studies. He is grateful for this opportunity to study.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is an industrious mother who helps her husband in generating income. She is 44 years old and has four school-age children. The couple plans to improve their sources of living in order to earn a higher income.

Mila plans to have continuous growth of her business buying and selling native snails and vegetables. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more native snails and vegetables to sell. She believes that her loan will make it possible for her to improve the business as well as their status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more native snails and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 38 years old and comes from Trinidad, Bohol. She is into farming and fishing to support her family. Together with her husband, she has eight children ages 2-18. She and her husband help each other in tilling the land, hoping for a good harvest. Both farming and fishing are hard work; the farming needs to be done in the daytime while fishing is more productive at night. 

Rosalina applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be used to buy fertilizer and fish net. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption, school fees and future business investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fish net

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Ramon está en el 1er ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que se ha unido con el objetivo de poder luchar y mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una.
Una persona digna de destacar es Alejandra, quien se dedica a la venta de postres dulces que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de forma ambulante. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, ya que se levanta a hacer sus postres frescos. Comenta también que con su trabajo ayuda a su familia, y trata de ayudarles en todo.
Alejandra pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus postres, como ser harina, dulce de leche, huevos, azúcar y demás, y de esa forma seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The San Ramon group is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group that formed with the goal of being able to work hard and improve the living conditions of each member.
 
One person worthy of mention is Alejandra, who sells desserts that she herself makes and then goes out to sell as a street vendor. She comments that her work is very demanding, since every day she begins to work at a very early hour, since she gets up to make her desserts fresh. She also comments that with her work she helps her family and that she tries to help them in everything.

Alejandra is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies for her desserts, such as flour, dulce de leche, eggs, sugar, and other items, and in the way continue working and striving.

loans.use: to buy flour, dulce de leche, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients to make desserts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Goudy

texts.fr:
Madame GOUDY est une dame de 53 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques et divers et  cela depuis 5 ans .Elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants dont le plus agé à 27ans et le plus jeune 25ans. Elle est responsable de famille et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter  du parfum, des poudres pour bébé des crèmes, du lait pour le corps, du beurre de karité...Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 19h. les bénéfices lui permettent de pouvoir diversifier les produits et services et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Goudy is a 53-year-old woman who has been active in selling cosmetics and various items for five years. She is married and has four children, of which the oldest is 27 and the youngest is 25. She is responsible for the family and helps her husband with the daily expenses. With this loan, she is going to buy perfumes, baby powder, creams, lotions, and shea butter. She begins her day at 7AM and finishes at 7PM. The profits will allow her to diversify her products and services and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and women's items for resale

loans.name: Randy Pol

texts.en:
Randy Pol is 31 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child. 

Randy Pol has been engaged in managing a little sari-sari store together with his wife for two years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Presently, he is an elected Barangay Official in their community. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional grocery products, consumable goods and soft drinks for retail. Randy Pol has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Randy Pol hopes to expand their little business.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery products, consumable goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 49 years old, married and has six children.  Five of her children are in school.

Monina is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Monina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

Monina has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Monina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with four children.

Janice works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janice has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and earns additional income from food vending and e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Janice aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a van, equipment, permits and uniforms for the start-up of his business.

loans.name: Laiheng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Laiheng is a mother of three dependent kids who really need her support, as one is too young for schooling while the remaining two are in school. The main sources of her family income are from a silk weaving business and a fishing business. 

Laiheng has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, and neither have her other five fellow members. All of them including Laiheng are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy raw silk and to pay for the labor costs that help to dye the color of her silk. 

Laiheng hopes that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can expand her business and keep her kids in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy raw silk and to pay for the labor costs that help to dye the color of her silk

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelves, baskets, a scale, and stock (fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Mory

texts.fr:
Mory est un jeune enseignant qui vient solliciter les services de l’IMCEC afin de bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui servira à payer ses frais d’inscription à l’Université. Mory est entré dans l’enseignement depuis 5 ans, refusant catégoriquement d’être un diplômé au chômage, il a préféré intégrer l’enseignement, en attendant de trouver autre chose qui l’intéresse plus et d’augmenter ses diplômes et performances intellectuelles.
Mory est célibataire et habite avec ses parents et ses frères et sœurs, il donne sa participation pour la dépense quotidienne de toute la famille.
Le crédit aura un impact positif sur lui, puisqu’il lui a permis de payer ses frais de scolarité, de mettre un peu d’argent de coté, et de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Mory désire construire sa propre maison, fonder un foyer et y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Mory is a young teacher who has come to seek support from IMCEC (a Kiva field partner) in order to benefit from a credit which will serve to pay for his university enrollment costs. Mory has been a teacher for five years and, having categorically refused to be an unemployed graduate, preferred to become a teacher while waiting to find something else which interests him more, all the while expanding his studies and intellectual performance. Mory is unmarried and lives with his parents and siblings. He uses his wages to help with the entire family's daily expenses. This loan will have a positive impact on him because it allows him to pay for his school fees, save a little bit of money, and improve his family's food situation.
Mory wants to build his own house, establish a household, and house his family.

loans.use: To pay for university enrollment fees

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata s’active dans le commerce depuis une dizaine d’années. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans un village qui s’est développé au fil du temps, grâce à ses habitants immigrés qui reviennent investir dans la zone. 
Aminata fait du commerce de divers : habits, sacs, produits cosmétiques…Elle travaille de 7h du matin à 18h de l’après-midi. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’honorer une commande de chaussures, de tissus et de produits cosmétiques. 
Madame Aminata a une grande responsabilité envers ses enfants, c’est elle qui en a la charges, et c’est grâce au crédit qu’elle arrive à être à la hauteur : à leur payer la scolarité et a améliorer leur conditions alimentaires.
Aminata voudrait ouvrir un magasin de prêt à porter si elle voit son capital augmenter.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata has been active in commerce for almost ten years. She is a married mother of a family. She lives in a town that has developed over time, thanks to immigrants who have returned to invest in the area.
Aminata runs a business selling various items: clothes, bags, cosmetics, etc. She works from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening. She is seeking this loan in order to fulfill an order for shoes, fabric, and cosmetics.
Ms. Aminata has a strong duty towards her children, as she is the one taking care of them, and thanks to loans she has been able to rise to the challenge of paying for their education and improving their food situation.
Aminata would like to open a ready-to-wear clothing store if she sees her capital increase.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, bags, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Teresia

texts.fr:
Teresia is 37 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. She does farming business and it has been profitable. Her husband also provides additional income in the family. Right now her monthly income from her business is KES 25,000.

She will be using the loan to buy cattle feed and fertilizer. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and save for the education of her children.

Her hopes and dreams in future are to buy another cow and educate her children up to tertiary level.
texts.en:
Teresia is 37 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. She does a farming business, and it has been profitable. Her husband also provides additional income in the family. Right now, her monthly income from her business is KES 25,000.

She will be using the loan to buy cattle feed and fertilizer. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and save for the education of her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy another cow and educate her children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and farm inputs like fertilizer.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 58 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Cristita earns a living from the income of their parcel of cocoland. Presently, she is also an elected Barangay Official in their community. She is earning an approximate amount of not less than 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovations.

Cristita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future Cristita hopes to acquire an additional parcel of cocoland.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovations

loans.name: Manerson

texts.en:
Manerson joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and he appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. He is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

Manerson engages in a hog raising activity for which he is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000. This loan is intended to purchase additional feed and piglets.

Manerson dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Adriana Cecilia

texts.es:
Adriana, a sus 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo de 17 años. Trabajadora y activa, comenzó su vida laboral desempeñándose como empleada en diferentes empresas de confección, allí aprendió todo el manejo de este tipo de negocios por medio de la observación y, cuando tuvo la posibilidad de independizarse, tomó la decisión y en compañía de su esposo, montó su propio taller de confección a terceros, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7 am a 6 pm o dependiendo del volumen de trabajo que tengan pendiente; así han logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá ajustar el dinero para comprar una máquina ojaladora digital, con la que estará en la capacidad de optimizar los tiempos de producción y aumentar su eficiencia, así podrán cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos, fidelizando sus clientes actuales y atrayendo nuevos proveedores.
Adriana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, para que sea más rentable y le brinde la posibilidad de adquirir su casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida junto a su familia, además desea brindar a su hijo la posibilidad de tener estudios universitarios para que sea un profesional íntegro y exitoso.
texts.en: Adriana is 44 years old, married, and mother of one 17-year-old son. She is hardworking and active. She started her work life as an employee in various sewing companies where she learned everything about running this type of business by observing. When presented with the opportunity to become independent, she and her husband made the decision to start their own third-party dressmaking shop. She works Monday through Saturday from 7:00 AM until 6:00 PM depending on the volume of work that she has pending. Thus she has been able to make enough income to cover her living expenses. With the help of this loan, she could come up with the money to buy a digital buttonhole machine. This will optimize production time and increase efficiency so she can make a timely delivery of orders, build loyalty with existing customers and attract new suppliers. Adriana says that her greatest wish is to expand her business to make it more profitable and afford her with the possibility of buying her own home. Thus she can enjoy a more comfortable and improved quality of life with her family. She also hopes to afford her son with the opportunity to study at a university so that he can become an honest and successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a digital buttonhole machine.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Kuña Aty está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que tienen ingresos muy bajos, pero deben seguir esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Constancia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, pero ella a través de su esfuerzo y por medio de la venta de productos de belleza que hace, sumado también a la venta de plásticos está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia con los ingresos que con sacrificio está obteniendo. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que quiere seguir capacitándose para poder mejorar su vida.
La Sra. Constancia con préstamo quiere comprar productos de bellezas variados para poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program, where all the members work and help each other to advance. They are doing the survey on the elimination of poverty, where 10 of the members are below the poverty line, that is, they have very low income, but they need to continue striving to improve.

One of the members is Señora Constancia, who in the latest survey demonstrated a level of poverty within the first level. But through her effort and by means of the sales of beauty products that she makes, in addition to the sale of plastics, she is making progress and helping her family with the income that she is obtaining with her sacrifice. She is a very hard-working person who wants to continue receiving training to be able to improve her life.

With the loan, Señora Constancia wants to buy various beauty products to be able to continue with her sales, improving her business plan.

loans.use: to buy various beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita previously accessed a loan of 30,000 PHP that she used to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like bags, umbrellas, towels, bed sheets, etc. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Pablita would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as bags, umbrellas, towels, bed sheets, etc. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pablita hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products such as bags, umbrellas, towels, bed sheets, etc

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 50 years old from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with seven children ages 4-16. For five years now, Rosalinda has been selling home-cooked snacks like pancakes, rice cakes and bread. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy brown sugar, cooking oil and flour. She is optimistic about the impact of additional capital for her business. She hopes that someday her children will be successful with their education.

loans.use: to buy brown sugar, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Amon Group

texts.en:
Amon is a group of four poor women from Al-Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER to improve their businesses. Safia, a 39-year-old married woman, lives with her children in a small house in Al-Hodeidah city. She said that her husband is unable to cover all their household expenses. So she decided to work and earn money to cover the needs of her children. 

Safia is a door-to-door women's clothing saleswoman. She sells "dera'a", a traditional Yemeni dress. She has earned a good profit from this business, so she decided to purchase more clothes and target new clients. Therefore, she asked for a loan in the amount of 30,000 YER. She looks forward to opening a clothing store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to attract more clients.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: A widowed mother of two kids residing in Kampong Cham province, Phally earns a living via her grocery selling business, which she has run since she was 23 years old. Phally is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of three to get a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each while the remaining borrower is seeking 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her business on time with a good income in return.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San cayetano está en su  9no ciclo  del programa de comité, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 20 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que en su última encuesta de eliminación de pobreza mostraron indicador por debajo de lo mínimo, por lo que deben esforzarse un poco más.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Pablina, quien tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar, peo que hoy en día ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre acude a su negocio. Su meta es poder mejorar su despensa y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden, a la vez que también ayuda a su familia con los ingresos que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Cayetano" is in its 9th loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees.  They are participating in the Poverty Elimination survey, and 3 of the 20 members of the group have been found to be below the poverty line.  That is to say that their last Poverty Elimination survey showed an indicator that they were below the minimum, and so they must exert themselves a bit more.

One of the members of this group is Pablina, who has a small, well-stocked store that she started up with a lot of sacrifice.  She now has a good set of regular customers who always come to her business.  Her goal is to improve her store so that she can continue to give her customers what they are asking for and also help her family with the income that she obtains.

She is requesting this loan to invest in drinks, foodstuffs, canned goods, dairy products, bakery goods, and other items.  This way she can stock up her store and continue to strive to improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
37-year-old Rose is engaged in rice farming in her native town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a driver. She is motivated to work hard because of her three children ages 5-10. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm and food for her family. Rose can only hope that she will be successful in raising her children specially in giving them a proper education.

In the future, she hopes to have other business opportunities so she will earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and food for her family

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and lives in Napo, San Juan, Siquijor. In order to help the family, she sells a variety of goods. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2013, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. 

Marilou wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 8,000 PHP to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and help to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages and soft drinks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia de 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo que está estudiando y depende de sus ingresos, su principal actividad y fuente de ingreso es la elaboración y venta de quesillos a esta actividad se dedica desde hace 10 años, se provee de insumos de los productores de leche por la zona donde actualmente vive, es una persona responsable, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superarse, su pareja los abandono pero ello le dio fuerzas para salir adelante, como no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos solicita un crédito para la compra de muebles y enseres para su hogar, ya que les hace mucha falta y de esta manera podrá vivir de manera más cómoda y lograra satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su hijo.
texts.en: Claudia is 33 years old, is single and has a son who is studying and depends on her income. Her main activity and source of income is the production and sale of fresh cheese. She has worked doing this for 10 years. She gets the inputs from the milk producers of the area where she currently lives. She is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to move forward. Her domestic partner abandoned them, but this motivated her even more to keep on going. Since she does not have the financial resources, she is requesting a loan to buy furniture and household goods for her home, because they really need them. In this way she will be able to live more comfortably and satisfy her needs and those of her son's.

loans.use: To buy furniture and household goods for her home

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. Analiza is married and has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maichelle

texts.en:
Maichelle is 31 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school. Maichelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Maichelle has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maichelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more peppers, oil, onions, Vita, rice, etc., to increase her sales.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan muy sacrificadamente para mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para que por medio de ella puedan conocer como se encuentran en un aspecto general en sus vidas y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juliana quien hace comidas variadas para la venta, comenta que hace todo tipo de comidas que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando para poder continuar ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo, y también el día de mañana quiere tener un local para vender sus comidas y que no tenga que sacrificarse para venderlos de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, y demás productos con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo las delicias que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Renacer (Rebirth) group is in its 17th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where all the members work with great sacrifice to improve their lives. They are doing the survey on the elimination of poverty, so that through it they can know where they are in their lives in a general sense and be able to work accordingly.

One of the members is Señora Juliana, who makes various foods to sell. She comments that she makes every type of food, which she then goes out to sell as a street vendor. Her dream is to continue working to be able to continue helping her family as she has been doing, and in the future she also wants to have a shop to sell her foods, so that she won't have to sacrifice herself to selling them as a street vendor.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various ingredients for her foods, such as greens, condiments, vegetables, and other products, with which she will be able to continue making the delicacies that she offers her customers.

loans.use: to buy greens, condiments, vegetables, and other products to make food to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Despite her early marriage, Gloria didn’t end up with her dream in life. Instead, her situation pushes her to strive harder in order to succeed. Gloria is in her 40s and has three children. Through the patience and hard work of her and her husband, they fully supported their first child's studies. Now, her first child is working as a nurse. Gloria’s husband is a driver for a local government unit while she runs her variety store in her village. 

Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy beverages, soap, shampoo, conditioner, and powdered milk. She hopes that her business will further improve through her requested loan. Her goal now is to expand the products she sells and earn a bigger income. She will use her profit for the education of her children to finish their studies and to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soap, shampoo, conditioner, and powdered milk for her general store

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina, 50 years old, is married and has nine children, three of whom are still attending high school and college. Rizalina is doing her best to give her family a better way of living. She is engaged in a hog raising business within their village. To earn additional income, she is also engaged in selling cosmetic products around their village. Rizalina is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy lotion, lipstick, intimate apparel and fragrances to keep her businesses profitable. She hopes to succeed with her business and with her living situation.

loans.use: to buy lotion, lipstick, intimate apparel and fragrances

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Helen earns a living from her salary as the School Principal in one of the Elementary Schools in their municipality. She is also earning an income from their parcel of cocoland. She is earning an approximate amount of not less than 15,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations. 

Helen has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future Helen hopes to engage in business to add to their family income.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovations

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes to be more successful in life and dreams of having a longer life to see her grandchildren. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As the married parent of six children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a crafts business making shells in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling fish. Norma is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more shells to sell for her business.

Norma has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shells to sell

loans.name: Cathylin

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cathylin works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Cathylin is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, etc for her general store business.

Cathylin has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
KHSR-011625-001
Srey Mom is 57 years old and a widow with four children who lives in Siem Reap Province.  She is a waitress.  One of her children is a sculptor and another is a construction laborer in Thailand.  All of them can earn $9 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for loan of $800 to buy a sugarcane juice machine to squeeze sugarcane for clients. This loan will help her get more income for her family. 

She expects that her business can progress well.  Then she can buy pigs to breed.

loans.use: For buying a sugarcane juice machine to squeeze sugarcane for clients

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vangie dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 59 years of age, is engaged in the hog-raising business. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children.Two of their children are still studying.

Teresita is managing her hog-raising business well just to cover her family needs and let her children finish their studies.She plans to borrow additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Teresita believes that her requested loan will  improve her business involvement.

loans.use: to buy hog feed for the maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Dilma

texts.en: Dilma, 40 years old, is married and has three children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Dilma has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from fishing. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. to sell. Dilma has already borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. Elsie is married, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fishing equipment, like fishing nets, gasoline, etc.

Elsie has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fishing equipment, like fishing nets, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, chips, etc.

Raquel has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Raquel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, and chips

loans.name: Rene Aldubi

texts.es:
Rene de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado, la esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos,, con él vive su mamá y su papá, de él depende solo su esposa, Rene se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 15 años de desempeñarla, también es albañil, el trabajo lo aprendió por su papá, trabaja de 6 a 11 de la mañana.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar un terreno, para tener su ganado y poder cultivar. A futuro planea tener un terreno propio y así poder vivir en lo propio y poder tener sus animales y sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rene, age 21, went to school through the ninth grade.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to the domestic chores.  His mother and father live with him.  Only his wife is dependent upon him.

Rene has been farming for 15 years.  He is also a bricklayer.  He learned the work from his father.  He works from 6 until 11 in the morning.

He will use the loan to buy a piece of land for his livestock and to be able to cultivate the land.  In the future he plans to have his own piece of land.  This way he will be able to live on his own.  He will also be able to have his animals and his crops.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for his livestock and to be able to cultivate the land.

loans.name: Srey Leay

texts.en: Srey Leay is 33 years old, a married woman with four children who lives in Takeo Province. To earn a living, she works as a factory laborer and her husband works as a construction laborer. Both of them can earn $9 per day. Srey Leay would like to apply for loan of $700 to buy land for farming. This loan will help her to earn more income as well as to improve her standard of living. In the future, she hopes that she can harvest crops more than twice per year and her children can get their bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is 35 years old and married, with three children, in Takeo Province. She is a farmer, and her husband is a driver. Both of them can earn $9 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for loan of $600 to buy a rice harvester to harvest her field and to provide harvesting services to clients. 

This loan will help her in earning more income as well as in getting a better standard of living. In the future, she hopes that her business can be expanded, and her children can get a diploma.

loans.use: To buy a rice harvestor to harvest her field and provide harvesting services to clients

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia Rosario pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas en uno de los terminales terrestres de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende durante el día a sus clientes que le solicitan su mercaderia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar galletas, chicles, chocolates entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the "Patron de San Sebastian" Communal Bank in the city of Cusco. 

She continues to dedicates herself to her business, selling snacks in one of the bus terminals in the city of Cusco. Rosario is a responsible and diligent person. She sells during the day to the customers who request her merchandise. She has spent years in this business and it brings her satisfaction, both economic and personal. This is how she advances her family.

Rosario is requesting a loan to purchase cookies, chewing gum, and chocolates, among other items.

Rosario feels grateful for the loan and she promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy cookies, chewing gum, and chocolates, among other items, to sell.

loans.name: Jocylynda

texts.en:
Jocylynda operates a sari-sari store (general store) within her village.  She has four children, and her husband is a farmer. She established her business after she got married. Jocylynda has now been in this business for 14 years. She spends the income she generates from the business on her family's daily food expenditures and other household expenditures.

Jocylynda wishes to earn a higher income in order to let her children finish their studies. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy grocery items like beverages, canned goods, and breads. Jocylynda will do her best to improve her skills in selling as well as to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like beverages, canned goods, and breads for her variety store

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the materials needed for shoe and umbrella repair. Her loan helped not just her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her family.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy raw materials needed for shoe and umbrella repair. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie hopes to have another branch, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed for shoe and umbrella repair.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
Hing is a farmer who farms rice and cassava in Kampong Cham province where her residential area is. She is 33 years old and has one child. She has been involved in this current business for ages. 

Now, Hing leads a group of four to obtain a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,400,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Pheakdey's Group

texts.en:
Pheakdey, a young mother of three children, lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She strives for a living through rice farming and a porridge selling business. Both businesses have generated her about 18,300 KHR per day.  Pheakdey has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages. She has successfully repaid her past six loan cycles and her living conditions have gradually improved as a result of the positive impact of her past loans. 

Pheakdey is now teaming up with a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better income than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Bopha's Group
