texts.en: Bopha is 37 years old and a mother of two kids who are still in school. She and the rest of her family resides in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province where she does her rice cropping on two hectare of farmland and supplements her income with her fishing business. This is the third loan for Bopha and the second loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan, which she has repaid back, has enabled her to provide sufficient hygiene and food for her kids. Now, she formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer costs, insecticide and reaping costs. She hopes that she can support her business seasonally so that she can gain a good yield.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and reaping costs and purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling seashells and fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store.  Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of seashells and fish for her business.

Marites has sustained her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of seashells and fish

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Ernestina  posee un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace quince  años para  el sustento de su familia. 

Doña Gladys Ernestina se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7 am para preparar los mas riquísimos platillos que sus clientela le solicita,  finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar por mayor su mercadería tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, carnes de res y de pollo, especies para  así obtener mayor  ganancia  la que le ayudara  a realizar sus  sueños.
texts.en:
Gladys Ernestina has a business selling food products in markets around the city of Leon.  She has been dedicated to this business for the past fifteen years in order to support her family.  

Doña Gladys Ernestina commutes to her workplace at 6:00 am and opens her business at 7:00 am in order to prepare the best possible dishes at her customers' requests. She wraps up business at 5:30 pm from Monday to Saturday, and on Sundays at noon. 
 
The loan that she requested from Ceprodel will be used to buy her merchandise at wholesale - products such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oils, beef, chicken, and others-  which will enable her to earn a better living and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, oil, etc.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en: Sinuon is 32 years old, a married woman with two children (one of children is with her in the photo) from Takeo Province. She works in factory labour, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Both of them can earn $7 per day. Now she would like to apply for loan of $1300 for buying timber and roof zinc to build her house. This loan helps her to have better living conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can buy a sewing machine for opening a tailor shop.

loans.use: to buy timber and roof zinc to build her house.

loans.name: Oscar Guillermo

texts.es:
Oscar Guillermo  vive en la capital de Nicaragua trabaja como vigilante en una empresa .casado vive en una pequeña vivienda con su esposa y sus tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en edad escolar 
Está solicitando un crédito a kiva  para poder alistarles  a sus hijos uniformes. Zapatos, cuadernos, libros y  pago de matrículas ya que con el inicio del año escolar estos gastos son necesario para que sus hijos puedan asistir a la escuela  a recibir los conocimientos del saber para ser unos hombres de bien el día de mañana .
texts.en:
Oscar Guillermo lives in the capital of Nicaragua.  He works as a watchman for a company.  He is married, and he lives in a small house with his wife and their three children.  Two of the children go to school.

He is requesting a Kiva loan in order to be able to register his children for school; to buy the shoes, notebooks, and books; and to pay for their tuition.  With the start of the school year these are necessary expenses so that his children are able to go to school and get the knowledge they need to become good men in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 49 years old. He is married and lives in a Zamboanga del Sur with his four children and his wife. 

Abraham, a government employee, is planning to find a better job and become promoted in order to provide good financial support for his family. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his doctorate fees, and has therefore applied for this loan.

In the future, Abraham wants to become successful in his career.

loans.use: to pay for his doctorate fees

loans.name: Vedasto

texts.en:
Vedasto previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase fertilizer and other supplies for his farming business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in meeting their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for maintaining the farm. The profits from his business will  help him to sustain their daily needs and meet the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Vedasto hopes that his business will continue to flourish, and he dreams of giving his family a good life. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds, and tools for maintaining his farm.

loans.name: Jati Sari Group

texts.en:
The Jati Sari group is a women's group and has seven members. The group is located in Jati Luwih village, Tabanan, in the middle part of Bali. This is the first group in this area. The group consists of seven women who have the same business as pig breeders. Although they already have their main job, they run this business to supplement their families' incomes. Most of them work as farmers.

Ni Luh, as the head of the group, coordinated the group to have loans and training from MUK. They need the loans to start the business and the training to improve their knowledge in pig breeding. Ni Luh will use her portion of the loan to purchase two piglets and feed.

She has a plan to save the profit to expand her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po is 42 years old and a very hardworking man. He is married to a humble woman and is blessed with five children, one of whom works with him at construction sites around the vicinity of Kampong Thom province. The profit from this work allows him to provide enough food for his family and send his children to school.

With the requested loan, Po will be able to make improvements to his sanitation practices, because he currently doesn't have a safe latrine at home. He will build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members. Thanks to the special rate offered through the water loan program of Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Po is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family, and to protect the environment. He is photographed with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for his family

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Leonora works hard to support her family. She operates a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Leonora is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 44 years old, is married and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. Corazon has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items, such as shampoo, soap, chips, eggs, bread, etc. to sell. Corazon has already borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items, such as shampoo, soap, chips, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sack of charcoal to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 45 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Artemia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Artemia has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Artemia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julien

texts.en:
Julien is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julien is 30 years old, and has one child who is in school.

She has a fish vending business in The Philippines. Julien requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Julien has been in this business for four years. In the future, Julien would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic, 32 years old, is married and has two children. For the past 6 years, she has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Marivic is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Dianna

texts.en:
Dianna is 41 years old with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

 Dianna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

Dianna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Dianna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la producción, elaboración y reparación de muebles. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Madera de pino, Thinner, Sellador, Laca, Barniz y Cerraduras. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia is from the city of Granada.  She is married and has two children.  She is a merchant who makes and repairs furniture.  

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because she has managed to satisfy her customer demand.

She is requesting the loan to buy pinewood, thinner, sealant, lacquer, varnish, and locks.  She believes that the loan will be a great help because she will be able to get better earnings and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pinewood, thinner, sealant, lacquer, varnish, and locks.

loans.name: Dt

texts.en:
DT is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

DT has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en:
The Nyuh Gading group, composed of 7 members, repaid their previous loan of 10,500,000 IDR to MUK on time. One of the members resigned because she successfully sold her pigs and earned enough profit to continue the business by herself. The group decided not to find a replacement member.

In this loan period, Kadek, the head of the group, had losses in her business. Two of her pigs died from illness. She tried everything to save the pigs, but her efforts did not succeed. She’s very sad about that, but she still keeps up the fight to breed other pigs. Kadek repaid her loan by selling her other pigs, and she now needs a new loan to continue her business.

Although most of the group earned enough profit with the help of their last loan, they still need a new loan for their businesses because they have strong wills to become successful pig breeders. The loan will be used to improve their businesses through the purchase of superior piglets or sows. Kadek will use her portion of the loan to buy three superior piglets. She has plans to maintain them to become sows. She wants to become a piglet seller in her village. She hopes MUK and Kiva will always support her and the group.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Red

texts.en:
Red is 33 years old and married with three children.

Red works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Red has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fishing.

Red aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is a married entrepreneur who operates a general store; she sells snacks to earn extra income. Her husband is a farmer, providing their main source of income. In her  ten years of running the business, Amalia earns well to support her child's needs and she has been able to sustain it. Amalia has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She recently borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Amalia hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is married and has four children. Her husband farms and she is busy managing her retail business. Margie buys various vegetables in different villages at wholesale prices and sells them in the market at retail to her regular costumers. To keep her business productive, Margie is requesting additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy bitter gourds, string beans, tomatoes and many more vegetables. Margie hopes to use the loan to sell more vegetables and earn more profit someday.

loans.use: to buy bitter gourds, string beans, tomatoes and many more vegetables

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine, âgé de 59 ans, est un homme très actif, qui fait partie des membres fondateurs de ce guichet rural. Il est à son sixième crédit, et il s’active depuis plus de 20 ans  dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires/céréales locales : mil, maïs, arachide…Il possède aussi un moulin à mil qui lui permet de maximiser son profit en vendant le produit brut et en pouvant le transformer aussi sur place pour la clientèle qui le désire. Lamine comme on le voit sur la photo en tenue bleue, est aidé par son neveu qui se tient près de la machine sur la photo. Il travaille de 7h à 23h. Grâce aux bénéfices, il gère sa famille et leurs besoins quotidiens ; il a aussi pu diversifier les produits et services, élargir le nombre des employés, mettre un peu d’argent de coté, payer la scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Il a aussi eu à renforcer ses outils de travail.
Monsieur Lamine, dans l’avenir, désirerait améliorer son activité avec l’achat de nouvelles machines de transformation de céréales.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine, 59 years of age, is a very active person and one of the founding members of this rural branch. He is on his sixth loan. For over 20 years, he has been selling food staples/local cereals: millet, corn, peanuts etc. He also owns a millet grinding mill, which allows him to maximize his profit by selling raw product and being able to process it on site at the customer's request. Lamine, who is wearing a blue outfit in the photo, is assisted by his nephew, seen  next to the equipment. Lamine works from 7 AM to 11 PM. Thanks to this revenue he is able to provide for his family and everyday household needs. He was also able to diversify his product and service, increase the number of employees, save a bit of money on the side, pay for his children's schooling and improve the nutrition of his family. He was also able to get better work tools.

In the future, Mr. Lamine would like to improve his business by buying new equipment for processing cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals (millet, corn, and peanuts) for resale.

loans.name: Elmelyn

texts.en:
Elmelyn previously accessed a loan of 50,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a piggery for additional income.
 
Elmelyn would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elmelyn hopes to have a grocery store and dreams to have a car. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a pig fattening business in the Philippines for 12 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Virginia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nora Maria

texts.es:
La señora Nora Maria posee un negocio de venta de calzados en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace doce  años para  el sustento de su familia ya que es madre soltera de tres hijos. 

Doña Nora Maria se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7 am para preparar su puesto de trabajo y de esa forma ofertar sus productos a su clientela,  finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel fue utilizado para comprar por mayor su mercadería tales como: Chinelas, zapatos de colegio, camisolines, tobilleras, camisas de uniformes, y así obtener mayor  ganancia  la que le ayudara  a realizar sus  sueños.
texts.en:
Nora Maria has a business selling shoes in one of the markets in the city of León.  She has been dedicated to this business for the last 12 years in order to support her family, as she is a single mother of three children.

Doña Nora Maria commutes to her work at 6:00 am and opens her business at 7:00 am in order to prepare and offer her products to her clientele.  She finishes at 5:30pm between Monday and Saturday, and at noon on Sundays.  

The loan that she requested from Ceprodel was used to buy (at wholesale) her merchandise such as: flip-flops, school shoes, camisoles, ankle braces, uniform blouses.  With this loan, she hopes to earn a better living which will help her to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase flip-flops, school shoes, camisoles, ankle braces, uniform blouses, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 33 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, soap, etc.

Merlita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат замужняя женщина. Она с мужем на протяжении многих лет живет на районе Носири Хусрав. Ей 46 года. Она решила начать новую деятельность и стать успешной бизнес woman. Пользуясь благоприятным климатом и природой Таджикистана, хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она намерена купить несколько скотин от рынка района Шахритус и после длительного откорма продать с наценкой. Шарофат верит и надеется, что ей помогут и поддержат, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en:
Sharofat is a married woman. She and her husband have lived in the Nosiri Khusrav region for many years. She is 46 years old. 

Sharofat decided to start a new business and become a successful business woman. Taking advantage of the favorable climate and nature of Tajikistan, she would like to start a business in the area of cattle breeding. She intends to purchase some cattle at the market in the Shahrituz region, and after feeding them for a long time, resell them with a profit. 

Sharofat believes and hopes that you will help and support her in starting a business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to start her own business of buying and reselling cattle

loans.name: Ma. Delsa

texts.en:
Ma. Delsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Ma. Delsa has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport and her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, etc

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Norm, a mother of six children, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Norm earns her living doing paddy rice cropping and supplements her income by working for others during her spare time. She earns about 32,000 KHR. 

Norm has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, and has successfully repaid her past five loans, which have helped her to uplift her lifestyle. Norm now leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide, and to pay for plowing fees. Norm highly believes that she can gain a better income than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 26 years old, is married and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 3 years, Marilyn has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of retail items. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock, such as canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc. to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock, such as canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kulsunkan

texts.ru: Кулсункан 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Кулсункан - среднее образование, по характеру спокойная, ответственная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулсункан занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулсункан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулсункан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулсункан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kulsunkan is 56 years old, married and has 5 children together with her husband. Kulsunkan has secondary education. She is quiet and responsible by nature. As a main source of income for her family, Kulsunkan works with livestock breeding, after having started 22 years ago with the purchase of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulsunkan's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow and a calf. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulsunkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase heifers to increase the number of livestock. Kulsunkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Norlan Vismar

texts.es:
Norlan Vismar vive en la cuidad de Managua  trabaja como vigilante en un centro de compra de  la capital su trabajo lo hace con mucho esfuerzo ya que tiene que dejar a su familia por las noche para cumplir con mucha  responbilidad su jornada de trabajo para poder ganarse el alimento de cada día  para sus familia que es muy importante para el.
 Don Norlan está solicitando un financiamiento kiva a ya que lo necesita  para alistar a sus tres hijos para que puedan asistir  ala escuela.
Confiando en DIOS que todo esto va hacer positivo este dinero lo va a invertir en pago de matrículas para inscribir a sus hijos en un centro de estudio y comprarles  uniforme escolar, zapato, libros, cuadernos ya que  para el que sus hijos asistan a la escuela es muy importante  para que se puedan formar hombre de bien en un futuro.
texts.en:
Norlan Vismar lives in the city of Managua. He works at as a guard in a shopping mall in the capitol. He puts a lot of energy into his work, for which he has to leave his family every night. He responsibly completes his shifts in order to earn the daily bread for his family, which is very important to him. 

Norlan is requesting a loan from Kiva to enroll his three sons in school. The loan will enable him to invest in school fees at a local institution; and in uniforms, shoes, books, and notebooks. He trusts in God that this investment will pay off and believes that it is very important for his sons to attend school so that they become honorable men.

loans.use: to cover school expenses.

loans.name: Gloria Del Transito

texts.es: Gloria mayor de edad casada con tres hijos con domicilio en la cuidad de Somotillo se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta y trabajadora se dedica a la elaboración de vestidos de bodas, vestidos de quince años y uniformes estudiantiles, se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas, botones cinta y reparación de una maquina de coser.
texts.en: Gloria, an older woman who is married with three children, and resides in the city of Somotillo, characterizes herself as an honest person and a hard-worker.  She works on the detailing and sewing of wedding dresses, dresses for quinceañeras, and student uniforms.  She approached the offices of Ceprodel requesting a loan to purchase fabric, buttons, ribbon, and the repair of a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for the detailing on school uniforms and dresses.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with five children. With two of her children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft dinks, beer, snack foods, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, snack foods and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Celuk Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Celuk Rahayu group is located in the middle part of Bali, where many people farm. All the group members' husbands work as farmers and, as Balinese women, the members support their husbands' incomes by raising pigs at home. The group can pay off their previous loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeeded in maintaining their pigs although some of the members had trouble making their payments. Ni Nengah, the leader, was responsible for the group and the repayment. She maintained 2 fattening pigs, which she sold. After deducting the cost of feed and the price of the piglets, she earned a satisfactory profit. She’s very happy and hopes she will get another loan to improve her business.

After successfully repaying their first loans, the group members are proceeding to the next period with the purpose of improving their businesses. They also made some changes in the group members and rules. 

Ni Nengah, head of the group, coordinates the members in the purchase of piglets so that all members get good piglets. She used the loan to buy three local piglets to be raised for pig barbeques. She plans to use the profits from this loan to purchase merchandises for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase 3 local piglets

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic's greatest dream in life is to let her eldest child finish her studies. She owns and operates a general store within her locality. Marivic is selling grocery items like snack foods, canned goods, breads, biscuits and candies. With the previous loan she took from ASKI, she was able to develop her business. Through her previous loan, she was able to gain a better income, which provided for their daily consumption. Marivic wants to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy condiments, seasonings, beverages, coffee, sugar and shampoo. She hopes that through her requested loan, she will be able to make her business profitable and viable someday.

loans.use: to buy condiments, seasonings, beverages, coffee, sugar and shampoo to stock her general store

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta operates a retail store selling dried fish in their community. She has been doing this for more than ten years and earns well for the family. She and her husband live in the village with their children. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying more dried fish to sell.

In 2008, Gualberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. It help to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Recently, Gualberta has requested a new loan to buy additional varieties of goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of goods to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel has been providing transportation services in their community for more than three years. He earns well from this aside from the business of his wife. His children have been successful in their careers and he has tried to earn his living while he can. 

Miguel has gained access to the micro finance services of GDMPC as a new member. Recently, he took out a new loan for motor repair. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and wants to save his profit to use when they get old.

loans.use: to pay for motor repair

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 39 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc.

Estrella has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc

loans.name: Eledita

texts.en: Eledita, 58 years old, is married and has four children. For the past 4 years, she has farmed vegetables in the Philippines and earned additional income from pig fatterning. Eledita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other planting materials for her business. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other planting materials

loans.name: Dariyka

texts.ru: Дарийке 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Дарийки - высшее образование. Трудовую деятельность начала в средней школе учительницей младших классов, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать. По характеру Дарийка очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Дарийка занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дарийки, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 70 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 4,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетнюю траву. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дарийка обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Дарийка планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Dariyka is 53 years old, married and has three children together with her husband. Dariyka has higher education. She started her career as a high school teacher for the youngest classes. Then she got married, but she continued working. Dariyka is very responsible, sociable and cheerful by nature. 

Together with her husband, Dariyka works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 21 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dariyka's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows and 70 sheep. The monthly income from selling the milk is 10,000 som (KGS). Dariyka also processes 4.0 hectares of land, where she mainly grows beans and perennial grasses. She sells the harvest they get wholesale.

With an aim to further develop her business, Dariyka turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Dariyka plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for expanding the cattle shed.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Usen

texts.ru: Усен 47 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 5 детей. У Усена- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Усен занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 17,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Усена, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Усен обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Усен планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату за обучение детей.
texts.en:
Usen is 47 years old, married and raising five children together with his wife. Usen has secondary education. As a main income for his family, Usen works with livestock breeding, after having started 19 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 17,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Usen's persistent work, his farm currently has two dairy cows and 15 sheep. The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop his business, Usen turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Usen plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. He also plans to save money to pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Maria Adriana

texts.es: Doña Maria Adriana es originaria de Boaco. Casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene 38 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa usada. Inicio su negocio hace cuatro años con capital propio, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio y prosperando hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es comprar un freezer. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Jabones, Azúcar y Gaseosas. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar más productos y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Adriana is originally from Boaco. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Maria is a merchant who manages a grocery business and also sells used clothing. She started her business four years ago with her own capital. Over time she has stocked her business and it has been prospering to this day. Her next goal is to buy a freezer.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, soap, sugar, and sodas. She expects this loan will be of great help since she will be able to buy more products and generate better earnings. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, sugar, and sodas.

loans.name: Toktobu

texts.ru: Токтобу 38 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает сына, которому 16 лет, сын учится в школе и помогает маме по хозяйству. У Токтобу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтобу занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Токтобу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 бычка и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтобу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Токтобу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en:
Toktobu is 38 years old, divorced, and raising a son by herself. The son is 16 years old and goes to school. He also helps his mother with the household. Toktobu has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding, after having started 19 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Toktobu's persistent work, her farm currently has two bulls and 15 sheep. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Toktobu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Toktobu plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for the further education of her son.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia Patricia continua dedicándose a realizar diseños publicitarios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante, a la vez la socia esta dedicándose a la elaboración de tortas a pedido para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia lleva poco tiempo en este nuevo negocio y ella espera que su negocio crezca en el futuro, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, matequilla entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

Patricia continues to make designs for advertising.  She is a responsible and committed person.  This is the way that she gets ahead.  

She also makes cakes by order for different engagements as her services are requested.  She has been in this new business for a short amount of time.  She hopes that her business grows in the future.  She wishes to be able to continue working in order to get ahead in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like flour and butter, among others.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and butter, among others.

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
Nhim, 50 years old, lives in Ta Lou village, a remote area of Bakan, Pursat province. She is married and blessed with seven children: three are married and the other four are students who still depend on her income. Nhim owns two-hectare parcels, where she plants and harvests rice to sell as her main source of income. She has been in the farming business for more than 30 years and the profit from this allows her to pay for daily food, home bills and the costs of other commodities.

Nhim will use this loan to make improvements to her sanitation practices, since she hasn’t got a safe latrine at home yet. She will build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Nhim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for her family members.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a single entrepreneur who has operated a buy-and-sell business for more than eleven years. She earns good income from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. It added to her inventory capital and gained more returns to be saved for the future.

Recently, she took out a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more crabs and prawns to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her own general living situation.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and prawns to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a farming of vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming of vegetables business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella works hard to support her family. Ella is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, Pampers, cream, sugar, etc.

Ella has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, Pampers, cream, sugar, etc

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling books. Lucia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of herbal medicines to sell for her business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labor to provide assistance and maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Nancy Goya

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Nancy es docente de profesion,la socia continua dedicándose a trabajar en una ONG en uno de los proyectos de este mismo, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, a la vez la socia continua realizando tejidos hechos a mano, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas de diferentes colores, hilos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nancy, belongs to the communal bank Patron de San Sebastián from the city of Cusco.

Nancy is a teacher by profession. She continues working for a NGO in one of their projects. She enjoys devoting her time to this work and is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work each day. At the same time she continues making making hand-knitted items. She is a responsible and earnest person and this is how she is able to support her family. 

Nancy is asking for this loan to buy different colors of wool, thread, and other items. She is grateful for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to pay for different colors of wool, thread, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs that will help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Doña Karla es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo y con dinero que tenía ahorrado, poco a poco fue comprando su mercadería y es así como ha logrado mantenerlo hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es diversificar su mercadería. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cuadernos, Lapiceros, Borradores, Libretas, Granos básicos entre otros artículos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar sus ingresos. Su plan futuro es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Karla comes from the city of Granada. She is married and a mother to three children. She works as a shopkeeper in a corner store, a business she started with the support of her husband and money she had saved. Bit by bit she began buying merchandise, building it up into the store it is today. Her next goal is to diversify her merchandise.

Karla is asking for a loan to buy exercise books, pencils, erasers, books, bulk grains and other items. She believes that this loan will be very helpful in allowing her to increase her income. In the future she hopes to turn her corner store into a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, pencils, erasers, books, bulk grains and other items

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: Horn, a mother of six children in her late 40s, is an inhabitant of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To cover the daily basic needs of her entire household, she does rice cropping on two hectare of land and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for around 10 years and earns about 37,800 KHR per day.  Including this loan, she and her co-borrower are in their seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past six loans, which she repaid back completely, have enabled her to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, she is the representative of her group. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy gasoline, fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a better income.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 43 years old, married and a farmer in Alcala. He usually earns an income of PHP 30,000 each harvest season twice a year and uses it for his family's expenses such as school fees and daily meals. Part of his income is used as revolving capital for the business. Now, he would like to keep improving his farming output, which is the reason why he is in need of additional capital of PHP 30,000. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

The additional revenue will be kept for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is 28 years old, a local villager from Battambang province. Sophy is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school; the one remaining is too young for schooling. To support the family, she grows rice as her main source of income. Her husband can earn extra income via his occupation as the construction worker. She has been with this business for some years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Sophy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one past loan and completely paid it back. The past loan has helped her to improve her lifestyle and make it better than before. This is the second cycle loan for her and she is leading a group of three to request a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. Sophy is planning to spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for land preparation. She strongly hopes that her family’s business will improve and earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Ikbol

texts.ru: Ее зовут Икбол. Икбол жительница маленького района Кубадиён. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. Она вместе с мужем воспитывает троих детей. Дети учатся в школе. Икбол большое внимание уделяет воспитанию и образованию детей. Она не получила высшее образование и хочет, чтоб его дети были образованными. Икбол, чтобы помочь мужу прокормить семью занимается скотоводством. Большая часть населения Таджикистана занимается сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Икбол не стала исключением, ведь природа и климат их района вполне способствует здоровому росту скотов. Икбол выращивает скотов в коровнике (коровник сзади Икбола). Сейчас у нее совсем мало скотин и она решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. Она надеется, что ей помогут, и она купить теленка и сможет сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en:
This woman is called Ikbol. She is a resident of the small region of Qubadiyon. She is 46 years old and married. Together with her husband she raises three children. The children go to school. Ikbol pays great attention to raising and educating her children. She did not receive higher education and would like for her children to be educated. 

In order to help her husband feed the family, Ikbol works with livestock breeding. The larger part of the Tajik population work with agriculture. Ikbol is not an exception, as the nature and climate of her region is suitable to healthy breeding of cattle. Ikbol breeds cattle in her cow shed (you can see the shed behind Ikbol). Currently she has very few cows and she decided to apply for a loan in order to increase the number of cattle. She hopes you will help her so that she can purchase a calf and preserve her income.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and preserve her income

loans.name: Ruzikhol

texts.ru:
Большая часть населения Таджикистана с давних времен занималась сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Скотоводства и земледелия посей день является популярным в Таджикистане. Потому что 93% государство занимает горы и предприятия и компании находятся только на равнинах. Основным источником дохода для жителей горных земель посей день остается сельскохозяйственными. 
  Жительница одного из районов горной страны Кубадиен Розихол. Ей 26 лет. Она тоже занимается животноводством. Розихол начала заниматься 3 года назад. Ей нравиться ее работа и хочет далее развивать свою деятельность. С этими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом. Она просит ей помочь купить теленка. Она надеется, что с Вашей помощью ей удастся значительно развить малый бизнес.
texts.en:
For a long time the larger part of the Tajik population has worked with agriculture. Livestock breeding and field crop cultivation is very popular in Tajikistan to this day. Because 93% of the land is mountains, enterprises and companies are situated only on the plains. The main source of income for the residents of the mountains is still agriculture. 

Ruzikhol is a resident of one of the mountain regions, Qubadiyon. She is 26 years old. She also works with livestock breeding. Ruzikhol started this business 3 years ago. She likes her work and would like to develop her business further. With this intention she applied for a loan. She requests help to purchase a calf. She hopes that with your help, she will be able to develop her small business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, concrete blocks and steel sheets

loans.name: Nhoeurn

texts.en:
Nhoeurn, aged 40, is married and a mother of four children, living with her spouse in a rural village of Bakan, Pursat province. Nhoeurn and her husband help each other operate their own farm to make a living. For nearly 20 years, farming has been a significant source of income for her family. From her current business, she is able to earn well, to meet the daily living costs.

Nhoeurn had planned to improve her household sanitation practices in order to promote their health. Due to insufficient money, she is asking for a loan amount of 1,000 USD, to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Nhoeurn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Myrna has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de alquilar carros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia alquila a todos sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de los carros como cambio de aceite.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Group member Pamela belongs to the Patron de San Sebastian community bank in Cusco. She is still working for a car rental agency and has spent a long time in this business. It is going really well for her because of the effort she puts into her work every day. She rents out cars to all the customers who come to her. She is responsible and hardworking, which is why she has been able to get ahead. 

Pamela is asking for a loan to give her cars a service, such as changing the oil. She is grateful for this loan and promises to make all her repayments on time.

loans.use: to give her cars a service, such as changing the oil

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora vive en la ciudad de Patria y se siente contenta. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de yuca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como yuca y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (
texts.en: Leonora lives in the city Patria and is happy. Her principal economic activity is selling yucca. She has been running her own business for several years now and everything is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her job. She belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Huanca de Patria”  and this opportunity requires that she apply for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise like yucca and increase her working capital. She is thankful for and appreciates the loan and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise like yucca.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 19 years old and lives with her family. Her parents do business to earn a living. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. Her two siblings are still studying, too.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microfinance to pay her school tuition fees. She wants to become successful and be able to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios earns a living from selling goods in her retail store, while her husband does farming. For six years, Remedios has earned well and sustained the business. She has also purchased some home improvements like appliances from her own earnings.  To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income, for the purpose of improving the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Rialyn

texts.en:
Rialyn is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Rialyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rialyn has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rialyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 33 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Amalia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as retail goods. 

In the future Amalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en: Ceferina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. Ceferina has been in this business for 15 years. She also earns additional income from fish vending. Ceferina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol is 52 years old, a married woman with one child. She lives in Takeo Province. She is a silk maker, her husband is a farmer and her child is a factory laborer. All of them can earn $7 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for loan of $700 for buying silk to make fine silk to sell. This loan helps her in getting more income, as well as getting a better standard of living. 

In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy silk to make fine silk to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been working in his  mango farm for many years. He earns well from this and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for mango production. Aside from this, he also has a farm of bananas. 

Recently, he took out a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. With this small amount of investment, he is hopeful to have an abundant harvest that will help him to save for his improved future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 50 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Arlene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 40 years old, and married with four children.  Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.  Alma has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from making fishing nets.  Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of personal collection products to sell.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling personal collection products business for 20 years and also earns an income from manicure and pedicure service.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 30 years old and single with  children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, juice, etc. to sell.

Rachel has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Chanthoeun is 36 years old and a married woman with three children living in Takeo Province. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a construction laborer. Both of them can make $6 per day.

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $500 to buy a cow to breed and then to sell to get a profit. In the future, she hopes that she can run an animal farm and her children can earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed and sell

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is 53 years old and from the remote area of Bakan district, Pursat province. She is married with four children: three are married and one is still a student. For nearly 30 years, she has been farming rice to make a living. She is happy because her husband is very supportive and always helps her manage their farm and household.

Run had planned to improve her household sanitation practices in order to promote their health. Due to inadequate money, she is asking for a loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Run is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Jonawien

texts.en:
Jonawien's parents earn a living from driving and working as a private employee. Her siblings are still studying. As the second child, she had to become determined to be good in school as well as in her community. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay her tuition for the current semester. She hopes to become successful in the future, and is thankful to GDMPC for giving her a chance to be a part of the organization.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Carmen is in an agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Carmen has been in pig fattening for 6 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Menie

texts.en:
Menie works hard to support her family. Menie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as shampoos, groceries, etc.

Menie has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Menie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items, such as shampoos, groceries, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been in this business for four years now.

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima works hard to support her family. Felicisima is married and has a buy-and-sell curtains business in the Philippines.

Felicisima requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more curtains to sell to her customers.

Felicisima has been in this business for four years now.

Felicisima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more curtains to sell to her customers

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en: Flordelisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture making business.  Flordelisa has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from food vending.  She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her furniture making business.  Flordelisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for her coffee crop, and to pay field laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple consumer products, dairy products, soft drinks, sausages, beef, chicken and pork

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita owns and operates a transportation service in her village to make a living. She is the one who manages it. Her husband works in a private company.

She has been in the business for three years and she has successfully re-payed her previous loans used for vehicle repair. Charita is requesting a new loan to buy a new set of tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Catalina is 40 years old and her three children are still in school.

Catalina has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, blankets, pillow cases, etc., to sell.

Catalina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, blankets, pillow cases, etc., to sell

loans.name: Christine Lyn

texts.en:
Christine Lyn is 24 years old and single.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Christine Lyn has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, candies, etc. 

In the future, Christine Lyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa  is a 20-years-old, married woman who lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a mechanic and she helps him by selling grilled food in their village to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She borrowed a GDMPC micro credit loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare grilled food to sell. She plans to repair their house to have a comfortable living for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare grilled food to sell.

loans.name: Floricita

texts.en:
Florecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers. Florecita has been in this business for 6 years. Florecita earns more income from selling coconut shell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Florecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia continua con el negocio de la agricultura entonces cosecha hojas de coca y la venta de animales menores como gallinas y en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y alimento para las gallinas y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Celia continues in the farming business. She grows coca leaves and sells small animals such as chickens. In her free time, she sells sodas. Celia has already spent many years in this business and it is going very well, thanks to the determination that she puts into her work. 

Celia belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Huanca de Patria". This opportunity requires a loan to buy seeds and feed for the chickens, and in this way increase her capital in this line of work. She is grateful for and values the loan, and she commits to comply with the pay of her monthly dues with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and feed for chickens.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia continua dedicándose a la venta de frutas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como por ejemplo manzana, piñas, plátanos y otras frutas más. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Delia continues to sell fruits. She has been doing this for some years already and she does well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She belongs to the community bank Señor de Huanca de Patria and currently needs a loan to buy fruits such as apples, pineapples, bananas, and others.
She is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make the monthly repayments very responsibly. (The people of Patria are known for selling jungle products as well as accommodation and restaurants. Patria is a city at the entrance to the Manu National Park).

loans.use: to buy fruits such as apples, pineapples, bananas, and others.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito continua con sus actividades económicas la construcción de obras y la venta de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Benito continues with his businesses of public works and selling groceries. He has already spent many years in these businesses and they are going very well thanks to the dedication that he puts into his work. 

Benito belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Huanca de Patria". This opportunity requires a loan in order to buy basic products such as bags of rice and sugar. He is thankful for and values the loan, and commits to fulfilling the payment of his monthly dues with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica continua vendiendo la hojas de coca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.  

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Veronica continues selling coca leaves. She has been doing this for some years already and she is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She belongs to the community bank Señor de Huanca da Patria and currently needs a loan to buy seeds and manure. 
She is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make the monthly repayments very responsibly. (The people of Patria are known for selling jungle produce and for accommodation and restaurants. Patria is a city at the entrance to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro continua dedicándose a la agricultura pues cosecha de hoja de coca, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Alejandro continues to work in agriculture, harvesting coca leaves. He belongs to the village bank "Señor de Huanca de Patria” and at this time he needs a loan to buy seeds so that he can increase his business capital in this field of work.
