He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to meet the monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is single and has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products, such as body soaps, lipsticks, deodorants, perfumes, etc. to resell.

Lydia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products, such as body soaps, lipsticks, deodorants, perfumes, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Gladys Ricarda

texts.es:
Gladys de 51 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella de caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico, no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de  trabajar a muy temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico, detergente, maíz, fósforos, cereales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su venta de granos básicos para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Gladys agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
51 year old Gladys is married and has two children who are minors. She is from Leon, which is in the western part of the country. She is hardworking, responsible, and wants to overcome challenges. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to study and she saw the need to work from a very early age in order to help with the household expenses.
Thanks to her efforts and her desire to succeed, she works selling staples such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, corn, matches, and cereals. She works 10 hours a day offering her goods and her business is located in her house. The goal of this loan is to have working capital and supply her grocery store so she can offer her customers a better service and, in the not too distant future, make better profits. Gladys is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to have working capital to supply her business buying and selling staples such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, detergent, corn, matches, cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariela Lourdes

texts.es: Mariela continua dedicándose a la agricultura entonces cosecha hojas de coca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas
texts.en: Mariela keeps working in agriculture growing coca leaf. She has been in this business for several years and has been successful thanks to her dedication and hard work. She is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca de Patria" and plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Alvaro vive con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos, tienen una casa propia y un negocio donde comprar autos chocados y abandonados, ellos los desarman y venden las piezas para refacciones. También tiene dos grúas y da servicio a personas que las requieren. El dice que su principal logro es que inicio su negocio hace 7 años, entonces era muy pequeño pero gracias a la perseverancia a logrado creecerlo. Alvaro esta solicitando el préstamo, porqué quiere crecer su negocio y abrir uno igual en otra zona, el cual operaría uno de sus hijos. El se considera una persona responsable y cumplida, Alvaro dice: "pueden checar mi historial crediticio siempre he pagado bien mis deudas".
texts.en:
Alvaro is a client of Kubo Financing and this is his story.

Alvaro lives with his partner and they have three children. They own a home and a business where they buy wrecked and abandoned cars, take them apart and sell the pieces for repairs. They also have two tow trucks and they provide the service to people who need it. He says their main achievement was beginning their business 7 years ago, when it was very small. Thanks to their perseverance they have been able to grow it.

Alvaro is asking for a loan because he wants to grow his business and open another one in a different zone, which one of his sons will run. He considers himself to be responsible and polite. Alvaro says, "they can check my credit history, I have always paid my debts".

loans.use: to grow his business selling car parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, fruits, vegetables, meats, bulk foods, and dairy products for his store

loans.name: Sara Norma

texts.es: Doña Sara es originaria de la ciudad de León, casada y madre de 3 hijos ya independientes. Tiene 60 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio su negocio hace 40 años con dinero que tenía ahorrado. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Sillas, Licuadoras, Artículos de cocinas, Abanico entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Su plan futuro es ampliar su mercadería para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Sara, from the city of León, is married and the mother of three grown children. She is 60 years old. She works as a merchant, selling general merchandise. She started her business 40 years ago with money that she had saved. She asks for a loan to buy chairs, blenders, kitchen items, fans and other things. She believes the loan will be a lot of help in earning more money. Her plan for the future is to increase her merchandise and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chairs, blenders, kitchen items and fans, among other things.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema works hard to support her family. Gema is married and has a buy-and-sell spices and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices and vegetables to resell.

Gema has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Gema would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan es originario de Estelí. Se dedica a la Carpinteria. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Madera, Pegamento, Pintura entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá fabricar mayor cantidad de muebles para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Don Juan comes from Estelí and works in carpentry. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he has been able to respond to his clients' demand and improve his income. He is requesting a loan to buy wood, glue and paint, among other items. He expects the loan to be of great help as he will be able to build more pieces of furniture for his clients.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue and paint, among other items.

loans.name: José Manfredy

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, con él vive su madre, por lo tanto su esposa sus hijos y su madre dependen de él.

José trabaja en un lubricentro, desde hace 8 meses; pero cuenta con 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y además se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura.

Él está solicitando este crédito, pues lo necesita para mejorar su casa, ya que le hace falta el techo, esto le permitirá cubrir esta necesidad y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
 
Él sueña con que sus hijos y su familia vivan en mejores condiciones, en una vivienda digna y seguir trabajando para que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
José, 32, studied until 9th grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home and their two young children. His mother also lives with him, and they all depend on him.

Jose works has worked in an oil change center for 8 months, but he has been doing this job for 6 years. He is asking for a loan because he needs to improve his house, especially the roof which is lacking. This will allow him to meet this need and improve his family's living conditions.

He dreams that his children and family will live in better conditions, in a home made of solid materials, and that he will keep working so that they never lack anything.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his house.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles tiene 50 años,  es casada y tiene tres hermosos hijos, de los cuales solo 1 depende 
economicamente de su esposo y ella. Son una familia trabajadora, constante y muy unida. 
Ella se  dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo.  Con ayuda del crédito solicitado planea realizar  mejoras a su vivienda  dando comodidad a  su familia.
Quien solicita el crédito es ella, pero detrás está toda una  familia  de guerreros que la apoya, su lema es “La unión hace la fuerza.”
Sus logros son que  gracias a su negocio  ha comprado aparatos eléctricos, ha dado estudios universitarios a sus hijos,  solventa los gastos de la casa y ahora goza de  una estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles is a 50-year old woman who is married and has three beautiful children, one of whom depends financially on her and her husband. They are a hard-working, tenacious and united family. She has worked as a saleswoman for 10 years selling cosmetics by catalog. 

She plans to use the loan to make improvements to their house, providing her family with more comfort. She is the one requesting the loan, but there is a whole family of fighters behind who support her and whose motto is "Unity gives strength". Thanks to her achievements in her business, she has been able to buy appliances, cover her children's tuition and household expenses, and enjoy financial stability.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of eight group-leader farmers in Kenya's Kakamega North District. Wilson is pictured on the right with his hand raised. He volunteered and was selected to be the Kiva group representative. The field officer, also included in the photo, is standing on the left. The individual farmers represented by the group leaders are not pictured here. Farming inputs will be delivered to Wilson and the 74 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant a quarter of an acre of maize and a quarter of an acre of millet or sorghum. Each farmer will receive an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings. 

Wilson is 50 years old and has been a farmer for 22 years. He is married and has five children. He is known as a hardworking and experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in such organizations as the savings group and prayer group. He describes his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

Wilson joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2014 season. He joined One Acre Fund to learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed the family. Because he is an active community member, Wilson has become more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved his life because he has more farm training and is able to feed his family. He hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Wilson and the Bidii group will use their Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer packages from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to access hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Huseyin

texts.en:
Huseyin was born in year 1971. He has been married for 18 years and has two children. The elder child is studying first course of college and another child  is going to eleventh class and preparing for the University. Huseyin’s wife is a housewife and she helps Huseyin in his business. They are living in Boyuk Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region. 

But they are an IDP-Internally Displaced Persons- from Fuzuli city. Huseyin has been in animal breeding business for long years. He makes cheese, yogurt, and other dairy products, and sells these products at the local bazaar. 

In this work, his wife helps Huseyin. Today, Huseyin wants to buy little calves to increase his family business. Therefore, he has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this aid, Huseyin is thankful to Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy little calves.

loans.name: Nahshon's Group

texts.en:
Nahshon is a member of Jamii Group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 66 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Nahshon has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings (KES) for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Nahshon is 60 years old and has been a farmer for 35 years.  Nahshon works as a farmer to provide for his seven children.  The community and other farmers know Nahshon as trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group and prayer group.  Nahshon described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.  

Nahshon joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Nahshon joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods.  Nahshon wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers because he is an active community member.  Nahshon has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Nahshon's life because he was able to save money.  In the future, Nahshon hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to save for the future.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Nahshon and the Jamii Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and to hire laborers to maintain her coffee plants.

loans.name: Hedelita

texts.en:
Hedelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hedelita is 39 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Hedelita has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Hedelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Hedelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Hedelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Doña Julieta se presenta y demuestra ser una mujer luchadora, responsable y entregada a su compromiso como microempresaria, madre y compañera. Ella desde muy joven cuenta con la experiencia como cocinera, costurera y panadera. Su esposo tiene un taller de muebles muy originales y de calidad, desde hace 50 años, en el que ella le ayuda a conseguir sus clientes y entregar los pedidos. Doña Julieta es muy conocida en el pueblo como la señora que vende pan. Ella sueña con montar una cafetería al frente de su casa, esto lo desea lograr en un futuro no tan lejano; desea este crédito para comprarse una máquina para realizar granizados y la materia prima que necesita para el pan, ella cuenta con un buen mercado para sus ventas. Al llegar a la casa de esta familia se nota la pasión por los muebles rústicos, la unión y apoyo que existe entre ellos es muy agradable. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad de los trámites y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Julieta presents and demonstrates herself to be a fighter, a responsible woman who is dedicated to her commitment to being a micro-entrepreneur, mother and girlfriend. She has gotten experience as a chef, seamstress and baker since she was very young. 

For the last 50 years, her husband has had a workshop with very original and quality furniture, where she helps him obtain his clients and get the orders delivered. 

Julieta is very well-known in town as the woman who sells bread. She dreams about setting up a coffee shop in front of her house, something she would like to achieve in the not-too-distant future. She wants this loan in order to buy a snow cone machine and the raw materials that she needs for the bread. She has a good market for her sales. 

When she arrives home to this family, she notes, the union, support, and passion for rustic furniture that exist between them is very pleasant. She chose Fundación Mujer (Women´s Foundation) for the ease of its procedures and its low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a snow cone machine and raw materials

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 24 years old, married, and has one child. 

She is in the agricultural, pig fattening business in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Janeth has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 53 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to resell, such as canned goods, eggs, chips, milk, coffee, etc.

Betty has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to resell, such as canned goods, eggs, chips, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear, such as pants, blouses, shorts, etc. to resell in her buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. Josephine earns more income from selling jewelries.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear, such as pants, blouses, shorts, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 53 años de edad, estudió técnico en Trabajo social, está casada y su esposo es agrónomo, han procreado tres hijas, las cuales están estudiando en la Universidad. Rosa solo vive con su esposo y sus hijas por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de ella.

Rosa tiene 2 años de dedicarse a su negocio de venta de ropa nueva americana en el mercado. Anteriormente ella vendía productos de revistas, el trabajo de venta de ropa lo aprendió de su prima ya que ella le prestó el local en el mercado y fue así que decidió dedicarse a este negocio. Rosa se va a pie al mercado y le queda a 15 minutos de su casa, ella vende de 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM; en este negocio solo trabaja ella ya que sus hijas no pueden ayudarle porque se encuentran estudiando y al esposo tampoco le queda tiempo por su trabajo.

 El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar más ropa de hombre y de niñas; pues esa es la ropa que le hace falta y la que los clientes buscan más, al tener más mercadería disponible, Rosa logrará tener mayores ingresos para su familia.

Su sueño, es poseer un local más grande y un negocio de ropa muy surtido, que todos los clientes compren y cubran sus necesidades, también con lo que vende y con las ganancias desea seguir preparando a sus hijas en sus carreras universitarias y que hagan realidad el sueño de ser profesionales, ya que esa es la única herencia que ella puede dejarles.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 53 years old, went to technical school in social work. She is married, and her husband is an agronomist. They have three daughters, who are studying at the university. Rosa lives with only her husband, and her daughters therefore only depend on her.

Rosa has been working in her business of selling new American clothing in the market for two years. In the past, she sold products from catalogs. She learned the business of selling clothing from her cousin, since she lent her the market location, and this was how she decided to work in this business. Rosa goes to the market on foot, and it takes 15 minutes from her house. She sells from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. She works in this business alone, since her daughters cannot help her because they are in school, and her husband doesn't have time because of his work.

She needs the loan that she is applying for from CrediCampo to buy more men's and children's clothing, since this is the clothing that she needs and that the customers ask for most. When she has more merchandise available, Rosa will have greater income for her family.

Her dream is to have a bigger location and a better-stocked clothing business, where her customers can buy and cover their needs. Also, with what she sells and with the earnings, she wants to continue preparing her daughters in their university programs so that they can make a reality of the dream of having careers, since that is the only inheritance that she can leave them.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for men and children and stock her business.

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Samwel selected as the Kiva representative.  

Samwel has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 58 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Samwel is 61 years old and has been a farmer for 35 years.  Samwel works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children. 

The community and other farmers know Samwel as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group.  Samwel described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.  

Samwel joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Samwel joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers.  So Samwel has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  

Working with One Acre Fund has improved Samwel's life because he has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, Samwel hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow. 

Samwel and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. 

Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to give farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijas de las cuales una de ellas está estudiando y la otra hija ya se casó. 

Julio es una persona que realiza diversas actividades para salir adelante, se dedica al comercio, también a la ganadería y a la venta de autos. Julio vende granos básicos en los mercados, se va a su trabajo a las 7:30 AM y se dirige a su casa a las 3:00 de la tarde.

Este préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en su negocio, específicamente para comprar granos básicos.

Sus propósitos a futuro son, que su negocio crezca para aportar más ingresos a su familia y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Julio, 45, studied until fourth grade. He is currently in a relationship and his partner makes a living doing housecleaning. He has two daughters, one of whom is studying and the other one is already married.

Julio is a person who does different activities to get ahead. He makes a living in food sales, as well as cattle raising and auto sales. Julio sells basic grains in the markets. He goes to work at 7:30 a.m. and returns home at 3:00 in the afternoon.

He will use this loan to invest in his business, specifically to buy basic grains. His intentions in the future are to grow his business in order to contribute more income to his family and be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María tiene 68 años de edad, ella alquila el lugar donde vive con su compañero de vida, tiene 2 hijos que ya son adultos y tienen sus propias familias y viven en otra ciudad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, la cual las elabora en un comal que tiene en el patio de su casa, ya tiene 18 años realizando dicha actividad. Anteriormente María se dedicaba a los servicios domésticos (planchar, lavar ropa, cocinar etc.) en diferentes hogares. 

El préstamo que María solicita a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertir en su negocio de venta de tortillas, ya que es un negocio de mucha demanda y por el momento se encuentra escasa de insumos como leña y maíz, que son algunos de los principales elementos que se necesitan para la venta.

El sueño más grande de María es, llegar a comprar una casa propia en un futuro, así vivirá cómodamente y en privacidad, sin tener que estar pagando alquiler y con el riesgo de que se pueden ir en cualquier momento.
texts.en:
María, 68, rents a home where she lives with her partner. They have 2 children who are grown and have their own families and live in another city. She works selling tortillas, which she makes on a stove on the patio of her home. She has been doing this for 18 years. Before that, she did domestic services (washing and ironing clothing, cooking, etc) in different homes.

Maria asks for a loan from CrediCampo which she will invest in her tortilla business, since there is a lot of demand and right now she is running low on inputs like firewood and corn - some of the main things she needs for her sales.

Her biggest dream is to buy her own home so that she will live comfortably in privacy, without having to pay rent and risk being evicted at any moment.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling tortillas by purchasing things like firewood and corn.

loans.name: Lidia Margarita

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y su esposo trabaja en un camión vendiendo artículos para el hogar, tiene 4 hijos que viven en casa, 2 de ellos estudian y dos trabajan en un hospital.
 
Lidia y su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de carne azada a la orilla de la calle, les va muy bien en el negocio pues tienen mucha clientela que se acercan desde primeras horas del mediodía para almorzar. También tienen un molino con el cual generan ganancias cuando los clientes se acercan a moler maíz.

Ella necesita muchísimo de este préstamo, para reparar un vehículo que poseen, pues a veces necesitan hacer algunas diligencias y compras, y el vehículo es de mucha ayuda. Con el crédito ella podrá cubrir esta necesidad.

Lidia planea seguir creciendo en el negocio para así tener un puesto más estable que les haga crecer económicamente para beneficio de ellos y de su clientela.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 53-year old woman who is married and has four children living at home, two of them studying and the other two working in a hospital. Her husband works driving a van and selling household items. Lidia and her husband have a business where they sell roasted meat in the street. Things are going well and they have many clients coming from early in the afternoon to have lunch. They also own a mill that provides some income when clients want to mill corn. 

She really needs this loan to repair a vehicle that they own. Sometimes they need to run errands and go shopping, and this vehicle is of great help. The loan would allow them to cover this expense. 

Lidia plans to keep expanding her business so that she can have a more stable stand and grow financially for the benefit of themselves and their clients.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en: Bernie, a father of three provides transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than three years, he has earned well to provide for his family. He needs to purchase a new set of tires for his motorcycle to improve the services and provide safe transportation. With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle unit to use for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah works hard to support her family. Dinah is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Dinah has been in this business for eleven years now.

Dinah requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar, etc. Dinah successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Dinah would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar, etc

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece José, junto a sus dos hijas.

José tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado en la escuela, está felizmente casado y tiene 2 hijas, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también sale a vender productos de revistas (cremas, perfumes, ropa interior etc.).

José se dedica a trabajar la tierra, siembra maíz y cosecha “jilote” pues opina que le resulta rentable, también siembra hortalizas con sistema de riego. Para llegar al terreno donde trabaja debe hacer un recorrido de 15 minutos a pie y trabaja todo el día de sol a sol.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertir en sus cultivos y también para comprar comida para unos cerdos que tiene en el patio de su casa, así podrá sacar una buena cosecha y también engordar a los cerdos para luego venderlos.

Los planes a futuro de José son, tener una granja de cerdos y de esta manera ir creciendo en el comercio de la carne de este animal, para mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Jose appears in the photograph with his 2 daughters.  He is 33 years old, and has a 7th grade education.  He is happily married and has 2 daughters.  His wife takes care of the household chores and also goes out to sell products from a catalog (creams, perfumes, underwear, etc.)

Jose works the land, cultivating corn and harvesting baby corn, as he finds that this is profitable.  He also cultivates vegetables with an irrigation system.  In order to get to the land that he works he must walk for 15 minutes, and he works every day from dawn until dusk.  

Jose is requesting a loan from CrediCampo because he needs to invest in his crops and also buy some feed for some pigs that he has on his property.  This way, he will be able to get a good harvest and also fatten the pigs to later sell.

In the future, Jose plans to have a pig farm.  This way he can grow his business selling the meat of this animal, so that he can increase his income and thereby improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his crops and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Cesan

texts.en:
Cesan works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend the business hours even after nightfall.

Cesan is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help her coffee crop and pay for labor.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business buying and selling Natasha, Avon and MSE products in the Philippines. Laarni has been in this business for 4 years now.

Laarni requested a 7,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more stock to sell, such as shoes, sandals, perfume, beauty products, etc. In the future, Laarni would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as shoes, sandals, perfume, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 43 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Mary Jane has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Lorilyn has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business.

Lorilyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and has eight children. Elizabeth is married and has one child who is in school. She is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been fattening pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ámbar Johanna

texts.es:
Ámbar tiene 32 años de edad, se graduó de la carrera en psicología, vive en la ciudad con su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales están estudiando. Su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos y también trabaja como empleado. 

Ámbar trabaja en una institución para la mujer, ahí ejerce su profesión atendiendo pacientes con fuertes problemas traumáticos por situaciones como violaciones. Actualmente, el proyecto que está realizando es el de divulgación en hospitales y unidades de salud de la ley especial libre de violencia.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo, lo necesita para cancelar deudas pendientes, y el resto del dinero lo utilizará en actividades recreativas para sus hijos.

El objetivo más grande de Ámbar es terminar su maestría en dirección de empresas.
texts.en:
Ámbar is a 32-year old woman who studied Psychology and lives in the city with her husband and two children attending school. Her husband makes a living buying and selling vehicles and also works as an employee. Ámbar works in a women institution and serves patients with strong traumatic problems resulting from situations such as rape. She is currently involved in a campaign promoting the special law free of violence in hospitals and health centers. 

She will use the loan requested to CrediCampo to repay her pending debts and to cover recreational activities for her children. Ámbar's biggest goal is to finish her master in Business Management.

loans.use: to repay pending debts and to cover recreational activities for her children.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of this group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. The group leaders represent a total of 56 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Margaret has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Margaret is married and has two children. She is 45 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and savings group. Margaret has been a farmer for 22 years. She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Margaret plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Margaret’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, is able to save money and feed the family.

Margaret and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she does fishing and serves as a driver at the same time to earn extra income. 

After three years in running the business, she earns well enough to support the needs of her child and was able to sustain it. She also successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying some goods. 

Recently, she has borrowed from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Calera Ii Group

texts.es:
Jose Ediberto es un agricultor de 29 años de edad del Departamento de Ahuachapan, forma parte del grupo solidario llamado CALERA II,ellos se dedican al cultivo de maiz, maicillo, frijol y tambien a la crianza de ganado.
Jose Ediberto esta acompañado, sus estudios los realizo hasta sexto grado de primaria,debido a que sus padres son de escasos recursos y no podian seguir dandole estudio porque su situacion economica ya no se los permitio,Jose Ediberto tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para colaborar al sostenimiento de la familia,el tiene dos hijos entre las edades de 2 y 4 años.
Jose Ediberto tiene 15 años de dedicarse a las labores del campo, tanto al cultivo de granos basicos como a la crianza de bovinos,dichas actividades le permitieron en su momento ayudar a sus padres y hermanos, hoy dia esas labores agropecuarias le generan los ingresos necesarios para la manuntencion de su grupo familiar.
El solicita credito para la compra de 2 vacas para la produccion y comercializacion de leche,lo cual le permitiria mantener un nivel de ingresos para apoyar a su familia, en especial a sus hijos, pues Ediberto sueña con verlos realizados como grandes profesionales, mejorando asi su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Ediberto, age 29, is a farmer from the Ahuachapan department.  He is part of the CALERA II communal bank.  The members of the bank grow corn, sorghum, and beans.  They also raise livestock.

Jose Ediberto is in a relationship.  He went to school through the sixth grade.  Due to the fact that his parents have scarce resources, they were not able to continue giving him an education.  Their financial situation would not allow it.  Jose Ediberto had to work from the time he was very young in order to help support the family.  He has two children between the ages of two and four.

Jose Ediberto has been working in the field for 15 years.  He works as much at growing basic grains as raising cattle.  These business activities, at this time, allow him to help his parents and his siblings.  Nowadays these farming jobs generate the income needed to support his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy two cows to produce and sell milk.  This will allow him to maintain a level of income to support his family, especially his children.  Ediberto dreams of seeing them become great professionals.  This way they will be improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Marygorety's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers from Kakamega North District. Marygorety has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 69 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Marygorety is married and has eight children. She is 60 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group and the prayer group. Marygorety has been a farmer for 32 years. She describes her harvest as good last year but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

Marygorety first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. Marygorety joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Marygorety plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Marygorety’s own life has improved, because she has more farm training and was able to save money and feed her family. 

Marygorety and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers with profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.en:
Abubakr was born in 1989 in the capital of Tajikistan. He is married. His wife is a seamstress.  They have no children. 

Abubakr is going to organize a new business and in this way earn a living. He is going to open a training center. Abubakr wants to help people of his town to study and get good knowledge. 

Abubakr is asking for a loan of USD 3,000 to repair his place and buy tables and chairs. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his place and buy tables and chairs for his new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some simbras (nets with hooks) and a boat.

loans.name: Jim Vincent.

texts.en:
Jim Vincent is studying information technology in a university and wants to have a better career in the future. His parents earn from empoyment, and their income is good enough for their needs. He has two siblings still dependent on their parents. 

Jim Vincent joined GDMPC and borrowed money to pay his current tuition fees. He is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of his journey.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel is a member of Imara Group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here with some One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent 64 One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured.  

Daniel has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and he has his hand raised in the photo.  He and the other farmers each receive ¼ acre of maize, ¼ acre of sorghum or millet, and an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Daniel is married and has six children.  He is 61 years old, and he is friendly, trustworthy, and active in his community. Daniel has been a farmer for 35 years.  He described his harvest as poor last year, buthe believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with the One Acre Fund.  

Daniel first enrolled in the One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Daniel joined One Acre Fund to learn new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to spread the word about the One Acre Fund.  

Daniel plans to use the money he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has many benefits.  Daniel’s own life was improved because he has more farm training. 

Daniel and his Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of buying the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the savings on to the farmers. 

Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they repay the One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, está acompañada  desde hace 37 años  y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos que ya no viven con ella y que han formado sus propios hogares, con ella viven 2 nietos los cuales estudian educación básica.

María se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene 20 años de realizar esta actividad, lo aprendió de sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde muy joven, además ella se dedica al comercio informal de frutas u otros productos que pueda vender, pero su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura y  la ganadería 

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar una vaca y para pagar alquiler del terreno donde cultivará esta temporada, el préstamo le ayudara a asegurar el lugar donde trabajará y además tendrá un bovino con lo que aprovechara el rastrojo y desperdicios de la agricultura, con las ganancias obtendrá el sustento de su familia  a través de la producción de leche y queso.

Sus sueños son tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando hasta que Dios quiera, luchar  para que su familia esté bien y siempre tener un lugar para trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She's been in a relationship for 37 years. Her partner is a farmer. She has four children who no longer live with her. They have formed their own households. Two school-aged grandchildren live with her. 

María works in agriculture and cattle raising. She has done this for 20 years. She learned these skills from her parents who taught her from a very young age. In addition, she sells fruits and other products through informal sales. Her main source of income is farming and cattle raising. 

She needs this loan to purchase a cow and to pay rent for the plot where she farms this season. This loan will help to secure the place where she works. In addition, it will help obtain the cattle which will take advantage of the stover and waste from the farm. With the profits, she will earn food for her family through the production of milk and cheese. 

Her dream is to have an opportunity to continue working until God wills, strive for her family to be well and always have a place to work and move ahead.

loans.use: purchase a cow and pay rent for the plot where she works this season.

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanamaqui Group

texts.es: El grupo “VIRGEN DE CHAPI DE YANAMAQUI” está conformada por 11 socias quienes se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio minorista. Elizabeth tiene 46 años es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella se dedica al cultivo de de frutas  para luego expenderlos a los mercados mayoristas. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas gaseosas en el quiosco de un colegio. Ella en el grupo cumple la función de tesorera. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Elizabeth es la primera persona sentado del lado izquierdo viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Chapi de Yanamaqui” communal bank is made up of 11 members who make a living in agriculture and retail. Elizabeth, 46, has a live-in partner and two children whom she is educating. She makes a living cultivating fruit, to later sell it in the wholesale markets. Years ago she made a living selling candy and soda in the kiosk at a school. 

She serves as the treasurer of the group. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers to improve the quality of her crops. The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the loan offered. Elizabeth is the first person seated on the left side of the picture, in a red shirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get seasonal children's clothing to increase sales

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 25 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador que se preocupa para que su familia tenga las condiciones adecuadas para vivir, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica al comercio de mariscos y tienen una hija de 2 años. 

Ramón se dedica al trabajo de la pesca, en el cual tiene 4 años de realizar esta actividad, ya que es una de las fuentes de ingresos más fuertes que tienen los habitantes de la zona costera. Esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su padre, quien desde muy pequeño lo llevaba a pescar. También desde hace 2 años está trabajando en el comercio, con una tienda que también le genera ingresos para su familia, decidió emprender esta actividad al ver que donde vive no existía una tienda cercana y los habitantes tenían que caminar mucho para comprar, hoy en día le va muy bien en el negocio.

El préstamo que Ramón está solicitando será invertido para pagar unos productos que ha estado tomando al crédito, de esta manera podrá invertir sin tomar mercadería al crédito, comprará productos como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sardinas, papel higiénico, sopas instantáneas, etc. Además invertirá en la construcción de unas ramadas para lo cual comprará madera y palma, y así fomentará el turismo a la orilla de la playa

Uno de sus propósitos a futuro es poder tener una vivienda propia y segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Ramón, 25, is a hardworking young man who concerns himself with giving his family adequate living conditions. He is married and his wife sells shellfish. They have a two-year-old daughter.

Ramon has been a fisherman for four years, which is one of the major sources of income for people in the coastal area where he lives. He learned it from his father, who took him out fishing from a very young age.

He has also been working as a merchant for two years, with a store that generates additional income for his family. He decided to open the store because there wasn't one near where he lived and the locals had to walk a long way to buy things. The business is going very well.

He asks for a loan to pay for some products that he has been buying on credit, so that he can buy without having to take out more credit. He will purchase products like beans, rice, sugar, sardines, toilet paper, instant soups, etc. He will also construct a shelter, for which he will buy wood and palm fronds, so that he can increase tourism near the beach.

One of his dreams for the future is to own a safe home for his family.

loans.use: to pay for some products that he has been buying on credit; and also to purchase beans, rice, sugar, sardines, toilet paper, instant soups; and to build a shelter made of branches.

loans.name: Munar

texts.ru: Мунар 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Мунар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мунар занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мунар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 6 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мунар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Munar is 32 years old, married, and has four children with her spouse. Munar has a high school education, and to provide the primary income for her family she raises livestock, which she started 12 years ago with the purchase of 15,000 som (KGS) of animals. Thanks to Munar's tireless work today she owns a milk cow, two calves, six sheep, and a horse. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Munar came to Bai-Tushum for a loan to buy calves to increase her herd. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further growing her herd of livestock, and also plans to save money for her children's further education.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Dulali

texts.en:
Dulali is 50 years old and lives with her husband Akhil, 61 years old, and their only son. She received an education up to class VI (Grade 6) and her husband received an education up to class VII (Grade 7). Their son has been deprived of an education due to their monetary problem. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district in their Kaccha (made of mud and straw) house. 

Her husband’s clothing business is not good enough to support a decent lifestyle. For that reason, she would like to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a good quantity of clothes and expand his business to meet his customers' need. The profits generated from this business will be used to build up their savings and upgrade their financial condition. Her dream is to build a shop of her own in the local market in order to expand their business because it is a very profitable business in their locality.

Dulali is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva as well.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing from the wholesale market to sell

loans.name: Oert's Group

texts.en:
Oert is 38 years old and lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of  the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of five children. She has been working as a rice farmer for 17 years to earn a living. She also supplements her income by working for others, for a fee. She can earn about 10,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Oert is with VisionFund just for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Oert is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn more income. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise in order to earn more income

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José tiene 61 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos, actualmente está acompañado y tiene un hijo que ya se casó el cual ya no vive con él desde hace muchos años, con José solo vive un nieto que estudia bachillerato y su esposa.

José se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, sus padres le inculcaron la siembra de maíz, hoy en día él cultiva 2 hectáreas de tierra, la cual alquila cada año en los meses de enero o febrero para ir preparándola para la siembra, él se levanta muy temprano para estar pendiente de la cosecha.

El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para invertir en la siembra de una hectárea de maíz, ya que un amigo suyo se la alquilará este año y los fondos que José posee no le alcanzan para cultivar esa otra hectárea y él sabe perfectamente que solo lo logrará con la ayuda del crédito y con la ganancia espera pagar los estudios de su nieto.

Él sueña con que su nieto logre graduarse del bachillerato sin ningún problema ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad cuando era joven, y desea que logre superarse.
texts.en:
José, 61, didn't have a chance to go to school because his parents didn't have the money. He is married and has a grown son who hasn't lived with him for many years. Jose does have a grandson in high school who lives with him and his wife.

Jose has worked in agriculture since he was very young. His parents taught him to plant corn, and today he cultivates two hectares of land that he rents every year in January and February to prepare for the planting. He rises very early to be prepared for the harvest.

He is asking for a loan to pay for the planting of one hectare of corn, since a friend of his will rent to him this year and Jose doesn't have enough money to plant both hectares. He knows that the only way that he can do it is with the help of a loan. With the profits he hopes to pay for his grandson's schooling. He dreams of seeing his grandson graduate from high school without problems because he didn't have this opportunity as a young man, and he wishes that his grandson will achieve this.

loans.use: to plant a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 40-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Jagabandhu and three children in a small mud house in Dhupguri, Jiapaiguri district.  All of her children go to school and are studying in different grades, whereas she and her husband are illiterate and only know how to sign their names. By profession, her husband is a farmer. He grows different kinds of vegetables and crops in his own land and sells them in the local market.

Gita now decided to cultivate mustard on her own land because there is a great demand for mustard in her locality. Moreover, from this crop, she will be able to produce mustard oil, which is very essential to all the villagers. When she came to know about BJS (Kiva’s Partner), she applied for a loan to cultivate mustard on her own land. She hopes that she can upgrade her family’s financial condition with the profit generated from the mustard cultivation. She dreams of making a pakka house (concrete) with the profit she will earn on her own.

Gita is greatly thankful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate mustard

loans.name: Sineang

texts.en:
Sineang, 32, is married with two children. She lives in a rural village of the Tbung Khmum district of the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s needs, she has been involved in rice farming and cassava growing for 14 years. Sometimes, she also works for others, for a fee. The current business earns her approximately $7 USD per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sineang received her first loan with VisionFund one cycle ago. She has successfully used her previous loan to better support her family. She is now applying for a loan to buy chickens to raise, in order to earn additional income and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will help her earn more income so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicken to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants for the season.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a 29-year-old woman from Dhupguri. Pratima and her husband started their business with a small amount of money provided by her husband.

She lives with her only daughter in their own kaccha (made of straw & mud) house in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She has received little education due to poverty, but she is very much interested in her daughter’s education. She desires that her daughter get a proper education. She needs a lot of money to meet the household expenses and the educational expenses of her daughter. As such, she cannot extend her business due to the lack of money. Now she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more garments like saris (Indian women's dress), frocks, and shirts from the wholesale market to sell locally. This business is profitable and is in great demand in their local market.

She hopes the profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her child’s education.

Pratima is thankful for the financial assistance she received from BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase garments from the wholesale market to sell

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her husband and two, school-age children in the village of Shaqe in the region of Syuniq. Due to severe climate in the region, people in this area are mostly involved in animal husbandry and land cultivation. Gayane is as well. Her husband is an army officer and is rarely at home. So, Gayane has to take care of the children and household alone. She keeps cows, sheep, and chickens and cultivates wheat, emmer wheat (farro), potato, and grass as forage for the livestock. In the small orchard that Gayane owns, she also grows nut, apple, and pear trees.
 
Now, this hardworking woman asks for financial support to improve her cultivation process. The loan of 1,500 USD will enable her to purchase wheat and emmer wheat (farro) seeds, fuel, and fertilizer, which will help her to improve her cultivation process. She will wait for support from lenders.

loans.use: to pay for wheat and emmer wheat seeds, fuel, and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Ее зовут Гулнисо. Ей 61 год. Она замужем. Ее муж пенсионер. Гулнисо вырастила шестерых детей. Два старших сына находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Гулнисо, как и большинство жителей Таджикистана, занимается животноводством. Она в течение многих лет держит дома скотин. Гулнисо каждое утро просыпаясь, идет на скотный двор, чтобы кормить и поить скотов, так начинается день для Гулнисо. На сегодняшний день у нее имеется малое количество скота и Гулнисо решила в серьез заняться животноводством. Она намерена на деньги от кредита купить несколько скотин и дома, в коровнике выращивать крупнорогатых скотов. Она надеется, что с Вашей помощью ей удастся совершить задуманное.
texts.en:
Her name is Gulniso. She is 61 years old. She is married and her husband is retired. Gulniso raised six children. Two of the older sons are working abroad in the Russian Federation. Gulniso, like the majority of residents of Tajikistan, is engaged in animal husbandry. Over the course of many years, she has cared for livestock at her home. Every morning, Gulniso wakes up, goes to the cattle yard in order to feed and milk the cows--this is how the day begins for Gulniso.

Currently, she has a small number of cattle and Gulniso decided to seriously engage in raising livestock. She intends with the money from the loan to buy several cattle and in the barn by her home to raise them. She hopes that with help she will be able to carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a 35-year-old housewife from Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri District. She is married to Mukunda who is 39 years old and they have two children. She has received a higher secondary education while her husband is illiterate and can sign his name only. Her husband is a farmer who farms many kinds of vegetables and sells them in the local market. 

Pratima desires to start cultivation of potatoes on her own land and sell those potatoes in the local market. She has given preference to this business because potato cultivation is a very profitable job in her area. She wishes to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She has a kacha house (house made of mud, straw, bamboo etc). In the future, she dreams of building a beautiful concrete house with the profits from her potato business so that she can live happily with her family.

She sincerely thanks Kiva and BJS for the support.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for two cows, forage for her livestock, and fuel for improving her cultivation process

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: La señora Celestina tiene 44 años, casada con tres hijos que tienen la edad de 10, 8  y 14 años ella se dedica a la venta de comida tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, La señora Celestina  va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que la señora Celestina tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Celestina is 44 years old. She is married and has three children who are 10, 8, and 14 years old. Her work is selling food. She has a food stall located in the town of Sacaba. This loan is the first she’s had with this institution. Celestina will use the loan to finish installing running water in her home. She currently only has a well and it’s a lot of work to carry around the water, so she will build a connection to the bathrooms, shower, and kitchen. This way she will provide improved comfort to her family since, for many reasons, the area doesn’t have basic services, but this won’t prevent Celestina from having running water in her house. She feels very happy about the opportunity she is being provided so she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish installing running water in her house.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. Zamira is a very hardworking woman. She began her own business 15 years ago. Zamira has been busy with growing potatoes and other crops. She has great experience in this field. Zamira grows potatoes on her own land. Her husband and children help her with managing her business. Zamira sows potatoes every season. She needs money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ramiro Abel

texts.es:
Ramiro de 19 años de edad, es soltero y se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Mecánica Automotriz. Decidió estudiar esta carrera porque sintió interés y porque cree que da mayores ingresos y actualmente se encuentra trabajando en el rubro de su carrera. Actualmente está cursando el quinto ciclo, le falta medio año para terminar su carrera técnica y se siente muy orgulloso por ello. Su objetivo para cuando termine de estudiar es emprender una empresa de automotores, reparando y acondicionando todo tipo de motores como de autos y motos. Él utilizó el préstamo en la compra de una laptop la cual le ayudará bastante a llevar a cabo sus tareas que le dejan en su Centro de estudios.
Ramiro se siente muy alegre y a la vez muy satisfecho por haber conseguido el préstamo, ya que ahora podrá realizar sus trabajos en su domicilio sin la necesidad de ir a una cabina de internet. Su mayor sueño en la vida es terminar de estudiar y continuar estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Automotriz ya en una Universidad. Uno de los mayores obstáculos que ha tenido hasta el momento ha sido el no poder contar con solvencia económica ya que esta carrera contiene muchos gastos y cosas por comprar y así se pueda desenvolver con dinamismo haciendo sus prácticas pre-profesionales. Ramiro se siente muy contento y feliz al saber que personas de todo el mundo están financiando el préstamo, y a quienes también les da las gracias por esa gran oportunidad y apoyo que está recibiendo, ya que esto facilitará a que él pueda terminar de estudiar su carrera profesional.
texts.en: Ramiro is 19 years old. He is single and he is currently studying for a degree as an auto mechanic. He decided to study this field because he was interested in it, he thinks it will bring him higher earnings, and his present job is in the same field as his degree. Right now he is completing his 5th semester. A half year remains for him to complete his technical degree and he is very proud of this. His goal for when he completes his studies is to start an auto repair and renovation business for all types of motor vehicles and motorcycles. He is using the loan to purchase a laptop that will help him to complete his homework that he is assigned from his study center. Ramiro is very happy and very satisfied that he has received this loan because now he will be able to complete his homework in his room without having to go to an internet booth. His biggest dream in life is to complete his degree and to then to study for a degree in automotive engineering from a university. One of the biggest obstacles that he has faced up to this point has been an inability to maintain economic solvency because this degree requires a lot of expenses and items to purchase so that students can develop dynamically during their pre-professional training. Ramiro is very content and happy knowing that people from around the world are financing this loan. He is also very thankful for this great opportunity and the support that he is receiving because this will facilitate the completion of his studies for this professional degree.

loans.use: to purchase materials for school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and start a new business

loans.name: Jetina's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 9 group-leader farmers in the district of Kakamega North. Jetina has been selected as the Kiva representative.  Jetina has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 100 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Jetina is 63 years old and has been a farmer for 23 years. Jetina works as a farmer to provide for her 9 children. The community and other farmers know Jetina as hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, participating in groups such as the women's group and savings group. Jetina is also involved in the community as the chairperson for a merry-go-round.  Jetina described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better harvest with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Jetina joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and will continue working with One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in her community, Jetina also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers.  Jetina plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training and is able to feed the family.

Jetina and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en: Muslima was born in 1970. She is married and has four children. She is a careful mother to her children. Her husband is a welder. Muslima has a big family. In order to provide for such big family, she needs to make a lot of money. So, Muslima began her own business, a beauty salon, 7 months ago. She also provides rental wedding dresses for fiancées. She is going to develop her business to maximize profit. Muslima is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy wedding dresses to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses to increase her working capital

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is a resident of the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 45 years old and is married with two children. 

To make a living, Lim operates a rice farm and grows cassava. Having been in this business for 9 years, she is able to earn about 26,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. 

This is Lim's fourth loan with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the past loans, and now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. 

She hopes to get more income from her agribusiness to earn a good living.
